column1: Thursday Apple Rumors: All 2017 iPhones Will Keep Lightning Ports;3/2/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsLeading theApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) rumor mill today is news of iPhone 8 charging details. Today
column3: we'll look at that and otherApple Rumorsfor ThursdaymakeArticleAd();iPhone 8 Charging:A new rumor claims that Apple will continue to use its Lightning ports on all 2017 iPhone devices
column4: reportsMacRumors. According to this rumor
column5: the tech company won't switch to the USB-C port with the release of the iPhone 8. However
column6: it also claims that the new smartphones will allow for fast charging by incorporating USB-C power delivery technology into the Lightning port. This rumor also says that AAPL may introduce an L-shaped battery with the iPhone 8. The source of this rumor is KGI Securities analyst Ming-Chi Kuo.Oculus Rift:Owners of the Oculus Rift VR headset still aren't likely to see Mac support in the near future
column7: Tech Crunchnotes. Nate Mitchell
column8: co-founder of Oculus
column9: says that Rift support on the Mac is ""near and dear to my heart."" However
column10: he notes that the company isn't quite ready to add support for Apple's computers. Mitchell also says that adding support isn't even on the company's road map for the next six months.Pencil Storage:Apple has filed patents for ways to store the Pencil stylus when not in use
column11: reportsAppleInsider. The basic idea behind this patent is that cases for the iPad Pro would include loops that allow owners to store the Pencil when not in use. These loops would also be able to fold in under the tablet when not storing the Pencil for a neater appearance. Another image shows a possible magnet system that may hold the loop and allow it slide out from the case. The patent describes using a stretchable material for the loop.Check out more recentApple RumorsorSubscribe to Apple Rumors:RSSThe postThursday Apple Rumors: All 2017 iPhones Will Keep Lightning Portsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: The Nike Inc (NKE) Stock Dividend Is a Slam Dunk;3/2/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI have been a big backer ofStarbucks Corporation(NASDAQ:SBUX) for a number of years. The company's strong leadership
column3: impressive growth and iconic brand were all attractive. The dividendwas another motive. Management's focus has led to years of double-digit growth. That's why I'm kicking myself for missing one very similar stock:Nike Inc(NYSE:NKE).makeArticleAd();Source:Alessio Jacona via FlickrSBUX stock and NKE stock have essentially mirrored each other over the past five years. I have worn the dunce cap more than once trying to pick growth stocks
column4: value stocks and special-situation plays.But the one area I've excelled in? PickingFuture Blue Chipstocks.I may have passed on NKE stock over the years
column5: but that is no longer the case. Thankfully
column6: the stock has been under pressure. Long-term investors focused on the business and dividend now have time to buy. Long pauses and notable pullbacks are welcomed in high-quality stocks.Is Nike stock high-quality? You bet.The Positives for NKE StockOne could argue that a price-to-earnings ratio of 25.5 is still a bit expensive. But one could also point out that this is near the low-end of Nike's five-year range
column7: as shown below:Valuation is a consideration for me
column8: but it is not the most important factor in the game. I care about the long-term business. I care that there's a long runway to its success and that when the growth does eventually slow
column9: that there will be a continual flow of income
column10: both for the business and into my pockets.7 Stocks That Will Hit All-Time Highs in 2017On that note
column11: Nike stock yields just 1.3%. But
column12: its dividend has been growing by double-digits for basically the past 10 years. I say basically because Nike ""only"" raised its dividend by 9.7% in 2009. It's noteworthy that NKE not only continued to pay a dividend through the financial crisis
column13: but also continued raising said payout.Year Quarterly Dividend Growth 2012 $0.09 15.4% 2013 0.10 11.1% 2014 0.12 20% 2015 0.14 16.7% 2016 0.16 14.3% 2017 0.18 12.5%While Nike's dividend growth has been slowing over the past few years
column14: the hope is that it will continue at a double-digit pace. A big part of selecting Future Blue Chip stocks is the company's focus on dividend growth. Combined with reasonable sales and earnings growth
column15: the dividend acts as the third catalyst in a 1-2-3 punch.The Negatives for NKE StockThat said
column16: what if Nike cannot grow at its predicted pace? Then it would certainly will be viewed as overvalued down the stretch.For a look at what happens when sales and earnings slow more than expected
column17: look no further thanUnderArmour Inc(NYSE:UA) (NYSE:UAA). Despite being a high-quality sports apparel manufacturer
column18: UAA stock has been decimated.Nike's high single-digit sales growth expected for this year and next year is good
column19: but not necessarily great. It makes me wonder if the company's original goal of $50 billion in revenue in 2020 is indeed achievable
column20: especially with increased competition fromAdidas AG (ADR)(OTCMKTS:ADDYY) and UA. According to E*Trade
column21: analysts currently expect NKE to generate $46.3 billion in sales in 2020.Additionally
column22: Nike has missed on sales expectations in three of the past five quarters and on four of the past eight. Notably though
column23: it has beat EPS estimates for at least 12 straight quarters.Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Is Moving Markets - LiterallyOne additional concern is Trump's stance on imports. Apparel companies are notorious for producing overseas at low rates and importing those products into the U.S. to distribute. If a border tax hits NKE stock
column24: it's not clear how it could impact the business
column25: but it's unlikely to be a positive.The Bottom Line for NikeI don't expect the president to push for import tariffs that will wildly punish Nike stock overnight. While it's possible
column26: we also have to consider the benefit NKE should receive from lower taxes (although itseffective tax ratein fiscal 2016 was only 18.7%).Nike may ultimately fall a bit short of its lofty goals. But it's unlikely the king of athletic apparel will give up the throne any time soon. UA's products are good
column27: but the two companies can co-exist in today's world. Plus
column28: it's hard to picture Nike falling into second place.Given Nike's double-digit earnings and dividend growth
column29: I think this is a noteworthy long-term stock for investors who have time and patience to see it continually grow into a better and better investment.With any luck
column30: a pullback will knock NKE stock back down
column31: giving investors a better buying opportunity.As of this writing
column32: Bret Kenwell held a long position in SBUX and NKE.More From InvestorPlaceSnapchat IPO: Lofty Snap Inc (SNAP) Walks on EggshellsWall Street Is Finally Bailing on Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) StockThe 7 Best ETFs for Market-Beating ReturnsThe postThe Nike Inc (NKE) Stock Dividend Is a Slam Dunkappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Is Moving Markets – Literally;3/2/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIt's been a strong - and long-awaited - run forApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) stock. AAPL stock is up 19% year-to-date as of this writing
column3: and has gained by about one-third since the U.S. presidential election. Apple stock struggled for some time
column4: hitting an 18-month low below $90 in May. But clearly investor sentiment has turned.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockOf course
column5: overall investor sentiment has improved as well. Broad markets have strengthened in 2017 and since the election. TheDow Jones Industrial Average- as imperfect a measurement as it is - cleared 21
column6: 000 on Wednesday. But AAPL stock itself has been a major driver of those broad market gains.Just how much Apple stock - and
column7: to a lesser extent
column8: issues of other titans such asAmazon.com
column9: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) - has moved those indices might surprise you.How Apple Stock Impacts the S&P 500The S&P500is up 6.9% year-to-date as of this writing. That index consists of the 500 most important stocks in the U.S. market (not necessarily the largest)
column10: and comprises 70%-80% of total U.S. market capitalization
column11: according to Standard & Poor's itself.It would thus seem that AAPL on its own couldn't move the index all that much. After all
column12: 1 out of 500 is a small fraction
column13: even as big as Apple is. Yet Apple stock still drives about 3.6% of the index's returns.Snapchat IPO: Lofty Snap Inc (SNAP) Walks on EggshellsGiven a 19% YTD return
column14: then
column15: Apple alone has pushed the S&P 500 higher by about 0.69% in just two months. Fully one-tenth of the broad market index's growth has comejust from AAPL.And Apple isn't the only large-cap driver. AMZN stock
column16: now up 9% for the year
column17: has added 0.2 points
column18: or 3%
column19: of the index's growth. The three largest financials in the index -JPMorgan Chase & Co.(NYSE:JPM)
column20: Wells Fargo & Co(NYSE:WFC) andBank of America Corp(NYSE:BAC) - have added roughly 7% of the S&P 500's performance so far in 2017.In other words
column21: roughly 20% of the broad market's gains in 2017 from come just from five major stocks. And the figure since the election is actually above one-quarter
column22: with the three major financials creating 15% of the S&P's 12%-plus post-election gains.That's not to say that market strength is a mirage. Fully three-quarters of S&P 500 stocks are positive in 2017 as of this writing. But it has been a more top-heavy market than usual - and the impact of Apple stock
column23: in particular
column24: is even higher in other well-known indexes.AAPL and the Dow Jones Industrial AverageThe DJIA is different from most other indices in that it's weighted by price
column25: not market value. The most heavily weighted component in the Dow isGoldman Sachs Group Inc(NYSE:GS)
column26: because its stock price is over $250. The least important Dow Jones component isGeneral Electric Company(NYSE:GE)
column27: trading just above $30.Yes
column28: it's weird.That means Apple stock actually has the seventh-highest weighting in the DJIA. (AMZN isn't even excluded
column29: because of its $800-plus handle.) But Apple's strong gains still mean that it has driven over 12% of the Dow Jones' year-to-date  increase.Apple isn't alone in driving the index.Boeing Co(NYSE:BA) has added another 12%
column30: GS roughly 9% and JPM another 8%. Again
column31: the gains are somewhat concentrated; over 40% of the Dow's year-to-date increase is coming from just these four stocks.Still
column32: like in the S&P 500
column33: the gains are broad-based. Only four Dow components are in the red in 2017
column34: including the two energy issues.Exxon Mobil Corporation(NYSE:XOM) andChevron Corporation(NYSE:CVX) both have declined in 2017. But the 7% increase YTD has come in large part from just a few stocks - and
column35: like the S&P 500
column36: the same is true since November.Apple and the Nasdaq-100The Nasdaq-100 is a tech titan-heavy index. Thus
column37: it should be no surprise that AAPL stock has a major weighting in the index. Apple represents almost 12% of the Nasdaq-100 - the year's best-performing major index so far
column38: with an increase just under 11%.Apple stock has been the major driver
column39: accounting for over 20% of that growth.Facebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) has added another 9%
column40: as has AMZN.7 Stocks That Will Hit All-Time Highs in 2017Some 40% of the index's YTD gains have come from those three stocks. And they haven't had as much help from their fellow tech titans.Alphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) andMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) actually have lagged the Nasdaq-100 so far this year. That might be a good thing if those stocks pick up the pace - but it does leave the index somewhat reliant on just a few key issues.Of course
column41: that's the nature of the Nasdaq-100
column42: relative to the S&P 500 in particular
column43: which has more stocks and a broader mandate.But no matter the index
column44: Apple stock is important. And that just shows how embedded it is in the U.S. investing world. Pretty much every index has significant exposure to AAPL - which means that most diversified investors own Apple in some way
column45: shape or form.The strength in the broad markets in 2017 hasn't come solely from AAPL stock - but it has helped. And long investors - even those who don't own Apple shares directly - should be rooting for Apple to keep climbing.The author has no direct positions in any securities mentioned … but like most investors does own index funds which include securities mentioned
column46: including AAPL.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best Stocks to Buy and Hold ForeverHow to Handle Red-Hot Advanced Micro Devices

column1: How the Dogs of the Dow Are Faring in the Market Rally;3/2/2017;"TheDow Jones Industrials(DJINDICES: ^DJI) have been on fire so far in 2017
column2: setting new   all-time records on more than a dozen occasions in the first two   months of the year and climbing above the 21
column3: 000 level for the   first time on March 1. Yet rather than investing in the entire   Dow
column4: some dividend investors follow a strategy known as the Dogs   of the Dow
column5: which involves picking just a handful of the   components that make up the venerable average. Two months in and   after a huge rally
column6: now's a good time to check in and see how the   Dogs of the Dow are faring and what explains their performance in   2017.How the Dogs of the Dow are faring in 2017To find out which stocks make up the Dogs of the Dow
column7: you just   have to do one simple thing. Pick the 10 stocks as of the end of   2016 that had the highest dividend yields
column8: and then buy shares of   them in equal dollar amounts. Then
column9: hold onto all 10 stocks   throughout the year.So far in 2017
column10: the Dogs of the Dow are lagging slightly   behind the Dow overall. On average
column11: the Dogs are up 5%
column12: compared   to a nearly 7% return for the unmodified Dow.makeArticleAd();The biggest reason for the poor performance from the Dogs of   the Dow is that three of the 10 stocks the strategy tracks have   lost ground in 2017
column13: compared to just five overall for the Dow   30. The biggest loser has beenExxonMobil(NYSE: XOM)
column14: which has had to deal with renewed concerns about   whether the energy markets can keep clawing back more of the   ground that they lost during the plunge in crudeoil   pricesin 2015.Chevron(NYSE: CVX) has also produced year-to-date losses for similar   reasons. In addition
column15: Verizon(NYSE: VZ) has had to deal with new price-war considerations
column16: including the potential merger of its No. 3 and No. 4 rivals in   the U.S. wireless telecom industry
column17: and is also reacting   adversely to threats of higher interest rates.Another reason for underperformance is that the Dogs didn't   get to include the year's best performer so far.Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) has jumped more than 20%
column18: carrying forward   momentum from 2016 as investors have regained confidence in the   company's long-term prospects. Even though some investors worry   that a lack of innovative new products in Apple's visible   pipeline pose a long-term threat to the growth of the business
column19: the company has still been able to use the iPhone's success and   the loyalty toward its ecosystem to drive business.Don't count the Dogs outThat said
column20: the Dogs of the Dow have had their share of success   stories.Cisco SystemsandMerckhave risen by double-digit percentages
column21: but the most important   winner so far in 2017 has beenBoeing(NYSE: BA)
column22: which has climbed 18% since the beginning of the   year. Calls from the Trump administration to increase defense   spending have helped push the aerospace and defense giant higher
column23: and a strong commercial aerospace market continues to make   investors optimistic about Boeing. Yet even here
column24: the Dogs of the   Dow haven't benefited as much as the Dow 30
column25: because Boeing's   high share price has produced outsized gains for the average but   not for the equal-weighted Dogs.More importantly
column26: it's still early in the year. The Dogs of   the Dow tend to move in a manner similar to a value-based   strategy
column27: rewarding stocks that have lagged in the past. That's   very muchnotthe way that the stock market has acted lately
column28: instead riding   positive momentum from late 2016 and continuing to reward earlier   winners rather than creating a rotation of new gainers.In particular
column29: the Dogs include several stocks that could   benefit greatly from anticipated growth in certain sectors.Caterpillarin particular is well poised to boost its profits in North   America if construction and infrastructure activity rise going   forward. Pharmaceutical stocks have gotten hit hard recently
column30: but   if healthcare reform avoids major pressure to their profit
column31: then   the shares could rebound and help the Dogs to a greater extent   than they would the overall Dow 30.The Dogs of the Dow are lagging slightly behind the overall   Dow
column32: but that doesn't mean that the strategy is a bad one to use.   A lot can happen over the rest of 2017
column33: and you should watch   closely to see if the Dogs of the Dow can catch up and surpass   the Dow 30 in the months to come.10 stocks we like better than BoeingWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column34: it can pay to listen. After all
column35: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade

column37: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Boeing wasn't one of     them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even     better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

column1: Why Are These 2 Tech Titans Trading at a Huge Discount?;3/2/2017;"Sometimes Mr. Market gets confused and prices companies at a   premium or discount to their true value. While big companies such   asApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) andVerizon(NYSE: VZ) historically trade at a discount to the overall   market
column2: they're currently trading at an even deeper discount than   usual.Verizon's share price has mostly stood still while the market   continued to rally over the past year. Apple
column3: meanwhile
column4: is   trading around the same P/E ratio as it did at the beginning of   last year
column5: while the S&P 500 is trading 21% higher on a P/E   basis. Let's look at the numbers and see why both these tech   titans are trading at massive discounts.Wall Street might be missing something on these two. Image     source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Verizon's 15-year lowVerizon's P/E ratio for the trailing 12 months is a mere 15.5.   On a forward basis
column6: it's just 12.9. That compares with the   S&P 500's trailing P/E of 26.9. Verizon is trading at just   0.58 times the P/E ratio of the broader index. The last time it   was even below 0.65 was in 2002
column7: when the telecom industry   tanked
column8: according to analyst Craig Moffett of   MoffettNathanson.Historically
column9: Verizon trades for just an 11% discount. The 42%   discount it's trading at today represents a massive buying   opportunity for long-term value investors -- not to mention that   Verizon is also trading at a lower forward P/E compared withAT&T(NYSE: T)
column10: which trades for 14.3 times analysts' 2017 EPS   estimates.At the same time
column11: it's worth looking at why Mr. Market is   placing such a hefty discount on the wireless carrier.First and foremost
column12: the competition in the wireless industry   is increasingly fierce. Pressure fromT-Mobile(NASDAQ: TMUS) has finally gotten to Verizon
column13: putting pressure on   its pricing. Verizon recently introduced an unlimited-data plan   in an effort to compete with the value offered by T-Mobile's   plans. AT&T also bowed to the pressure
column14: opening its   unlimited-data plan to all customers and dropping the price.Image source: Verizon.However
column15: the strength of Verizon's wireless network and its   position on the leading edge of 5G network development give it a   significant competitive advantage over the long term.   Additionally
column16: its massive retail customer base -- the largest in   the U.S. wireless industry -- will continue to throw off cash for   its investments in its wireless network and digital advertising   and video. That should allow the stock to rise back up toward its   usual valuation levels over time.In the meantime
column17: investors can get a juicy 4.6% dividend for   their patience.Apple's recent run may be just the startShares of Apple have been on a tear over the last nine months
column18: increasing 46%. That significantly outpaces the 14% increase the   S&P 500 saw in the same period. But Apple was trading for a   35% discount on a P/E basis in 2015 and a 26% discount in   2016.The largest company in the market typically trades for a   discount to the S&P 500
column19: but not nearly as deep as Apple's.   Over the past 10 years
column20: the average discount for the largest   company by market cap was 16% to the S&P 500's P/E
column21: according   to BMO Capital's Tim Long. Apple shares traded near that level in   2012
column23: and 2014
column24: but the market hasn't caught up with the   explosion in earnings from the release of the iPhone 6 at the end   of 2014.Today
column25: Apple trades around a 25% discount to the S&P 500
column26: below that 16% baseline. While the market is down on Apple's slow   iPhone sales growth
column27: there are a few reasons to believe Apple's   earnings will continue to expand.The iPhone 7 Plus. Image source: AppleFirst of all
column28: the company continues to execute on its massive   capital returns program. Share buybacks will force earnings per   share to increase at a faster rate than net income.Second
column29: Apple's services business continues to grow at a   strong pace.Services revenue is higher margin than Apple's   core revenue.As such
column30: it has an outsize impact on Apple's profit growth.Investors looking for value have two great options with   Verizon and Apple. While the latter is trading at an all-time   high
column31: it still has room to run. Meanwhile
column32: Verizon is trading at   historic lows while maintaining strong competitive advantages
column33: indicating it should outpace the market from here.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Timeless Lessons From the 2017 DJCO Meeting – Part I;3/2/2017;"As we all know
column2: Warren Buffett andCharlie Munger(Trades
column3: Portfolio) hold theBerkshire Hathaway(NYSE:BRK.A)(NYSE:BRK.B) shareholder meeting in Omaha
column4: Nebraska
column5: every year. During the past two years there were more than 40
column6: 000 people who attended the meeting. Most people attend the Berkshire meeting as an annual pilgrimage as well as a get-together with fellow value investor friends.By contrast there were only about 400 people who attended theDaily Journal Corp.(DJCO) meeting
column7: or approximately 1% that of the Berkshire meeting. The DJCO meeting is also held in the middle of the week
column8: not the weekend. Therefore
column9: for those who are not in Los Angeles
column10: it is a very time-consuming effort. For me
column11: it is a rare opportunity to pay tribute to the great Charlie Munger as well as to connect with a very intelligent group of investors.This year marked my fourth time to participate in the Daily Journal shareholder meeting. All the questions were high quality. After the meeting
column12: Munger unexpectedly and generously stayed for an extra three hours to answer questions with a small group of cult members. Today I'd like to share a few observations and thoughts from the 2017 DJCO meeting.makeArticleAd();First of all
column13: and this is almost the theme of this year's meeting
column14: Munger repeatedly stressed the importance of deferred gratification. For most people
column15: deferred gratification is hard to practice but if you can
column16: your life will be different. Munger's success has a lot to do with deferred gratification. He cited a few examples. For instance
column17: China's success is largely through deferred gratification - when the Chinese were poor
column18: they managed to save half of the income to invest for the future. They rarely got a chance to enjoy anything
column19: but boy did that lead to the prosperity of hundreds of millions of Chinese.Another example of deferred gratification is how medical students eventually become doctors. We all know that in the U.S. it is a long journey to become a doctor - you have to work hard for many years to become one. Munger said that
column20: compared with derivatives traders
column21: he preferred to be associated with doctors.Below are a few direct quotes from Munger.""I lived my whole life with people who have deferred gratification; they don't have fun
column22: but they get wealthy. You end up with a lot of rich dead people - what good is that? But it does work. Your grave will look nice to outsiders and incite a lot of envy.""""I have a different feeling than the rest of America. I wish we weren't producing all this natural gas. I'd be delighted to just have it lie there untapped for decades in the future and pay extra once Arabs use up their oil. Our reserves not going away are like retaining the topsoil of Iowa. You wouldn't ship the topsoil to Greenland. There's not enough deferred gratification to sell our oil. Same for chemical feedstocks - use them slowly. I am sure I am right and the other 99% of the people are wrong. Nobody else in America seems to feel my way
column23: but I believe in deferred gratification.""One good thing about what we're doing is that it's slow
column24: but once you succeed it's very sticky business
column25: and the fact that it's difficult to do means it's difficult for people to change much - if you slog through
column26: it's a big market and the people have no option but to charge ahead - the fact that's it's so awful to grind through means people may not want to get in.""Second
column27: Buffett and Munger are exceptionally rational and adaptive. We all know that Munger gave a speech on human psychological misjudgments. One of the misjudgments is commitment and consistency bias. It is our nature to adhere to our pre-established view and if we shout it out in public
column28: we pound it in. Over the past few decades
column29: Buffett and Munger have consistently expressed the view that the airlines have the worst business model and that technology stocks are outside their circle of competency. But when the situation changed
column30: they changed their point of view by investing heavily in airlines and technology stocks such asApple(AAPL) andIBM(IBM).What's more admirable is how their view on airlines and Apple changed. The ideas were brought by Ted Weschler and Todd Combs. They were able to convince Buffett and Munger to take another look at the airlines and Apple from another angle and they did. Munger also said that the investment in airlines is not a cinch but when the competitive environment has changed
column31: they made a decision to adapt.""If you're in a game and learning more and honing skills
column32: of course you do better over time. Berkshire would be a very modest company if Warren never learned anything. We went out and bought whole entire businesses - something we'd not have done early on as stock investors. And Iscar at five times book value
column33: Ben Graham would've never bought that. We've learned better over time
column34: and we can keep learning and are still doing it. He's changed when he's buying airlines
column35: and he's changed when he's buying Apple. The nice thing about the game we're in is that we can keep learning. We're in the press for airline stocks when in 2013 we thought it was a joke
column36: it was such a terrible business. Today
column37: if you put all our holdings together
column38: we own a small airline. It violates the total catechism. It's the same thing for railroads scaring us away with all this trucking competition - it was a terrible business for 80 years
column39: and then we become a massive owner when they finally got it down to four main railroads. This morning I was with my daughter-in-law
column40: and she bought round-trip tickets to Europe for $400 with taxes - huh [aghast at how cheap it was]? Maybe we shouldn't be in the airline stocks. I frequently talk to Warren about the old days. We shot fish in a barrel. We even waited until they slowed down and used a shotgun. We get little edges now while before had total cinches. But it isn't any less interesting. We boughtExxonMobil(XOM) as a cash substitute - we thought it'd do a little better than cash at the time - but early on we never would've done that. Think what changed when we bought Apple with the hooting we've done about high tech. 'Apple and a bunch of airlines' is now a lead story about us in the press. But we're just adapting to a business that's gotten a lot more difficult. I don't think we've gone crazy. I think we're adapting. Now the odds are just a little in our favor. We'll take that advantage
column41: but it's harder. You marry the best person who will have you. Be satisfied with the type of advantage we didn't used to get
column42: caused by getting so enormously rich - it's not a bad trade-off.""Munger also emphasized the importance of patience and being prepared. The best opportunities are rare and transient so we have to be patient and be prepared to seize these opportunities. Munger gave us an inspiring example. He had been reading Barron's magazine for more than 50 years and only found one good idea from Barron's articles. It was a ridiculously cheap auto parts company. Munger bought the junk bond as well as the common stock at the cost of about $1 a share. He held for a few years and sold them at $15 per share for a total of profit of $80 million. And then he met Li Lu and thought Li Lu was very unusual. Li Lu also only invested in China
column43: which is a much less efficient market. Munger gave Li Lu the $80 million profits he made from the auto parts company and Li Lu turned this into $400 million. Essentially through two investments
column44: Munger turned a few million into $400 million. This example illustrates the importance of patience
column45: deferred gratification and concentration.More to come in my next article.Start afree seven-day trialof Premium Membership to GuruFocus.Premium MembersThis article first appeared onGuruFocus."

column1: Wal-Mart Stores Inc (WMT) Criticizes Border Tax
column2: And Rightfully So;3/2/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTheDow Jones Industrial Averagetoppled another milestone Wednesday
column4: breaching 21
column5: 000. One reason markets have continued to hit new highs is the expectation that President Donald Trump will soon unveil a plan for lower taxes on both corporations and consumers
column6: which comes with a caveat that would hurtWal-Mart Stores Inc(NYSE:WMT)
column7: among other retailers.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart via FlickrTreasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin told reporters last week- includingMaria Bartiromo
column8: my colleague at Fox Business - that tax reform is the primary objective.While the plan is heavily anticipated throughout the market
column9: one large aspect of it has the retail industry on edge: the border-adjustment tax.The president has hinted that corporate taxes will favor U.S. exporters over importers
column10: and earlier this month it was announced that more than 100 retail companies had joined a coalition against a border-adjustment tax that would affect imports from other countries while leaving exports untouched.The group is called Americans for Affordable Products
column11: and Walmart
column12: Target Corporation(NYSE:TGT) andBest Buy Co Inc(NYSE:BBY) are among its most notable participants.The 3 Best Oil Stocks to Buy for Retirement InvestorsWhat This Means for WMT StockConsidering approximately 97% of all clothing and shoes sold in the United States are imported
column13: it's no surprise that Walmart is critical of a border-adjustment tax. CFO Brett Biggs said""anything that would potentially raise prices for our customers in the U.S. is a concern for us.""Should any such tax come to fruition
column14: the company would be forced to either eat the increased costs or pass them on to consumers.Biggs' comments came just after the company reported its fourth-quarter earnings results. Comparable store sales grew 1.8%
column15: the strongest growth since July 2012 and tenth consecutive month of year-to-year improvement. Revenue guidance for the current quarter and fiscal year were above consensus and e-commerce sales grew 29%. A lot of the headlines focused on that along with the Jet.com acquisition
column16: but it's also worth noting that the brick-and-mortar side of the business sans groceries seems to have found equilibrium as well.In the end
column17: Walmart has displayed the kind of nimbleness many
column18: including myself
column19: weren't sure it was capable of
column20: after having things so good for so long. There are still issues with proper shelf stocking and having items people want versus those they don't
column21: but considering the devastating impact of food deflation and fading brick-and-mortar traffic
column22: WMT continues to execute well. Then there's its online presence
column23: which is growing rapidly
column24: but still has a long way to go from aesthetics to function.When it all comes down to it
column25: a border-adjustment tax is a tax on the middle class and businesses that already pay the highest ""effective"" tax rates in the nation. And when companies likeBoeing Co(NYSE:BA)
column26: General Electric Company(NYSE:GE) andCaterpillar Inc.(NYSE:CAT) - all of which have access to the Export-Import Bank - push for pressure on smaller retailers and even potential entrepreneurs
column27: it's extremely distressing.The good news is that many folks on Capitol Hill
column28: who are looking at smart economics above populism
column29: understand that this would be a disaster
column30: although there are smart economists out there (including several I admire) who like the idea and try to explain how adjustments in currency would mitigate harm to consumers.Why Apple Inc. (AAPL) Will Become a Trillion-Dollar CompanyI think Walmart protests too much
column31: but either way
column32: I suspect the border-adjustment tax is dead on arrival.As for WMT
column33: it has the potential to rally above $80 at some point this year. All that said
column34: I do want to add the caveat that if the border-adjustment tax does make it into law
column35: I would look to sell my retail stocks
column36: which would be unfortunate just as consumer spending is finally picking back up again.Curious what Wall Street insider Charles Payne really thinks?Get more behind-the-scenes insights
column37: valuable market research and hands-on guidance including live stock recommendations from Fox Business's rising star. Charles Payne'sSmart Talk is absolutely FREE for a limited-time only.Sign up today!More From InvestorPlace5 Top-Ranked Dividend Stocks to Buy in MarchThe 10 Best Stocks to Buy and Hold ForeverThe postWal-Mart Stores Inc (WMT) Criticizes Border Tax
column38: And Rightfully Soappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 3 Reasons Amazon.com
column2: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Will Keep Growing Like a Weed;3/2/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsE-commerce giantAmazon.com
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) has delivered returns of more than 60% to investors throughout the past year. With online shopping more popular than ever
column5: many investors may be questioning whether AMZN stock could still be a growth play.makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Seyfang via FlickrCome on.Amazon has rapidly increased sales each year
column6: and while that kind of expansion is more difficult to come by … no. Amazon's impressive growth isn't over yet. Nor are the breakneck gains in AMZN stock.Here are three reasons why.E-Commerce Is Just Getting StartedIt might seem like e-commerce has completely taken over the retail space as more and more stores abandon their brick-and-mortar formats and shift toward online selling. However
column7: data from the Census Bureaushows the industry is still in the early stages. In the fourth quarter of 2016
column8: e-commerce sales made up just 8.3% of total retail sales. So yes
column9: e-commerce is expanding rapidly
column10: but there's so
column11: so much room for companies like Amazon to expand.And AMZN is well-suited to grab this market share because it still continues to look for new ways to expand its offerings. Amazon has recently pushed its way into clothing
column12: food delivery
column13: flower delivery
column14: and even hand-made goods.The firm's dedication to becoming a one-stop shop for everything a person might shop for online is impressive and suggests that AMZN stock will continue to push forward.Growth in the CloudPerhaps the most compelling reason to put AMZN stock in the growth category is the firm's cloud computing arm
column15: Amazon Web Services (AWS).7 Stocks That Will Hit All-Time Highs in 2017Amazon has already established itself as the No. 1 player in the cloud computing market
column16: which itself is on its way to becoming a massive industry. The company's positioning bodes well for future growth.Amazon Web Services has been expanding exponentially on a yearly basis - the firm'sfourth-quarter resultsshowed that AWS sales were up 47% from a year earlier and $300 million from the quarter before. That is some jaw-dropping growth.AWS still only makes up about 8% of Amazon's overall revenue
column17: but it's a powder keg for profits thanks to its high-margin nature - exactly why some were worried aboutAWS' recent outage.Considering the low-margin nature of the rest of Amazon's businesses
column18: Amazon Web Services' growth is critical to AMZN stock.Brick-and-Mortar FootprintWhile it may seem counterintuitive
column19: brick-and-mortar retail is another place where AMZN could drive some big-time growth.Amazon is working to increase its physical presence with new store formats that allow customers to come in for a physical - but still unorthodox - shopping experience.One of AMZN's most promising brick-and-mortar ventures isAmazon Go- a physical store that boasts no lines and no checkouts.Customers download the Amazon Go app and then are free to enter the store and choose whatever items they want. Amazon has developed ""Just Walk Out Technology"" which is able to detect what products have been taken or returned to shelves. That means when customers are ready
column20: they can simply walk out of the store and their Amazon account will be charged.Amazon Go is still in the early stages
column21: but if it rolls out more broadly
column22: it could create a brand-new type of shopping experience.Why Apple Inc. (AAPL) May Have 1
column23: 000+ Engineers Working on ARE-commerce has caused many big-name stores to reduce their store footprints
column24: but Amazon is working from the other direction. Setting up shop in meaningful locations with specific formats could actually be a major for growth for AMZN stock.Bottom Line for AMZN StockAmazon has ingrained itself so deeply into the retail mindset that customers are increasingly turning to Amazon for all their household products. Not only that
column25: but Amazon has been quick to adapt as the market evolves
column26: putting the firm in a great position to continue delivering stellar growth well into the future.If you think the growth in AMZN stock is over
column27: think again.As of this writing
column28: Laura Hoy was long AMZN.More from InvestorPlaceForget Snap Inc (SNAP): Buy Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Instead!Catch Valeant Pharmaceuticals Intl Inc (VRX) Stock for Free7 Stocks to Buy That Are ALMOST in Buffett Buying RangeThe post3 Reasons Amazon.com
column29: Inc. (AMZN) Stock Will Keep Growing Like a Weedappeared first onInvestorPlace."

That project seemed to have been put on hold when AAPL and broadcasters couldn't reach an agreement on price.But Alphabet has just succeeded where Apple failed.YouTube TV - live TV from over 40 providers including the big networks for $35 per month - is now official.YouTube TV Takes on CableYouTube TVwas announced on Tuesday. Launching ""soon"" in the U.S.
column11: this is Google's skinny TV bundle for cord cutters. The four major networks are onboard. So isWalt Disney Co's(NYSE:DIS) ESPN

column18: this is pretty much what Apple has been struggling to release.YouTubeTV is Eerily Similar to Apple's Television PlansApple has to have been watching Google's YouTube TV announcement with dismay. Its rival beat it to the punch with the streaming TV bundle it had envisioned offering with the Apple TV.What makes it even more galling is how close YouTube TV is to what AAPL was negotiating.In May 2015
column19: AAPL andCBS Corporation(NYSE:CBS) were in talks about a subscription Apple television streaming service
column20: butmoney was reportedly a sticking point. In December of that year
column21: CBS CEO Les Moonves confirmed toBusiness Insiderthat his network had been in talks with Apple
column22: and were close to settling on a monthly price to charge consumers. Moonves was throwing around $35 - exactly the price that YouTube TV is charging.Apple balked. Apparently Google was waiting in the wings.Where Does This Leave AAPL and Its TV Strategy?At this point
column23: Apple's entire television strategy seems to be struggling.There was hope that the new Apple TV that launched in 2015 would come with a streaming TV bundle. That didn't happen. Now Apple's set-top streamer is suffering from disappointing sales. The box costs twice what Google andAmazon.com
column24: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) charge for their streamers
column25: but lacks the 4K support rivals offer.Last year
column26: AAPL was showing off anew TV appthat would serve as a hub for streaming content
column27: tracking use across multiple services and devices. But it failed to get buy-in fromNetflix
column28: Inc.(NASDAQ:NFLX)
column29: making its usefulness questionable.Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Could Break $1
column30: 000 If ...Google's YouTube TV launch is the icing on the cake.Where Can Apple Go From Here?Don't expect Apple to give up on its plans
column31: of course.The signs of a renewed push toward taking over your living room began last month. Applehired the former head of Amazon's Fire TVto take over as the head of marketing for Apple TV. This move has raised expectations that AAPL will revamp its Apple TV hardware. It also freed up the previous head of Apple TV to helplead Apple's efforts to sign content deals- something he had considerable experience in from his previous role as senior VP of content distribution atHulu.While YouTube TV offers a fixed content bundle

column33: Moonves says. If the company can accomplish that goal

column1: Berkshire Hathaway: Repurchase Limit Crosses $135 Per Share;3/1/2017;"In addition to the release ofWarren Buffett(Trades
column2: Portfolio)'s shareholder letter this past weekend
column3: Berkshire Hathaway(BRK.A) (BRK.B) reported full-year fiscal 2016 financial results as well - so let's dive in.Berkshire reported $24 billion in net income in 2016
column4: comparable to 2015. On 2.466 billion equivalent B shares
column5: that's equal to roughly $9.75 per share in 2016 reported earnings.I personally make a few adjustments to try and normalize these results. First
column6: I largely back out the roughly $6.7 billion in investment and derivatives gains included in net income (replaced by roughly $2.3 billion in income
column7: which is equal to ~50% of the trailing five-year average). Second
column8: I add back unreported earnings from the ""Big Five"" -The Coca-Cola Co.(KO)
column9: American Express(AXP)
column10: Wells Fargo(WFC)
column11: IBM(IBM) andApple(AAPL); by my math
column12: there was roughly $3.1 billion (aftertax) in unreported earnings from these five holdings (the Apple stake is adjusted to reflect the disclosures Buffett made Monday morning on CNBC). Finally
column13: I make a few other adjustments that I believe are reasonable (most notably an estimate of earnings power on the excess cash Berkshire holds and higher depreciation expense at BNSF to account for the real maintenance cost attributable to the railroad). All in
column14: my math estimates that Berkshire Hathaway's normalized earnings power is approaching $10 per B share.makeArticleAd();For the full year
column15: Berkshire generated $32.5 billion in cash flow from operations (a decade ago that number was ~$10 billion). Roughly $13 billion was reinvested in the business as capital expenditures with $5.1 billion and $3.8 billion spent at Berkshire Hathaway Energy and Burlington Northern Santa Fe. Another $31.4 billion was spent on acquisitions (largelyPrecision Castparts[PCP] but also $1.4 billion for bolt-on acquisitions). The net shortfall from these three buckets (roughly $12 billion) was covered by incremental long-term debt issued at low single-digit interest rates.Insurance businessesBerkshire's insurance businesses reported a pretax underwriting gain of ~$2.1 billion in 2016
column16: an increase of 16% from 2015. The gain was attributable to Berkshire Hathaway Reinsurance Group
column17: where underwriting income nearly doubled
column18: to $822 million. Within BHRG
column19: ""Retroactive Reinsurance"" losses declined from $469 million to $49 million. It's difficult to say anything meaningful based on headline changes in the reported reinsurance results from year to year. As an example
column20: the retroactive reinsurance agreement recently signed withAmerican International Group(AIG) - for which Berkshire received a premium of $10 billion- will generate $375 million in pretax deferred charge amortization losses for BHRG in 2017. Focusing only on the losses without considering the economics of the whole deal leads you to faulty conclusions.GEICO had another solid year of growth in 2016
column21: with earned premiums up 12%. For the year
column22: GEICO added nearly 1 million net auto policies in force (PIFs)
column23: compared to a net 700
column24: 000 additions in 2015. While the loss ratio increased in 2016
column25: pressuring profits
column26: this is a reasonable trade-off in the short term (it's worth noting that storm-related losses at GEICO increased by $260 million in 2016 as well). GEICO has a sustainable competitive advantage that becomes more powerful in an environment where consumers are increasingly cost conscious. Management has proven adept at managing the business for the long-term. GEICO will emerge from the industry's current challenges in a stronger position than it started.Berkshire Hathaway Primary Group continues to report solid numbers as well
column27: with earned premiums increasing to $6.3 billion in 2016 (up more than 40% from 2014). The combined ratio was just shy of 90%
column28: resulting in more than $650 million in pretax underwriting income.At the end of 2016
column29: the float attributable to Berkshire's insurance businesses exceeded $91 billion (compared to $70 billion five years). Inclusive of the AIG deal discussed a moment ago
column30: Berkshire's float exceeds $100 billion. In his letter
column31: Buffett restated his belief that a decline in float
column32: should it occur
column33: will be very gradual - ""at the outside no more than 3% per year.""Noninsurance businesses2016 was a tough year for rails generally and BNSF specifically
column34: with revenues falling 10% on comparable declines in volumes and average revenue per car. The coal business took a beating in 2016
column35: with volumes and revenues down 21% and 27%
column36: respectively; even after declining by more than one-quarter
column37: the coal business still accounted for ~17% of BNSF's revenues in 2016. The operating ratio increased in the face of sliding revenues (meaning lower operating margins)
column38: resulting in a 16% drop in earnings. 2016 was undoubtedly a struggle for BNSF; if guidance fromUnion Pacific(UNP) is any indication
column39: 2017 should be a step in the right direction.Berkshire Hathaway Energy reported $17.9 billion in 2016 revenues
column40: a low single-digit decline from 2015. A small increase in pretax income ended up as a 7% increase in aftertax profits
column41: partly attributable to a lower effective tax rate (down two points to 14%). There's plenty of room to run here: my research suggests production tax credits from wind-powered electricity generation will be a material tailwind to BHE's net income over the coming years (MidAmerican owns more wind-powered capacity than any other rate-regulated electric utility in the country).Berkshire's Manufacturing
column42: Service and Retailing (MSR) businesses reported ~$5.6 billion in earnings in 2016
column43: an increase of ~$1 billion versus the prior year (both measures exclude amortization of intangibles). The entirety of the gains came from the Manufacturing bucket due to the inclusion of Precision Castparts; pretax Manufacturing earnings declined in 2016 whenPrecision Castparts is backed out (largely due to a $365 million loss from the disposition of part of Lubrizol's business in the fourth quarter). MSR was also impacted by other one-time costs
column44: such as $110 million in acquisition/integration and transition costs from the Duracell deal.Finally
column45: Finance & Financial Products revenues increased 10% in 2016
column46: with earnings up 4%. Clayton Homes' reported a solid year
column47: selling more than 42
column48: 000 units (an impressive 25% increase from 2015). Strength in manufactured homes from Clayton offset less impressive results in the remainder of the business (notably at Marmon).ConclusionBook value increased by ~11% in 2016 to $115 per B share (trailing three-year CAGR of 8%). The repurchase authorization (up to 120% of book value) enables Buffett to buy back stock at ~$138 per B share. As he noted in the shareholder letter
column49: ""purchases at that level clearly bring an instant and material benefit to continuing shareholders"". Starting at ~$170 per share
column50: that would require a pullback of ~20%. Shares are reasonably valued at current levels.Berkshire's fortress balance sheet continues to offer significant optionality; at some unknown point in the future
column51: it will be used to create meaningful per-share value for investors. My favorite quote from Bufett's shareholder letter addressed this in a roundabout way:""Every decade or so
column52: dark clouds will fill the economic skies
column53: and they will briefly rain gold. When downpours of that sort occur
column54: it's imperative that we rush outdoors carrying washtubs
column55: not teaspoons. And that we will do.""Disclosure:Long BRK.B
column56: IBM and Union Pacific.Start a free seven-day trial of Premium Membership to GuruFocus.Premium MembersThis article first appeared onGuruFocus."

column1: 5 Best Performing Stocks of February;3/1/2017;"Markets set a blistering set of gains over the month with new milestones being created on a regular basis. Over the month increasingly evident that President Trump's policy proposals have gone down extremely well with investors. Additionally
column2: economic data continued to be largely encouraging while earnings numbers have been impressive
column3: lending a firm basis to the long-running market rally.February's PerformanceFor the month
column4: the Dow
column5: S&P 500 and Nasdaq rose 4.8%
column7: respectively after President Trump vowed to bring back millions of jobs to the U.S. Additionally
column8: optimism over Trump's proposed market-friendly policies including tax cuts
column9: financial de-regulation and increase in infrastructure spending benefitted all the three key indexes. Fed's positive view of the economy and rally inoil pricesas well as upbeat earnings reports also boosted investor sentiment.Encouraging Domestic DataMost of the economic reports released during the month were encouraging in nature. The ISM manufacturing index increased while the services index declined only marginally for the month of January. Retail sales increased 0.4%
column10: following an upwardly revised 1% gain for December. Durable orders rebounded in January
column11: increasing by 1.8%. The Leading Indicators Index gained 0.6% following an increase of 0.5% in December.CPI and PPI both moved up 0.6% in January. Construction spending increased by 0.2% in December. However
column12: a few key reports were negative in nature. Industrial production declined 0.3% following a downwardly revised 0.6% increase for December. While durable orders fell by 0.4%
column13: consumer confidence dropped to 111.8.Q4 GDP's Second Estimate SlipsAccording to the ""second"" estimate by the Bureau of Economic Analysis
column14: fourth quarter output of goods and services increased at a seasonally adjusted annual rate of 1.9% from the previous three months. This was lower than the consensus estimate of 2.1% growth. An increase in the foreign-trade deficit weighed on growth during the final three months of 2016. In the fourth quarter
column15: exports fell 4% while imports rose 8.5%.Business investment fell lower
column16: with spending on equipment decreasing 1.9%. Residential construction investment increased 9.6%
column17: revised downward from an initial estimate of a 10.2% gain. However
column18: strong gains in consumer spending had a positive impact on the domestic economy. Consumers
column19: the torchbearers for the U.S. economy
column20: increased spending by a solid 3%Housing Sector Recovery SlowsMost of the reports released across the month suggest that the housing sector's recovery has slowed down. Housing starts declined by 2.6% in January though building permits increased by 4.6%. The National Association of Home Builders (NAHB) Housing Market Index declined from 67 to 65 in February.In contrast
column21: existing homes sales jumped 3.3% in January to a seasonally adjusted rate of 5.69 million
column22: the highest level recorded in 10 years. New home sales increased 3.7% to a seasonally adjusted rate of 555
column23: 000. However
column24: the pending home sales index declined 2.8% in January to 106.4
column25: the lowest level in a year. The current scenario seems to be a consequence of demand outstripping supply and a sharp increase in home prices.Job Additions Rise
column26: Increase in Hourly Earnings   DipThe U.S. added 227
column27: 000 jobs in January
column28: higher than the consensus estimate of 174
column29: 000 job additions. This figure also exceeds December's reading of 157
column30: 000. These are the best monthly job gains since September.However
column31: expectations that the economy is moving towards a full employment scenario weighed on workers' pay
column32: with average hourly wages rising only 0.1% in January
column33: lower than December's downwardly revised gain of 0.2%. Further
column34: the unemployment rate
column35: meantime
column36: ticked up to 4.8% from 4.7% in January.Record Earnings Growth in Fourth QuarterThe absolute earnings total for the quarter is on track to be the highest ever. The bulk of the Q4 earnings season is now behind us
column37: with results from only a few of S&P 500 members still awaited. As of February 17
column39: Q4 results from 411 S&P 500 members
column40: or 82.2% of the index's total membership had been released. Total earnings for these 411 index members are up +8% on +4.9% higher revenues
column41: with 68.9% beating EPS estimates and 54.7% coming ahead of top-line expectations. (Read:Retail in Focus as Q4 Earnings Season Winds Down)Retail earnings grabbed the spotlight last month. Solid fourth-quarter reports from Wal-MartWMT
column42: Macy'sM
column43: and Home DepotHDprovided a major fillip to investor sentiment. Earlier in the month
column44: Apple Inc.'sAAPLfirst quarter fiscal results easily topped expectations. The good show was driven by impressive sales of Apple's latest smartphone model iPhone 7 and 7 Plus.Investors Ride ""Trump Rally""The euphoria surrounding President Donald Trump's proposed market-friendly policies including the prospect of massive tax cuts and an uptick in infrastructure spending propelled markets to new highs in February. The Dow closed at an all-time high for a twelfth straight session on Feb 27
column45: posting its longest such streak since 1987. Both the blue-chip index and S&P 500 settled at all-time high levels
column46: while the Nasdaq closed a few points short of a record. At present
column47: the blue-chip index continues to hover above the psychological milestone of 20
column48: 000.Trump's polices including tax cuts
column49: repealing regulations and pickup in infrastructure outlays restored expectations of a pro-growth agenda that helped the Dow push further into record territory. Trump is also planning a multi-trillion-dollar tax cut that will boost the U.S. economy and lift corporate profits.Deregulation Ensues
column50: Defense Spending to RiseTrump has also signed an executive order designed to scale back the Dodd-Frank Act. He views the Dodd-Frank regulatory overhaul as a harsh measure
column51: especially
column52: on banks as they had to beef up compliance compartments to deal with a list of new rules.Meanwhile
column53: Trump sent both the political parties a notice on Feb 27 stating that he intends to significantly raise defense related outlay. He will seek a $54 billion hike in spending on tanks
column54: ships and weapon systems and will trim other priorities. The defense budget will climb 10%
column55: according to the White House
column56: while Trump recommended $30 billion in supplementary military spending for this yearMaiden Speech to CongressUltimately
column57: the Dow snapped its record streak of gains ahead of Trump's first speech before a joint session of Congress on the last day of the month. Profit taking ensued due to a lack of details about Trump's policies.During his speech
column58: Trump adopted a measured approach to several contentious issues. However
column59: he reiterated his commitment to immigration reform and replacing Obamacare with a new healthcare law. At the same time
column60: the speech was light on details but for a request that Congress pass his trillion dollar infrastructure plan.FOMC MinutesMinutes from the Federal Reserve's January meeting adopted a similar tone
column61: keeping alive prospects of a potential near-term interest rate hike. The minutes said that ""many participants expressed the view that it might be appropriate to raise the federal funds rate again fairly soon if incoming information on the labor market and inflation was in line with or stronger than their current expectations or if the risks of overshooting the committee's maximum-employment and inflation objectives increased.""Fed Chair Janet Yellen expects a gradual rate increase amid a modestly expanding economy and inflation that should touch the Fed's desired target rate of 2% in the near term. She said that ""at our upcoming meetings
column62: the Fed will evaluate whether employment and inflation are continuing to evolve in line with…expectations
column63: in which case a further adjustment of the federal funds rate would likely be appropriate.""5 Star Performers for FebruaryI ran a screen onResearch Wizardfor companies with the following parameters:(Click here to sign up for a free trial to the Research Wizard today):Percentage price change over the last 4 weeks greater than or   equal to 15% (As of Oct 31

column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAndroid
column4: fromAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL)
column5: is the dominant mobile operating system. It runs on nearly nine of every 10 mobile phones
column6: worldwide. But that's never really been a primary reason to by GOOGL stock … or at least not directly.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockFrom an investor standpoint
column7: you would still rather buyApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) because Apple monetizes iOS the way a butcher monetizes a pig. Google
column8: on the other hand
column9: just gives its OS away to OEMs.That's not to say Google doesn't make any money off Android
column10: though. Simply by offering its search engine and Google Play store through the software
column11: GOOGL rakes in billions of dollars.But
column12: the Android ecosystem is extremely fragmented. Compared toAmazon.com
column13: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) - which runs its own store and hasits own browser and search engine- Google's take is a mere fraction.What if that changed? Would it mean anything to GOOGL stock holders?Controlling AndroidWhile Google is not yet charging OEMs to use its software
column14: the company has been quietly trying to gain control of its creation. Management is pushing OEMs to deliver security updates on a monthly basis. This is important
column15: as crooks push malware onto older
column16: unpatched phones.7 Stocks That Will Hit All-Time Highs in 2017Google's newest handset
column17: the Pixel
column18: is designed to be as good as an iPhone. Reviews
column19: however
column20: have been mixed. The company is even trying to getback into Chinathrough its OEMs (the world's largest market tossed Google back in 2010 over censorship).Still
column21: Google has its work cut out for itself.Samsung Electronic(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) dominates the Android market. OEMs and consumers see this fragmentation as an advantage
column22: even though it allows bugs to multiply because they may appear on one device or brand only.The operating system itself is hopelessly fragmented. Google is only now rolling out its Marshmallow and Nougat versions of Android andstill developing the ""O"" version
column23: while many users have devices that still run the KitKat version. My own Android phone runs on Lollipop
column24: (simply because it lacks the storage to run anything newer).The way Google eventually gets its arms around all of this may be throughAndromeda
column25: an operating system for both Android and its laptop Chromebook devices. Unifying software platforms would give Alphabet Inc the kind of power that Microsoft only dreamed of with its Windows operating system.Bottom Line on GOOGL StockIf Alphabetwereto start monetizing Android
column26: would investors even notice?Alphabet continues to grow at 20% per year
column27: powered by advertising on its main Search site and YouTube. The company brings approximately 25 cents of every dollar to the net income line
column28: its balance sheet carries almost no debt
column29: and operating cash flow is ridiculous ($36 billion last year alone
column30: more than twice what it achieved just two years prior). In 2016
column31: Alphabet had revenue in excess of $90 billion.Over the last year
column32: the price of GOOGL stock is up nearly 17%
column33: and the non-voting GOOG shares are up even more. The company's market cap of $577 billion trails only that of Apple. Six months ago
column34: they were nearly level
column35: but that was before Apple's recent run to new highs.Alphabet Inc CFO Ruth Porat's program of paring non-performing assets and forcing ""other bets"" (like the company's self-driving car unit
column36: now called Waymo) to make it on their own has paid off. Google's investment balances have been growing steadily
column37: along with its asset base.Why Apple Inc. (AAPL) Will Become a Trillion-Dollar CompanyWhat's most amazing is how Alphabet continues to underperform. Android is not a major profit center
column38: and Google Cloud is often considered third in the market
column39: behind Amazon and Microsoft. Google was late to the voice party with Google Assistant
column40: which allowed Amazon to get the drop on it. Plus
column41: the hardware line is loaded with ""me too"" products
column42: and GOOGL leads in precisely zero categories.Still
column43: Porat has performed well in providing discipline to Google executives
column44: but she has not propelled Alphabet to market leadership outside of Search.If assets such as Android became true profit centers
column45: GOOGL stock would be well on its way to $1
column46: 000 per share and becoming the first trillion-dollar company.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud

column1: Dow Soars Above 21
column2: 000 on Trump Speech
column3: Short Covering;3/1/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTheDow Jones Industrial Averagesurged more than 300 points to cross the 21
column5: 000 level for the first time ever on Wednesday
column6: roaring back from Tuesday's minuscule decline that broke a record 12-in-a-row win streak.makeArticleAd();The exuberance is so thick in the air it's hard to breathe
column7: with stock prices melting higher despite political uncertainty
column8: hawkish noises from the Federal Reserve
column9: extended valuations
column10: narrow breadth and extreme sentiment. It's incredible to see.In the end
column11: the Dow gained 1.5%
column12: theS&P 500gained 1.4%
column13: theNasdaq Compositegained 1.4% and theRussell 2000gained 1.9%. Treasury bonds weakened
column14: the dollar was mostly stronger
column15: gold lost 0.3% and oil lost 0.3% amid renewed focus on record crude inventories.Financial stocks - which have been the primary drivers of the post-election uptrend - gained 2.8%. yield-sensitive utilities and REITs were the laggards
column16: down 1% and 0.4%
column17: respectively.Weight Watchers International
column18: Inc.(NYSE:WTW) surged 27.5% on a Q4 earnings beat thanks to a 9.7% jump in subscribers. Guidance was strong.Office Depot Inc(NASDAQ:ODP) soared 16.5% on solid results.Intel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) fell 0.8% after a downgrade from Bernstein analysts on concerns over data-center sales and high valuation. That boosted the March $35 INTC calls recommended toEdge Prosubscribers to a gain of 35%.Palo Alto Networks Inc(NYSE:PANW) fell 24.2% on weak results and guidance.5 Blue-Chip Stocks to Sell in MarchBest Buy Co Inc(NYSE:BBY) fell 4.5% on a fourth-quarter earnings beat
column19: but unexpected comp-store sales decline and weak guidance. And HD/4k camera system makerAmbarella Inc(NASDAQ:AMBA) fell 4.4% on weak forward guidance on inventory overhand from big customerGoPro Inc(NASDAQ:GPRO).Stepping back
column20: it's worth noting that the bulls keep changing the narrative
column21: with the buying apparently being driven by a lack of specifics from President Trump's admittedly well-received speech to Congress last night (when just 24 hours ago
column22: the warning was that stocks would be disappointed by a lack of specifics). Or that the last time the Dow had a 300 points rally was on Nov. 7
column23: when FBI Director Comey cleared Hillary Clinton for the second time over her email server and thus lifted her electoral victory hopes.All that seems to matter these days is that stocks
column24: no matter the reason
column25: want to move higher. Even as earnings and GDP growth estimates deteriorate (as shown above). The primary motivator for today's move is a combination of first-of-the-month inflows as well as intense short covering near the open. This is an air pocket. A sugar high.Yet headwinds continue to build. And we are massively overdue for a normal pullback with the last 1% loss on the Dow back in October.Apple Inc. (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook Raises Hopes for a New Mac ProThe biggest of which is the increasingly hawkish tone from the Federal Reserve which has pushed up futures market odds of a March rate hike above 80%. Fed rate hikes will ultimately end this bull market
column26: as they have ended all bull markets (and economic expansions) in recent history. Key dates to watch include a speech by Federal Reserve Board Chair Janet Yellen on Friday
column27: and in exactly two weeks from today
column28: the March policy decision and updated economic projections.Anthony Mirhaydari is founder of theEdgeandEdge Proinvestment advisory newsletters. A two-week and four-week free trial offer has been extended to InvestorPlace readers.More From InvestorPlace7 Stocks to Buy That Are ALMOST in Buffett Buying Range7 Stocks That Will Hit All-Time Highs in 2017The postDow Soars Above 21
column29: 000 on Trump Speech
column30: Short Coveringappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook Raises Hopes for a New Mac Pro;3/1/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) has taken heat recently over what some see as an abandonment of its core
column3: ""pro"" customers. With its focus seemingly on the iPhone and Apple Watch
column4: AAPL's Mac computers were being left to fall behind. Especially those aimed at the creative professional market.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleApple CEO Tim Cook answered questions at a shareholder meeting yesterday and offered up comments that give hope those Macs will soon be getting attention. Cook's words even raised the hope that a new Mac Pro could eventually be released.Apple's Professional Mac Lineup Has Fallen BehindOver the last several years
column5: AAPL hasfallen seriously behind in updating many of its Mac computers. Creative professionals and prosumers - considered Apple's core customers for Macs - have been especially hard hit.There has been no new Mac Pro in nearly 1
column6: 200 days. That's an incredible length of time to go without updating a workstation class computer that commands a starting price of $2
column7: 999. Prior to the current model
column8: professionals who needed AAPL's most powerful PC for rendering
column9: editing video and other tasks only waited one to two years between new Mac Pro releases.Apple released new versions every year between 2006 and 2010
column10: then in 2012 and launched the current Mac Pro in 2013.The iMac
column11: which has been a favorite of creative professionals as well as being popular with consumers
column12: hasn't seen a refresh in over 500 days. A new iMac is long overdue.7 Stocks That Will Hit All-Time Highs in 2017There have been many excuses
column13: including finger pointing atIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) over theavailability of new CPUs. Regardless of the real reason
column14: the perception is that Apple has relegated the Mac lineup to the back burner
column15: while it focuses on the incredibly profitable iPhone and launches new consumer products like the Apple Watch.In the meantime
column16: Microsoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) has been going after AAPL's creative professional demographic. The company has expanded from tablets into PCs and last year
column17: it launched theSurface Studio- an innovative all-in-one PC that has many longtime Mac users thinking hard about switching to Windows.Tim Cook Claims AAPL Is Still Focused on Professional CustomersAt an Apple shareholder meeting yesterday
column18: CEO Time Cook fielded investor questions. He dismissed speculation of the Mac and iPad line-ups converging
column19: making the point that a tablet could never be a Mac replacement. He then spoke about AAPL's focus on its professional customers. Quoted inMacRumors
column20: Cook's comments included:""You will see us do more in the pro area … The pro area is very important to us. The creative area is very important to us in particular.""When asked if the apparent lack of new releases aimed at creative professionals means Apple has become too consumer focused
column21: he replied:""Don't think something we've done or something that we're doing that isn't visible yet is a signal that our priorities are elsewhere.""He didn't say specifically that a new Mac Pro or a new iMac are coming
column22: but his comments give hope that these might be in the pipeline.What AppleHasDone for Its Creative ProfessionalsWhile the lack of a new Mac Pro and new iMac are hurting Apple's reputation for being the go-to platform for creative professionals
column23: the company has taken several steps to address the issue.What Is Apple Inc. Doing With Its iPhone 8 Lightning Port?It released the iPad Pro in 2015 and has since expanded its lineup of tablets aimed at creative professionals and prosumers. And last fall
column24: it released an all-new MacBook Pro - a favorite laptop among that demographic. The MacBook Pro launchdidn't go as smoothly as planned
column25: but did send the message that AAPL hasn't abandoned its core users. They may just have to get used to waiting a little longer between new models.With the iPad Pro established and the new MacBook Pro on store shelves
column26: next on the wish list for many Apple fans are a new iMac and a new Mac Pro. The latter in particular seemed in danger of being discontinued altogether
column27: but Tim Cook's comments have helped give hope that it could still be on AAPL's ""to do"" list.As of this writing
column28: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceApple Inc. Fesses Up to iPhone 6 Battery Issue
column29: Releases FixReport: Apple Inc. iPhone 8 Could Cost More Than $1
column30: 000 (AAPL)The postApple Inc. (AAPL) CEO Tim Cook Raises Hopes for a New Mac Proappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: New Feature Announcement: The User Manuals;3/1/2017;"As we ring in March 2017

column3: the User Manuals. Like cooking recipes
column4: these user manuals give detailed instructions on how to use our most popular features on the website.Throughout the past few years

column6: including customized series inInteractive Charts

column8: backtesting

column13: GuruFocus in Excel and the Application Programming Interface (API). This article will briefly discuss each of the above features and give links to the respective user manuals.Interactive ChartsmakeArticleAd();As discussed in a previous article
column14: the Interactive Charts feature allows you to generate visual diagrams that graph the trendline of the data. You can also create Peter Lynch charts
column15: price-sales valuation charts and other customized charts to find good value opportunities. For example
column16: consider the Peter Lynch Chart (Figure 1) and price-sales valuation chart (Figure 2) forWal-Mart Stores Inc.(WMT).Figure 1Figure 2As illustrated in Figure 1
column17: Wal-Mart trades slightly above its Peter Lynch earnings line. Although this suggests Wal-Mart is slightly overvalued
column18: the price-earnings ratio usually gives inaccurate results for cyclical companies as Peter Lynch observed during his investing career. The price-sales ratio
column19: on the other hand
column20: gives more accurate valuations as companies' profit margins tend to revert to the mean over time. Warren Buffett (Trades
column21: Portfolio) measures the total market valuation using the P/S ratio for the entire market
column22: i.e.
column23: the ratio of the Wilshire 5000 full-cap index to the U.S. gross domestic product.While Wal-Mart is slightly overvalued based on its Peter Lynch chart
column24: the discount store is moderately undervalued based on its price-sales valuation chart as Figure 2 illustrates. This suggests Wal-Mart has good value potential in the short term despite having declining operating margins.For more information on constructing detailed visuals
column25: please consult the Interactive Charts User Manual.Discounted Cash Flow CalculatorLike Interactive Charts
column26: which identify the ""entry points"" (times to buy) and the ""exit points"" (time to sell) for a company stock

column29: the terminal growth rate

column1: GuruFocus Has a New Home Page;3/1/2017;"If you accesswww.gurufocus.com
