column1: Apple Inc. Fesses Up to iPhone 6 Battery Issue
column2: Releases Fix;2/24/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIf it seems as thoughApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) has been fighting with battery issues with the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6s for months
column4: that's because it has.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleThere was a limited recall of iPhone 6s batteries blamed on a manufacturing issue
column5: problems in China and recently reports of widespread iPhone 6 sudden shutdown issues that seemed battery related. The company always denied any widespread issue.Until now.AAPL has finally acknowledged a problem related to the iPhone 6 battery … and says it has released a fix.The iPhone 6 Battery Has Been … ProblematicIf there's one thing 2016 will be remembered for when it comes to consumer electronics
column6: it's the challenges of working with lithium-ion batteries.5 Income Tax Deductions You Can't Afford to MissThe poster child for just how wrong this technology can go isSamsung Electronic Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF). Samsung had a terrible 2016 after its flagship Galaxy Note 7's lithium-ion batteries were implicated in multiple fires
column7: This led to a complete recall of the device
column8: an estimated $10 billion hit
column9: a seriously damaged reputation and anextensive investigation to pinpoint the cause.In comparison
column10: AAPL's iPhone 6 battery woes have been less spectacular
column11: but the cloud over Apple's previous two generations of phones has lasted just as long - if not longer. And they proved much more frustrating in terms of nailing down a cause
column12: or a fix. That's because there appear to be multiple issues at play. And just as Apple admits there's a problem and announces a solution
column13: another iPhone 6 battery issue seems to pop up.In 2016
column14: Apple had to deal with aninvestigation in Chinaover reports that iPhone 6 and iPhone 6s batteries were not only failing
column15: but leaving the devices with expensive damage. Apple's findings pointed to cheap knock-off chargers as the culprit. Then there were reports of iPhone 6s phones unexpectedly shutting down. Apple eventually pinpointed the cause as being a manufacturing defect in a batch of batteries. Abattery exchange programwas launched
column16: but that got off to a rocky start when Apple Stores were flooded by iPhone owners hoping for a replacement battery
column17: and a backlog of repairs.Just as that mess was being sorted out
column18: complaints began to rise of iPhone 6 sudden shutdown issues. This was a new iPhone 6 battery issue and seemed to affect a growing number of users. It also affected the iPhone 6s
column19: but not the iPhone 7.The problem got so bad that at one point in January
column20: rumors started thatApple was planning to launch a full-scale iPhone 6 battery exchange program. However
column21: AAPL continued to deny there was a widespread problem with iPhone and 6s batteries.Now
column22: Apple has come clean.Apple Releases Fix for iPhone 6 Shutdown IssueThe company finally admitted that iPhone 6 and 6s phones have been suddenly and randomly shutting down
column23: forcing owners to plug them into a charger before they can be restarted. But
column24: AAPL says it released a fix and it's effective.In a statement released toTechCrunch
column25: Apple says iOS 10.2.1 finally addresses the issue:""We're seeing a more than 80% reduction in iPhone 6s and over 70% reduction on iPhone 6 of devices unexpectedly shutting down.""So what happened?AAPL says the iPhone 6 battery (and in some cases the iPhone 6s as well) suffers from a limitation of all-lithium-ion batteries. As these batteries get older
column26: they sometime deliver power unevenly. This could trigger the iPhone's power management system to force an emergency shutdown to protect the device.Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Just Entered Dangerous TerritoryApple made changes to that system in iOS 10.2.1
column27: essentially making it less sensitive to minor fluctuations. It also added new functionality so that should an iPhone 6 sudden shutdown occur
column28: the user can restart their device without having to be connected to a charger. The company says it also will add a battery diagnostic screen to iOS that warns iPhone owners when their battery requires service.The fact this issue was directly related to aging lithium-ion batteries explains why it was the iPhone 6 battery being implicated more frequently than the 6s
column29: why the numbers seemed to keep growing and why the iPhone 7 hasn't yet been affected.Will this mark the end of AAPL's drawn out iPhone 6 battery saga? The company has been playing whack-a-mole trying to identify issues with its lithium-ion batteries. But this fix seems to be enough of an umbrella solution that it may finally be able to put this chapter behind it.And let Apple go back to the good old days when complaints were limited to wishing the iPhone lasted longer on a battery charge …As of this writing
column30: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceWWDC 2017: Here's What Apple Inc. Might RevealIs Apple Inc. (AAPL) Preparing a Red iPhone 7?Report: Apple Inc. iPhone 8 Could Cost More Than $1

column1: Qualcomm
column2: Inc. (QCOM) Stock Has Big Prospects Despite Its Problems;2/24/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsIt's a bittersweet victory
column4: to be sure. Just whenQualcomm
column5: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) starts to unveil a game-changing technology
column6: a legal hurricane starts to make landfall. If any current or would-be owners of QCOM stock are torn as to what the future likely holds
column7: there's good reason.makeArticleAd();Source:Karlis Dambrans via FlickrAnd yet
column8: as much jeopardy as the company's bottom line may be in at this time
column9: the fact that Qualcomm stock is still down more than 25% over the past three years suggests the market saw a litigation headwind coming sooner or later. The worst-case scenario may already be priced into QCOM stock
column10: which means the recent weakness makes for a compelling entry point.The BadThe legal wrangling is mostly withApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL)
column11: superficially. But
column12: should Apple be successful with its effort
column13: it opens the door to other litigation
column14: not to mention emboldens a similar case being brought against Qualcomm by the Federal Trade Commission.The short version of the story: Apple (and the FTC and the Korea Fair Trade Commission
column15: for that matter) are all arguing the same thing - Qualcomm's business model of licensing its technologies to phonemakers isnot only exorbitant
column16: but unlawfully stifles competition. That's a legal no-no in most any country. The Korea Fair Trade Commission isseeking $873 million for essentially the same.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy and Hold ForeverFor the record
column17: QCOM has lost this argument before. In 2015
column18: thecompany forked over $975 million to Chinafor breaking that country's antitrust laws. Indeed
column19: Qualcomm wasallegedly charging all-encompassing licensing feesto phonemakers that may or may not have needed access to all of the technology in that IP package… another dubious practice.Years of sharp dealing have finally caught up with Qualcomm.The GoodThe irony is
column20: while the company was over-milking its aging patent portfolio
column21: QCOM was also developing some new - and highly marketable - intellectual property.The idea of the Internet of Things (IoT) is an exciting one
column22: but the reality is
column23: the technology and bandwidth needed to meet the need just isn't ready
column24: yet. Or
column25: it wasn't anyway. This week
column26: Qualcommunveiled its 802.11ax technology
column27: which can carry four times the amount of data current Wi-Fi technology carries
column28: but without using any more bandwidth.Qualcomm Technologies VP Rahul Patel explained:It is taking Wi-Fi to a new level from a user-experience point of view. What it is trying to do is prepare the Wi-Fi network
column29: which in many cases is experiencing a lot of congestion
column30: largely because the network is becoming dense and is not able to deal with the amount of traffic.At the same time
column31: the company has created a whole new kind of RF ""front end
column32: or the radio connection between a mobile phone's modem and the transceiver. Not only is it a superior solution to current alternatives
column33: it's a simpler solution that works with a variety of connection protocols
column34: such as LTE and MIMO
column35: by the utilization of modem intelligence.They're not the kind of advances the average consumer cares about
column36: or even understands. With 5G connectivity about to become the norm
column37: however
column38: these little advances are actually big advances that phonemakers will desperately need.Bottom Line for QCOM StockIn simplest terms
column39: the future of QCOM stock lies somewhere between the two ends of this good/bad continuum. One way or another
column40: sooner or later
column41: Qualcomm's business model of leveraging an aging patent portfolio - and doing so in a questionable manner - is going to falter. If the company wants to continue being an IP player
column42: it's going to need some new IP.The question is
column43: will 802.11ax and new RF front-end platforms be enough? It matters
column44: simply becausethe company's licensing and royalty revenue is roughly twice its revenue from outright chip sales.3 Stocks That Could Soar on a Short SqueezeThe answer to this question is a qualified yes; the qualification is the speed with which lawsuits will result in a decision
column45: and the time that will be needed for IoT and 5G to reach critical mass. Odds are good the former will hurt before the latter helps
column46: meaning Qualcomm could be headed for a dry spell
column47: earnings-wise.Still
column48: for the true long-termer who can stomach the ""in the meantime"" volatility
column49: the market may start to appreciate the potential of the distant future now…after a few years of strong bearish pressure.QCOM stock may not be appropriate for grandma's retirement portfolio
column50: but there's little doubt the company's new technologies will be crucial to the next generation of connectivity.As of this writing
column51: James Brumley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceApple Inc. (AAPL) vs. Alphabet Inc (GOOGL)Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Is Feelings. Nothing More Than Feelings.7 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy NowThe postQualcomm
column52: Inc. (QCOM) Stock Has Big Prospects Despite Its Problemsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Zacks Podcast Highlights: Can Companies Satisfy Their Investors by Satisfying Their Customers?;2/23/2017;"Is Customer Satisfaction the Hidden Key to Stock   Outperformance?For Immediate ReleaseChicago
column2: IL - Is there a link between customer satisfaction and stock prices? We explore this idea in the latest edition ofthe Dutram Reportwhere Eric Dutram talks with Kevin Quigg
column3: Chief Strategist of ACSI Funds. Kevin's company is at the forefront of customer satisfaction research
column4: and they have some great insights into the link between having satisfied customers
column5: and satisfied investors too. To listen to the podcast
column6: click here: (https://www.zacks.com/stock/news/246643/is-customer-satisfaction-the-hidden-key-to-stock-outperformance)As consumers
column7: we have all been frustrated by companies which did not meet our expectations. Either poor service or a low-quality product
column8: the end result was always the desire to do less business with the given company.However
column9: on the other side of the coin
column10: there are those companies out there that go above and beyond
column11: time and time again. Those are the companies I like to frequent
column12: and I have always wondered if these types of firms-which have a long history of satisfying their customers-end up making better investments too.Well
column13: in this edition ofthe Dutram Report
column14: I talk to Kevin Quigg
column15: chief strategist at ACSI Funds
column16: for some insights into this topic and if this idea works as an investment.Inside ACSIKevin is an expert in the American Customer Satisfaction Index
column17: a benchmark that exists to find companies that customers either like
column18: or would rather avoid. This is done by looking at a few key areas of the customer satisfaction process
column19: including customer expectations
column20: perceived value
column21: and perceived quality.This data has proven to be extremely popular with companies
column22: as it helps them to keep tabs on the competition and to see their relative standing among their peers too. But the data can also be used to shape the outlook for companies and to see how they are trending in terms of customer satisfaction
column23: which can help to show which companies are moving in the right direction.ACSI's idea is that customer satisfaction leads to customer loyalty
column24: which leads to additional consumer spending which ultimately leads to long-term stock appreciation. This intuitively makes sense
column25: and now there is a way to use this strategy in ETF form.The ETFThis is via ACSI Funds' American Customer Satisfaction Core Alpha ETF (ACSI). This product holds securities that have high ACSI customer satisfaction scores
column26: with the theory being that these will outperform their low-satisfaction peers.Current holdings include well-respected names like Apple (AAPL)
column27: Johnson & Johnson (JNJ) and Alphabet (GOOG) just to name a few
column28: though there are dozens of names in the portfolio. And if you are wondering what is done for sectors where customer satisfaction levels aren't as readily available
column29: such as energy or materials
column30: big ETFs-such asXLEorXLB-are utilized in order to give more broad market-like exposure.Bottom LineFor a more in-depth look at this index as well as its investable counterpart
column31: make sure to listen to the podcast for additional information. We highlight some of the strengths and potential pitfalls when it comes to this strategy
column32: and how it might fit into a portfolio too.So

column1: Trump's Tax Policy May Make for Some Very Easy Investing;2/23/2017;"President Donald Trump hasn't officially released his proposed changes to tax policy yet
column2: but we pretty much know what to expect.It is going to make life very easy for us as investors. We can just buy the most profitable U.S. companies with the biggest hoards of balance sheet cash and then relax.makeArticleAd();We know that we can count on a reduction in the tax rate corporations pay. As recently as December Trump indicated that he planned to have the rate of corporate tax reduced from 35% to 15%.Part two of the reduction in corporate taxes is the ""repatriation holiday"" that Trump wants that would allow companies to bring overseas cash back home without having to pay a significant amount of tax on it.Both of these changes are going to benefit the biggest
column3: strongest companies in the country.In his fourth-quarter letter
column4: hedge fund manager David Einhorn observed that the way to invest for Trump policies is to focus on companies that are currently paying a lot of income taxes. It makes perfect sense.The most profitable companies are going to get a huge bump up in cash flow when that corporate tax rate drops to 15%. What would be ideal then is to find companies that are both very profitable (paying a lot of income tax) and have a lot of overseas cash that the repatriation holiday can free up.A company that fits that mold very well would beApple(AAPL). Apple is a longtime position in Einhorn's fund and a very profitable company with a lot of overseas cash.Here is what Einhorn said specifically about Apple in his recent investor letter:Apple stands to benefit from repatriation of foreign cash and tax reform. The company has over $200 billion in offshore cash it could bring back to the U.S. Apple also derives a majority of its earnings from foreign sources but still accrues GAAP taxes at a 25% rate
column5: which is higher than many other large tech companies. The lower corporate tax rates proposed as part of repatriation and tax reform could therefore lead Apple toward a structurally lower GAAP tax rate going forward.If Apple's tax paid on repatriating that cash just drops by 25% that means the company should be worth $50 billion more than it was without the repatriation holiday. That is a $10 per share bump without the company having to do anything.If Apple's annual tax rate also drops by 60% under a Trump corporate tax cut that would reduce GAAP income tax expense from $15 billion last year to $4.8 billion. That is a $10 billion bump to earnings which on just a 10 multiple means a $100 billion increase to Apple's market capitalization. That is closer to $20 per share.Add the two of them together and you could see a $30 per share bump inApple's share pricejust from Trump's tax policies. That is on a stock that is arguably attractively priced already.Thank you for the idea
column6: Mr. Einhorn. Thank you for making investing easy
column7: Mr. Trump.Disclosure:I don't own shares of any company mentioned in this articleStart afree seven-day trialof Premium Membership to GuruFocus.Warning! GuruFocus has detected 3 Warning Sign with AMZN. Click here to check it out.AMZN 15-Year Financial DataThe intrinsic value of AMZNPeter Lynch Chart of AMZNPremium MembersThis article first appeared onGuruFocus."

column1: 7 Blue-Chip Stocks That Are Flush With Cash;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsCash is king. It not only drives growth

column5: R&D
column6: share buybacks or dividends.When thinking about which stocks to buy for my forthcoming stock advisory newsletter

AAPL has $247 billion of cash on hand

column19: as well.Repatriating that money would leave it with a sizable $77 billion cash hoard. GE is already loved by income investors
column20: so my guess is that GE would use the cash to continue making acquisitions and foolishly buying back stock.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy and Hold ForeverThat will boost per-share earnings and create inorganic growth that keeps the GE name alive as far as investing is concerned.Blue-Chip Stocks: Johnson & Johnson (JNJ)Source:Dawn Via FlickrCash Balance:$40 billionWhat It Should Do:Increase dividends
column21: R&D
column22: M&AI'm not keen onJohnson & Johnson(NYSE:JNJ) despite the fact that it is one of these blue-chip stocks that has recently hit all-time highs. I'm mystified because it isn't growing net income and is really struggling as a company.Still

column24: JNJ should bump up its dividend by another $1 per share
column25: and plow the rest into R&D and acquisitions.3 Struggling Stocks That Could Make Epic RunsIt needs to grow
column26: and right now it's just a sitting duck that's insanely overpriced.Blue-Chip Stocks: Coca-Cola (KO)Source:Chris Nielsen via FlickrCash Balance:$25 billionWhat It Should Do:M&ATheCoca-Cola Co(NYSE:KO) is in a bit of trouble
column27: as the world moves away from sugary and unhealthy drinks. Because it has $25 billion of cash on hand
column28: about $8 billion in annual and predictable free cash flow and needs to find a vision
column29: it should deploy that cash by making a bold acquisition.It needs to buy some massive group of beverage companies that are growing organically and have caught consumers' taste. That's the only way this legend is going to be able to move into the future. Otherwise
column30: it can just settle into flat-growth mode and pay an increasingly uncompetitive 3.5% yield.Blue-Chip Stocks: Microsoft (MSFT)Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)Cash Balance:$132 billionWhat It Should Do:Increase dividends

column32: R&DMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) is in the enviable position of having about $132 billion of cash on hand
column33: while also having settled comfortably into Peter Lynch stalwart territory.MSFT only pays out less than half of its reliable $25 billion to $27 billion of free cash flow. It can easily bump its dividend by another $1 per share and push the yield up toward 4%
column34: and even higher if it wished to.7 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy NowThen it could drop a huge chunk of money into a mega-acquisition that would push it into growth stock territory again. Or it could just keep trying to expand its footprint with big R&D spends.Blue-Chip Stocks: Alphabet (GOOGL)Source: ShutterstockCash Balance:$92 billionWhat It Should Do:NothingWe obviously must mentionAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column35: NASDAQ:GOOGL) here

column40: so I say

It needs to find blockbuster drugs and it has the money to do so.The 3 Best REITs for Sky-High Total ReturnsIt can't just buy up little things here and there. A Pfizer for the future is a Pfizer that revisits what made it great in its past.Lawrence Meyers is the CEO of PDL Capital

column1: This Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Trade Is a Sure Thing;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsImmediately after the U.S. elections
column3: the consensus was to buy the small caps and financials. The money had to come from somewhere
column4: so Wall Street sold mega-cap tech to chase the trend then. Stocks likeAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column5: NASDAQ:GOOGL) fell
column6: but eventually recovered. GOOGL stock even set a new all-time high. Then came earnings season.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockThe reaction to GOOGL earnings was brutal - shares fell 6% in four days. Luckily
column7: GOOGL bulls stepped in and defended the stock. As a result
column8: Alphabet Inc has all but erased the entire post-earnings dip.I've always said that the short-term reaction to earnings is purely a gamble. And that the longer-term fundamentals will eventually prevail.My interpretation of Alphabet earnings is that the Google machine is still on rails! It prints money from multiple assets that have more than a billion users; management is a proven winner; and spending on crazy ventures has abated. Alphabet now even have official structures to profit from the self-driving auto arena.3 Covered Calls to Squeeze Dividends Out of Thin AirSo
column9: for the long term
column10: I have no real worry for GOOGL stock other than the general equity market gyrations. If markets sell off
column11: so will GOOGL. Conversely
column12: I don't expect shares to fall too far on their own from the company's own actions.GOOGL Options PlayOptions are liquid enough to allow me to set in motion trades with ample buffers that I expect to be sure winners given the current environment. The trick is to find a level where GOOGL stock will be defended by fundamental investors. Then I sell risk against those levels and sit back and let time work for me.You've read the statistic that most options expire worthless. So I'd want to be a seller of options since the buyers lose most often.The Bet:Sell the GOOGL Jan 2018 $660 put. This is a bullish trade for which I collect $13 per contract to open. The 20% buffer from current price gives this trade a 95% theoretical chance of success. Selling naked puts is dangerous. Not everyone is comfortable exposing themselves to such downside risk. If GOOGL stock falls below my sold put
column13: I am committed to owning the stock at that level. So anything below $647 per share would accrue losses if GOOGL falls 30% or so.Since risk tolerances vary
column14: I will offer an alternate trade with similar metrics but with a finite risk profile. The alternate version would better fit smaller accounts
column15: too.The Alternate:Sell the GOOGL Jan 2018 $670/$660 credit put spread. This
column16: too
column17: is a bullish trade for which I collect $1.25 per contract to open. The price buffer is about the same
column18: so the theoretical chance of success is still more than 90%. If successful
column19: this trade yields 14% on money risked. I still need GOOGL stock to stay above my sold spread to win.Usually
column20: I like to balance my trade by selling opposite risk. In this case
column21: I will offer the option to do that
column22: but I will delay entry a little in this ""animal spirited"" equity market.The Hedge (Optional):Sell the GOOGL Jan 2018 $1060/$1080 credit call spread. This is a bearish trade for which I collect $1.50 per contract to open. I need GOOGL to stay below my sold strike to win. There is no $10 wide spread available yet
column23: so I can't make it a perfect iron condor. This trade
column24: if successful
column25: can yield 8% on money risked.How to Trade Facebook Inc for 470% ReturnsUsually
column26: in perfect iron condors
column27: my potential yield would almost double because I can only lose on one side or the other. In this case
column28: the two sides will balance
column29: but not perfectly. I am not required to hold these options trades through expiration. I can close any of them for partial gains or losses.Nicolas Chahine is the managing director ofSellSpreads.com. As of this writing

column6: the price is expensive. A pair of custom AirPods
column7: as well as a custom color for the AirPods case
column8: is almost double the normal price of the wireless earbuds.Wireless Charging:Apple is reportedly working with several different groups on wireless charging
column9: 9to5Macnotes. These reports claim that the tech company has five different groups that are developing wireless charging. APPL has also joined the Wireless Power Consortium. Current rumors claim that the company wants to bring wireless charging to its upcoming iPhone 8. However
column10: these rumors are conflicting on how exactly the feature will work.Acoustic Imaging:Apple has filed a patent for acoustic imaging technology that may replace Touch ID
column11: reportsAppleInsider. The acoustic imaging technology technology works in two stages. The first sends out acoustic waves that would be able to move through the display of the device. The second stage has it sensing the feedback from those waves. This allows it to create a 2D image of objects. It would also allow the company to remove the psychical Home button used for Touch ID from its mobile devices.Check out more recentApple RumorsorSubscribe to Apple Rumors:RSSThe postThursday Apple Rumors: ColorWare Offers Custom AirPod Paintingappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Apple Inc. vs. Alphabet Inc: Value or Growth?;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsChoosing between buyingApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) is the classic choice between value and growth. And if you were confused
column3: AAPL stock is the value play
column4: while GOOGL stock provides the growth.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockWhile Apple shares have been on fire in 2017 - up 17% - you can still get in for a price-to-earnings ratio around 16
column5: lower than what investors are paying for the averageS&P 500stock. You also get a dividend of 57 cents per share
column6: more than covered by earnings.GOOGL is the growth play. Revenues increased to $90 billion last year from $55 billion in 2013. This justifies a P/E of nearly 30. The shares are also up 17% over the last 12 months.Right now
column7: investors prefer value over growth and Apple stock is doing better than Alphabet. But this isn't the proverbial choice between a rock and a hard place
column8: instead
column9: it's more like picking between cookies and ice cream. I own both stocks
column10: I have owned them for several years
column11: and I have profited handsomely holding both.The Case for AAPL StockNo technology company is as adept at squeezing profit from hardware as Apple.While other smartphone companies struggle to make money
column12: Apple regularly brings $1 of every $4 in iPhone sales to its bottom line. Its closed ecosystem is perceived as safe and their products last for years.7 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy NowThe current case for Apple stock
column13: however
column14: has little to do with hardware. Instead
column15: services now drivethe stock forward. Services like its app store - from which it takes a 30% cut of sales - Apple Music
column16: iPay and iCloud have become huge
column17: with $7.17 billion of revenue in the fourth quarter alone. The success of its services enabled Apple to become a power in the cloud by putting more than$12 billioninto capital spending last year. It's no secret that the cloud is a capital-intensive business
column18: but Apple has been able to out-spend cloud rivals without disturbing its profit machine.AAPL hadover $246 billion in cashon its books at the end of last year
column19: most of it kept overseas. The Trump administration has proposed a one-time tax cut to encourage Apple to bring this cash back to the U.S. That's enough money to buy companies such asComcast Corporation(NASDAQ:CMCSA) orWalt Disney Co(NYSE:DIS) outright.When analysts subtract the Apple cash from its market cap
column20: they find the company itself valued at ""just"" $460 billion
column21: with a PE of 9 and just over two times sales. If you're looking for a cheap value stock
column22: poised for an era of unprecedented growth
column23: with plenty of safety and margin for error
column24: they say
column25: buy AAPL today.The Case for GOOGL StockThe artists formerly known as Google have a different case to make.Alphabet has become acash flow monster
column26: delivering nearly $40 billion in operating cash flow last year. Its revenue grew nearly 20%
column27: and GOOGL's operating margin is over 25%.Clouds scale like no invention ever seen before
column28: and Alphabet delivers a global search service for literally nothing. Its Android operating system is on87% of all smartphones
column29: against just 12% for Apple
column30: and Alphabet doesn't have to build or sell them. It just watches as customers who own them come to its services.But with no fanfare
column31: GOOGL has also become a power in hardware. Its Chromebooks now outsell Apple's Macintosh line with about 5% of the PC market. Alphabet now participates in all the hardware markets pioneered by rivals - from virtual reality headsets to streaming devices - with watches and personal assistants that let you conduct searches of your home or the world with just your voice.Under CFO Ruth Porat
column32: who joined the company fromMorgan Stanley(NYSE:MS) in 2015
column33: Alphabet is finally telling investors how much they're spending on ""other bets"" like robots and self-driving cars
column34: and it's working to make money on those ventures.The Bottom LineIt's hard to see a loser here.Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock Is Feelings. Nothing More Than Feelings.The perceived threat to Alphabet is the growing balkanization of the Internet
column35: with national governments seeking to control what people see and say within their borders
column36: and who can profit from it. That has yet to impact GOOGL
column37: but even the perception can hurt a stock.AAPL is currently benefiting from a global flight to safety. Its enormous cash position
column38: its strength as a luxury brand
column39: and its growth in services
column40: which could easily be expanded into competition in the cloud with companies such as Alphabet
column41: are all seen in the best light right now.If pushed to the wall and forced to buy just one right now
column42: I would probably go with GOOG
column43: the non-voting version of Alphabet stock
column44: which shares equally in earnings but sells at a $20 per share discount to the GOOGL shares.But both companies are likeGeneral Motors Company(NYSE:GM) was in the 1950s
column45: International Business Machines Corp.(NYSE:IBM) was in the 1960s
column46: andHalliburton Company(NYSE:HAL) was in the last decade. These are their good old days. We know they will end someday
column47: but that day is not today.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column48: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing he owned shares in AAPL

Comparing the most recent share price to the 200 day moving average can also be a useful technical analysis technique --learn more about the 200 day moving average ».makeArticleAd();Exchange traded funds (ETFs) trade just like stocks
column14: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks
column15: but can also be created or destroyed to accommodate investor demand. Each week we monitor the week-over-week change in shares outstanding data
column16: to keep a lookout for those ETFs experiencing notable inflows (many new units created) or outflows (many old units destroyed). Creation of new units will mean the underlying holdings of the ETF need to be purchased

column1: Apple's (AAPL) Eco-friendly Headquarters to Open in April;2/23/2017;"After massive delays and cost escalations
column2: Apple Inc.AAPLhas finally announced that its new headquarters named Apple Park will be ready by April this year.Per the press release
column3: Apple Park will be powered entirely by renewable energy and will need no artificial heating/air conditioning for a major part of the year. The solar panels installed in the Park are expected to generate 17 megawatts of power. The building will have natural ventilation.In 2011
column4: Apple co-founder Steve Jobs had envisioned Apple's futuristic design headquarters. CEO Tim Cook said ""Steve's vision for Apple stretched far beyond his time with us. He intended Apple Park to be the home of innovation for generations to come. The workspaces and parklands are designed to inspire our team as well as benefit the environment. We've achieved one of the most energy-efficient buildings in the world and the campus will run entirely on renewable energy.""Apple Park is spread across 175 acres of land in Santa Clara valley. The Park's main building is ring shaped (likened to a spaceship widely) and about 2.8 million square feet in area. Apple claims that that building is ""clad entirely in the world's largest panels of curved glass."" Apple Park also has a 1000-seat auditorium
column5: which will be named after Jobs who died in 2011 after a long battle with pancreatic cancer.Apple said that it will start moving its employees from April and will take about half a year to completely move 12K of the company's employees to the new headquarters. Like many other campuses
column6: Apple Park will feature cafes and a fitness center.Apple Inc. PriceApple Inc. Price|Apple Inc. QuoteReportedly
column7: Apple Park was designed by Apple's design chief Sir Jony Ive in partnership with architecture firm Foster + Partners and built for an estimated cost of $5 billion.Apple's Go Green InitiativesApple is one of the many big companies that took up climate change issues head on. Cook had earlier commented ""Climate change is one of the great challenges of our time
column8: and the time for action is now. The transition to a new green economy requires innovation
column9: ambition and purpose. We believe passionately in leaving the world better than we found it and hope that many other suppliers
column10: partners and other companies join us in this important effort.""In fact
column11: Apple meets 93% of its energy requirements via renewable energy facilities across the globe as per its 2016 Environmental Responsibility Report.It has been aggressively investing to source renewable energy for its operations. The company has set an ambitious target to fuel 100% of its global energy needs
column12: including supply chain
column13: solely through renewable resources like solar
column14: geothermal & wind power
column15: biogas and hydro power. As per sources
column16: Apple's supply chain needs over an estimated 60 times more energy than its own facilities.Apple states that it has gone 100% green in 23 countries including China
column17: Germany and Singapore. Plus
column18: all of Apple's data centers are running on clean energy. It uses entirely recycled/sustainable paper for 99% of its packaging.Undoubtedly
column19: going green will help big companies to save on costs while helping to protect the environment at the same time.Zacks Rank and Share Price MovementAt present
column20: Apple has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). Apple's shares have marginally outperformed the broader market over the past one year. Shares of Apple have registered growth of 44.74%
column21: compared with the ZacksComputer Miniindustry's gain of 43.53%.Stocks to ConsiderBetter-ranked stocks in the wider technology space are Texas instruments Inc.TXN
column22: MeetMe IncMEETand Netflix Inc.NFLX. Texas Instruments sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) while MeetMe and Netflix carry a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy). You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank stocks   here.In the trailing four quarters
column23: Texas Instruments
column24: MeetMe and Netflix recorded a positive average earnings surprise of 7.09%
column26: respectively.Zacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017In addition to the stocks discussed above
column27: would you like to know about our 10 finest buy-and-hold tickers for the entirety of 2017?Who wouldn't? Last year's market-beating Top 10 portfolio produced 5 double-digit winners. For example
column28: oil and natural gas giant Pioneer Natural Resources and First Republic Bank racked up stellar gains of +44.9% and +44.3% respectively. Now a brand-new list for 2017 has been hand-picked from 4

column1: Alphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Is Still a Top Tech Stock;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI'm a firm believer inAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column3: NASDAQ:GOOGL). In the markets
column4: there is an elite group of companies that define their respective industries. For example
column5: Amazon.com
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) owns e-commerce
column7: whileFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) has forever changed social media. And for now
column8: Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) is the king of smart devices. But in my humble opinion
column9: GOOGL stock tops them all.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockDon't get me wrong as this is not a slight against any of the above companies. Just let me forward a very basic observation - all these other names essentially require the internet to function. If not directly
column10: then certainly
column11: access to the internet represents their core marketing message.But what happens when you own the internet? That's a theoretical question to everyone except GOOGL.As I mentioned in a prior contribution
column12: thedominanceof the GOOGL search engine is unparalleled. The margin between Alphabet Inc and the next biggest competitor
column13: Bing
column14: is a whopping 300%. It just gets worse as you go down the rankings. By the time you hit fifth place
column15: it's just not even worth considering. In any other industry
column16: such a statement would be the death knell for the competition.Essentially
column17: GOOGL stock is an investment in life itself. Many people thought that thename changeto Alphabet - a play on the financial term ""alpha"" and the gambling term ""bet"" - was cheeky and a bit ridiculous. But it also signified that Alphabet Inc could do whatever it wants because no one can stop it. GOOGL stock was essentially either an asset or a threat
column18: depending on your perspective.Volatility Is a Risk to GOOGL StockUnfortunately
column19: where it matters most for investors
column20: GOOGL stock hasn't always shown its best stuff. True
column21: it's early into 2017
column22: and so far
column23: it's up over 4% year-to-date. Keep that up every month and you're guaranteed a stellar annual return. But Alphabet Inc has also beeninconsistent
column24: as InvestorPlace contributor Chris Tyler points out. For example
column25: GOOGL was looking at closing January at over 6%. Instead
column26: it only secured 1.4%.7 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy NowOn a strictly nominal basis
column27: that's not much of a swing. But on percentage basis
column28: it's a much different story. It has been well over a decade since Alphabet stock introduced itself to the markets. The crazy dynamics involved in a fresh tech company should be over by now. Today
column29: GOOGL and its subsidiaries are comparable toGeneral Electric Company(NYSE:GE) if GE was a little more hip.But with great size comes great envy. Alphabet Inc now faces a fundamental problem.Oracle Corporation(NYSE:ORCL) wants to reengage acourt rulingthat went in favor of GOOGL. At issue is the company's generous use of Oracle's Java software in order to design the Android operating system. GOOGL contends that using Java - which is open-source - is fair game. Oracle contends that it violates the ""fair use "" component of copyright law.For those that acquired GOOGL stock
column30: it's an ugly situation that might be a legitimate risk. Here's the thing - whether it's legitimate or not doesn't matter. If the markets think it's a problem
column31: it's a problem. That makes the sighting of what appears to be a bearish head-and-shoulders pattern (between early December until now) a curious development.Don't Panic on Alphabet IncGenerally
column32: it's not the best idea to buy an investment with baggage. Certainly
column33: it's not a good idea when the baggage is from a giant company like Oracle. Ditto that for its 6'3″ CEO that doesn't come off as someone you want to mess with. In other words
column34: GOOGL stock has some challenges.3 Struggling Stocks That Could Make Epic RunsI also don't think it's a coincidence that the head-and-shoulders pattern is emerging right now. If I'm looking at Alphabet Inc purely as a swing trade
column35: I wouldn't go full bore at this juncture. I expect shares to at least test its 50-day moving average
column36: which stands just under $800. It would not shock me
column37: however
column38: to see GOOGL stock slide towards its 200-day moving average
column39: which is around $763.Again
column40: that's looking at Alphabet Inc from a short-term perspective. For those that have a wider time horizon
column41: the king of the internet is as strong technically as it is fundamentally. Aside from some bumps in the road
column42: GOOGL stock is enjoying clear blue skies. Most importantly
column43: those bumps have never affected Alphabet Inc in a permanent way.The bottom line here is that I would be content holding GOOGL stock. Further
column44: any dips are justifiable buying opportunities
column45: not mere contrarianism for its own sake. Alphabet Inc isgoing to $1
column46: 000- just try to ignore the turbulence as best you can.As of this writing
column47: Josh Enomoto did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace7 Consumer Stocks That Will Knock Your Socks Off7 Stocks to Sell or Short Before the Bears StrikeThe postAlphabet Inc (GOOGL) Stock Is Still a Top Tech Stockappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Has Fitbit Inc (FIT) Stock Finally Hit the Bottom?;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News

column38: which is a huge deal for its size.We also have to reconsider this criticism of Fitbit stock as a ""commoditized"" investment. It's both a valid and an invalid argument. You can literally say the same thing aboutApple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL)

column1: Apple Reaches Analyst Target Price;2/23/2017;"In recent trading
column2: shares of Apple Inc (Symbol: AAPL) have crossed above the average analyst 12-month target price of $137.10
column3: changing hands for $137.11/share. When a stock reaches the target an analyst has set
column4: the analyst logically has two ways to react: downgrade on valuation
column5: or
column6: re-adjust their target price to a higher level. Analyst reaction may also depend on the fundamental business developments that may be responsible for driving the stock price higher - if things are looking up for the company
column7: perhaps it is time for that target price to be raised.makeArticleAd();There are 29 different analyst targets contributing to that average for Apple Inc
column8: but the average is just that - a mathematical average. There are analysts with lower targets than the average
column9: including one looking for a price of $85.00. And then on the other side of the spectrum one analyst has a target as high as $185.00. The standard deviation is $18.383.But the whole reason to look at theaverageAAPL price target in the first place is to tap into a ""wisdom of crowds"" effort
column10: putting together the contributions of all the individual minds who contributed to the ultimate number
column11: as opposed to what just one particular expert believes. And so with AAPL crossing above that average target price of $137.10/share
column12: investors in AAPL have been given a good signal to spend fresh time assessing the company and deciding for themselves: is $137.10 just one stop on the way to an evenhighertarget
column13: or has the valuation gotten stretched to the point where it is time to think about taking some chips off the table? column1: HP Inc. (HPQ) Earnings & Revenues Surpass Estimates in Q1;2/23/2017;"makeZacksArticleAd();HP Inc.HPQreleased its first-quarter fiscal 2017 earnings yesterday
column2: after its split from Hewlett-Packard Company. The company reported better-than-expected results for the first quarter
column3: wherein both its top and bottom line surpassed the Zacks Consensus Estimate. Following the results
column4: shares of the company went up more than 2% in after-hours trading yesterday.The company reported non-GAAP earnings per share of 38 cents per share
column5: which came ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate by a penny. Also
column6: earnings increased from the year-ago figure of 36 cents per share.Notably
column7: Hewlett-Packard Company split itself into two standalone companies - HP Inc. and Hewlett-Packard EnterpriseHPE- effective Nov 1
column8: 2015. Post the split
column9: its PC and printer business has been operating as HP Inc.
column10: while Hewlett-Packard Enterprise specializes in commercial tech products.The stock has gained approximately 50.28% over the last one year
column11: outperforming the Zacks categorizedComputer-Mini Computersindustry's return of 41.27%.Quarter in DetailHP's total revenue increased 3.6% year over year to $12.684 billion and came ahead of the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $11.774 billion. The better-than-expected top-line performance was driven mainly by strength in the Personal System segment and outperformance of newly launched products.The Personal Systems segment garnered revenues of $8.224 billion compared with $7.476 billion reported in the year-ago quarter.  Commercial revenues increased 7%
column12: while Consumer revenues increased 15%. The company witnessed an 8% rise in total shipments mainly driven by a 12% increase in Notebook unit shipment
column13: while Desktops unit shipments were flat on a year-over-year basis.As expected
column14: Printing revenues were down 3% year over year to $4.483 billion
column15: primarily due to a 3% plunge in supplies revenues. HP's total hardware unit sales increased 6% primarily due to an increase of 2% in Commercial hardware units and a 7% increase in Consumer hardware units.Non-GAAP gross margin was down 100 basis points (bps) on a year-over-year basis to 18.7% primarily due to higher cost of sales. Total adjusted operating expenses decreased 1.8% year over year to $1.345 billion. Non-GAAP operating margin from continuing operations contracted 40 bps to 7.1% mainly due to unfavorable foreign currency impact and higher marketing spending expenses for demand generation.HP's non-GAAP net income from continuing operations came in at $655 million or 38 cents per share
column16: compared with $645 million or 36 cents per share reported a year ago.Balance Sheet and Cash FlowHP ended the fiscal first quarter with cash and cash equivalents of $6.331 billion compared with $6.288 billion in the previous quarter. The company had long-term debt of $6.688 billion
column17: compared with $6.758 billion last quarter.The company generated cash flow of $767 million from operational activities during the quarter. During the same period
column18: the company repurchased 25.5 million shares and paid dividends worth $227 million.GuidanceFor fiscal second quarter
column19: HP projects non-GAAP earnings in a range of 37 cents to 40 cents per share (mid-point: 38.5 cents). The Zacks Consensus Estimate is pegged at 39 cents.HP reiterated the fiscal 2017 earnings guidance. The company continues to anticipate non-GAAP earnings per share in a band of $1.55-$1.65 (mid-point: $1.6). The Zacks Consensus Estimate stands at $1.60 per share.Our TakeHP reported better-than-expected first-quarter fiscal 2017 results driven mainly by strength in Personal System and execution of restructuring actions and productivity initiatives.  However
column20: the company provided not so encouraging forthcoming and fiscal 2017 earnings guidance.We are impressed by the performance of HP Inc.'s PC segment
column21: wherein the year-over-year increase was witnessed mainly due to growth in Commercial and Consumer revenues.HP's efforts to turn around the business have been commendable. The company is working on product innovation and differentiation as well as enhancing the capabilities of the printing business to stabilize the top line.Furthermore
column22: looking at the data compiled by two independent research firms - Gartner and International Data Corporation - we believe that the downtrend in PC shipments showed signs of stabilization in fourth-quarter 2016
column23: compared with the previous quarters.Notably
column24: for HP
column25: this was the third consecutive quarter of year-over-year shipment growth following five back-to-back quarters of underperformance. The company witnessed a 4.3% increase in PC shipments and raised its market share to 20.4% from 18.8% in the year-ago quarter. We believe that the company's ongoing restructuring initiatives will result in lower costs
column26: while enhancing both productivity and profitability.However
column27: macroeconomic challenges and tepid IT spending remain near-term concerns. Competition from the likes of International Business MachinesIBMand AppleAAPLadd to its woes.HP currently carries a Zacks Rank #4 (Sell).You can seethe complete list of today's Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks hereZacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017In addition to the stocks discussed above

column1: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Is Making a Giant Push in Its Supercharger Network;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA) has already run into issues with congestion at Supercharger locations. There are also areas of the country where charge stations are few and far between. With the affordable Model 3 on track to go into mass production in September
column3: what is now an annoyance to customers could quickly become a real problem.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockTesla is getting ahead of the issue by accelerating the growth of its Supercharger network
column4: with plans to double the number of North American Supercharger locations in 2017.Tesla's Supercharger Network Is Critical to EVs' SuccessTransitioning from gasoline-fueled automobiles to electric cars isn't just a matter of convincing consumers to spend a little more on the initial purchase price. The technology
column5: green cred and especially the potential long-term fuel savings go a long way toward overcoming any initial sticker shock.The big problem is range anxiety.7 Marvelous Mid-Cap Stocks to Buy for the Best of All WorldsRegular drivers don't worry about running out of gas because there is a vast network of gas stations across the country. With an estimated150
column6: 000 gas stations in the U.S.(in 2015)
column7: you are seldom more than a few minutes away from being able to refuel. Once there
column8: it's typically five or 10 minutes to gas up
column9: pay and be back on the road.Electric cars like those made by TSLA have the advantage of being able to be charged at home
column10: but that takes a long time. According to Tesla's figures
column11: half an hour on a home charger gets about 27 miles of driving range. And that doesn't help when you're traveling.The company has been building up a Supercharger network that takes on the role of gas stations. A Supercharger is capable of adding 270 miles of driving range in 30 minutes
column12: and can fully charge a Tesla Model S with 90 kWh battery in roughly 75 minutes.Each Supercharger location isestimated to cost TSLA between $100k and $175kto build
column13: taking 12-20 weeks to complete.TSLA Will Double Its North American Locations in 2017Tesla's Supercharger network has two challenges.First
column14: it is much
column15: much thinner than the nation's network of gas stations. In all of the U.S. Canada and Mexico
column16: Tesla currently has just 373 Supercharger locations
column17: with 2
column18: 636 connections. Many of those Supercharger locations are concentrated on the east and west coasts.Then there is the charging time. While filling your car with enough gas to go 500 miles might take five or 10 minutes
column19: fully charging a base Model S takes 75 minutes.With Tesla ownership limited to early adopters with relatively deep pockets
column20: the sparse Supercharger network has mostly been an annoyance - something Tesla owners learn to work around. With the Model 3 slated to go into production in September and kick off a wave of mass market Tesla ownership
column21: those annoyances risk becoming a serious problem.Early adopters may be willing to work around challenges
column22: but average consumers quickly turn against a product that requires them to jump through hoops.In its full-year 2016 update letter to investors
column23: TSLA announced that is tackling the issue:""We plan to accelerate expansion of the Supercharger network this year
column24: starting with doubling our number of North American Supercharger locations in 2017.""Expansion and New Charging PoliciesDoubling the number of North American Supercharger locations helps to address range anxiety by filling in some of those areas on the map that are currently blank. Since each location has multiple Superchargers
column25: it also significantly expands the number of Tesla cars that can be charging at any given time.Tesla can't do much about the time needed to charge one of its cars - at least with current technology - but it has implemented several policies in the past few months to help deal with congestion at its Supercharger network.Weibo Corp (ADR) (WB) Stock Goes Cold Despite Hot Q4 EarningsIn December
column26: TSLA announced an idle fee(billed by the minute) would be charged to Tesla owners who parked their vehicles at Superchargers and left them connected. Then in January it announced theend of unlimited free Supercharger accessfor new Tesla buyers going forward.Withclose to 400
column27: 000 of the $35k Model 3s pre-ordered- and a goal of producing 500k electric vehicles a year by 2018 - the pressure is on TSLA to ensure its Supercharger network can meet the coming flood of demand. The policy changes will help
column28: but ultimately Tesla needs to expand its network of chargers to provide the coverage and availability drivers expect.Doubling the number of North American Supercharger locations this year will be costly
column29: but is a necessary move for Tesla to go mass market.As of this writing

column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsTeva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd (ADR)(NYSE:TEVA) desperately needed some good news heading into its fourth quarter earnings report. TEVA stock hit its lowest level in over a decade the week before
column3: after its CEO resigned abruptly.makeArticleAd();Source:Open Grid Scheduler (Modified)The departure of CEO Erez Vigodman came amidst reports of bribery investigations in the company's home country of Israel. And it came after a long decline in TEVA stock
column4: driven by pricing pressure
column5: questionable acquisitions
column6: and a ""patent cliff"" for Teva Pharmaceutical's key drug
column7: Copaxone.And while Q4 earnings delivered
column8: the news wasn't great. Revenue increased 33%
column9: but that came almost solely from the acquisition ofAllergan plc's(NYSE:AGN) generics business. Teva Pharmaceutical paid $40.5 billion in a transaction that has boosted sales as well as Teva's debt load. Margins were pressured
column10: reflected in non-GAAP EPS that increased just 8% despite the 33% rise in sales.But the company also reaffirmed 2017 non-GAAP EPS guidance of $4.90-$5.30. That eased fears of another reduction in the 2017 outlook
column11: which had been cut in January from $6-$6.50. The news was enough to drive a ""relief rally"" in TEVA stock
column12: which now has climbed more than 10% from its lows.There should be more upside ahead
column13: even if the road might be bumpy. Teva does have numerous risks
column14: both near-term and long-term. But it also has tremendous potential
column15: a cheap multiple
column16: and a new CEO on the way. There's a turnaround opportunity in TEVA stock and it doesn't look quite priced in.Why It's Crazy to Buy Teva StockAdmittedly
column17: there are concerns across the board for Teva stock. Thepatent invalidationfor Copaxone
column18: a multiple sclerosis treatment
column19: puts an estimated 20% of revenue
column20: and possibly 40%-plus of profit
column21: at risk. On the Q4 call
column22: CFO Eyal Desheh estimated an $800 million cash flow impact in 2017
column23: should competition enter immediately.That entrance - which would occur if Teva loses its appeal - also would shave 75 to 95 cents off EPS.The combination of lower earnings and higher debt after the Allergan deal raises another risk. Teva's leverage ratio (net debt to EBITDA) at the end of 2016 was 4.7. That doesn't imply immediate risk of bankruptcy
column24: to be sure. But Teva bonds that mature in 2026 have fallen about 12% just since September. Clearly
column25: the debt markets are pricing in a greater
column26: if still modest
column27: possibility of a restructuring that could wipe out TEVA stock.The company now faces the challenge of finding a new CEO.Both previous CEOsleft relatively quickly
column28: amid questions of fit within Teva's culture and clashes with the company's board. The company's current bylaws require the CEO to reside in Israel
column29: though it's possible those could be changed for the next candidate.9 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9.99The bear case for TEVA stock is that
column30: yes
column31: it is cheap - and for good reason. Declining profits
column32: a $36 billion debt load
column33: concerns about generic pricing
column34: and the loss of Copaxone all present significant risks. And those risks justify a 7x multiple to the midpoint of 2017 EPS guidance.Why Teva Stock Is a Buy NonethelessThose concerns are valid. But they're also backward-looking.Teva has numerous options to improve its situation
column35: and interim CEO Yitzhak Peterburg said on the Q4 call that Teva would ""leave no stone unturned"" in considering those options.And what's important to keep in mind is that the situation isn't all that dire. Yes
column36: bonds have fallen; but the yield to maturity still is just 4.4%
column37: implying a very low chance of bankruptcy over the next decade. The leverage ratio could move above 5x if Copaxone competition moves in; but that remains a manageable level. This isn'tValeant Pharmaceuticals Intl Inc(NYSE:VRX); Teva's back isn't against the wall.The company has options. TEVA is targeting a 3.5x leverage ratio
column38: and likely will consider asset sales as a path to those levels. There's still the possibility of a split between the branded and generic businesses
column39: something Wall Street has long targeted. (That decision appears up to the new CEO
column40: per the Q4 call.)Copaxone sales and profits aren't going to zero
column41: even if generic competition enters immediately. And the same goes for Teva Pharmaceutical earnings. This remains the largest generic drug manufacturer in the world based on revenue. With rising health care costs a concern pretty much everywhere
column42: and drug pricing a key part of those concerns
column43: that's a major long-term competitive advantage for Teva.The Apple iPhone 8 Will Be Revolutionary (AAPL)And TEVA stock is cheap - even assuming the worst about Copaxone. Using the low end of 2017 guidance and the high end of the guided Copaxone impact still puts 2017 EPS near $4
column44: and TEVA stock's P/E multiple below 10. Simply stabilizing the business at those levels likely implies a 12-13 multiple - and gets TEVA stock to $50.It's always difficult to time the bottom in any stock. But the Q4 earnings from Teva Pharmaceutical seem to imply that the company at least has a handle on its challenges. Looking forward
column45: the debt load isn't so big that the company is forced to do anything
column46: and a new CEO will bring fresh eyes.There are concerns
column47: to be sure. But Teva Pharmaceutical has a lot of tools still at its disposal to answer those concerns
column48: and push TEVA stock higher.The author has no position in any securities mentioned.More From InvestorPlace9 Best Cheap Stocks to Buy Now Under $9.997 Tech Stocks With Explosive Growth PotentialWatch Cisco Systems

column1: A Slight Negative for This Apple Inc. Supplier Emerges;2/23/2017;"Taiwan Semiconductor Mfg. Co. Ltd.(NYSE: TSM) is the world's largest contract chip manufacturer. It   manufactures chips for some of the largest
column2: most powerful   companies likeApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) as well as for small chip companies you might not   have ever heard of.TSMC is in the unique situation of having a very strong   position inside of Apple's iPhone line of smartphones -- it is   believed to be the exclusive manufacturer of Apple's   custom-designed A10 processor and it is also believed to be the   manufacturer of theQualcomm(NASDAQ: QCOM) Snapdragon X12 andIntel(NASDAQ: INTC) XMM 7360 cellular modems found inside of each   iPhone sold today.Image source: Intel.makeArticleAd();Going forward
column3: it looks as though TSMC is set to see revenues   from iPhone cellular modems vanish.Gone either this cycle
column4: or nextIf Apple chooses to reuse the Snapdragon X12 modem as well as   adopt Intel's XMM 7480 cellular modem for the upcoming iPhone   product cycle
column5: then TSMC should enjoy another year of cellular   modem revenues (since the XMM 7480 is also believed to be   manufactured at TSMC).However
column6: after that it is likely that Apple will adopt the   Intel XMM 7560 cellular modem as well as either the Qualcomm   Snapdragon X16 or Snapdragon X20 modem (if it doesn't ultimately   adopt one of them this cycle).The Snapdragon X16 is manufactured bySamsung(NASDAQOTH: SSNLF) on its 14-nanometer LPP technology and the   Snapdragon X20 is manufactured by Samsung using its 10-nanometer   LPE technology.The Intel XMM 7560 is
column7: unlike previous Intel modems
column8: manufactured by Intel itself using some variant of its   14-nanometer manufacturing technology.So
column9: at some point within the next iPhone cycle or two
column10: Apple   is likely going to be sourcing modems from both Qualcomm and   Intel that aren't manufactured by TSMC.What does this mean for TSMC's business?If we assume that this business is worth something on the   order of $1 billion in annual revenue (200 million units   multiplied by a rough estimate of $5 per unit)
column11: then -- all else   equal -- TSMC stands to see a roughly 3% revenue decline from the   eventual loss of this business (based on current analyst   consensus which calls for TSMC to rake in about $32.22 billion in   revenue this year).That's certainly less than ideal
column12: but such a loss isn't going   to dramatically impact the company's financial position. After   all
column13: the company still benefits from the growth of the overall   smartphone market (as it is a critical supplier of many key   smartphone processor makers) and I wouldn't be surprised to see   silicon content within smartphones continue to grow in the years   ahead as smartphones continue to integrate more features and   functionality.In other words
column14: TSMC should be able to more than make up the   potential declines elsewhere within the mobile market.What about for Intel's and Samsung's?Samsung's contract chip manufacturing business used to rely on   the manufacture of Apple's A-series applications processors
column15: but   it seems to have lost that business to TSMC for the foreseeable   future. Getting some logic silicon content in the iPhone again   via the manufacture of Qualcomm's modems certainly can't   hurt.A similar argument applies to Intel. The company is looking to   expand its total addressable market partly to grow revenue and   partly to continue to have enough chip scale to keep its   expensive factories filled with chips. By manufacturing and   shipping tens of millions
column16: if not more than 100 million cellular   baseband chips (eventually) annually
column17: the company has quite a lot   of ""guaranteed"" volume for its factories year-in and   year-out.In other words
column18: I'd say that TSMC losing business to Intel and   Samsung is probably more of a positive for the latter two's   businesses than it is a negative for TSMC.Offer from The Motley Fool: The 10 best stocks to buy       nowMotley Fool co-founders Tom and David Gardner have spent     more than a decade beating the market. In fact
column19: the newsletter     they run

column21: has tripled the S&P 500!*Tom and David just revealed their ten top stock picks for     investors to buy right now.Click here to get access to the full       list!*Stock Advisor returns as of 1/30/2017Ashraf Eassaowns shares of Intel and Qualcomm. column1: Apple Inc. (AAPL) iPhone 8 Camera Will Be Revolutionary;2/23/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAs we get closer to September and the expected launch of the 10th anniversary iPhone

column4: 000 or morefor the device.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleOne reason for the unprecedented starting price may now have been revealed. column5: and could be the missing piece that lets the company push into augmented reality.9to5 Macpublished details of a report
column6: released yesterday by KGI Securitiesanalyst Ming-Chi Kuo. According to Kuo
column7: iPhone 8 won't push the limits of the primary camera the way the dual-lens system on the iPhone 7 Plus did. Instead
column8: it will get a new FaceTime camera he describes a ""revolutionary.""7 Consumer Stocks That Will Knock Your Socks OffThe KGI report says the new camera will incorporate an advanced infrared sensor
column9: and employ technology developed byPrimeSense- the Israeli 3D sensor companyApple bought in 2013. Together
column10: the camera lens
column11: IR transmitter and IR receiver will be able to accurately track the depth and location of objects. In other words

column13: Ltd(OTCMKTS:HNHPF) - Foxconn to you and me - is expected to make the IR sensors.Lumentum Holdings Inc(NASDAQ:LITE) will provide laser technology. Algorithms from PrimeSense will make sense of all the imaging data
column14: along with facial recognition know-how from the2015 Apple purchaseMetaio.IPhone 8 FaceTime Camera: The Key to Facial Recognition and ARThe FaceTime camera is the iPhone's so-called ""selfie"" camera. column16: leading to speculation AAPL is preparing to release a product with augmented reality as a key feature.The iPhone 8's new FaceTime camera - with its 3D capabilities - could be that bigAR announcementwe've been anticipating. The KGI report suggests the iPhone 8's camera could scan the user's face and generate 3D selfies (thereit is).Besides the ultra-cool selfie capability
column17: these images could them be stitched into applications
column18: such as games.IPhone 8 on Track to Be a High-Tech LeaderWe're certain AAPL will be sparing no expense when it comes to making iPhone 8 a visual standout. It will have a bold new design - likely all glass with a stainless steel band and bezel-free OLED display.But the KGI report on the new FaceTime camera suggests it will also be a technology standout. Biometric security and AR support are looking to be key features. The new camera brings together a number of AAPL's past acquisitions
column19: helps to explain that rumored $1
column20: 000+ price tag and puts Tim Cook's ongoing pep talks about AR into perspective.Apple Park: Apple Inc (AAPL) Sets Grand Opening for 'Spaceship' CampusAnd according to KGI

column1: Wednesday Apple Rumors: 2016 MacBook Pro Keyboard Problems;2/22/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsLeading theApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) rumor mill today is news of MacBook Pro keyboard problems. Today
column3: we'll look at that and otherApple Rumorsfor Wednesday.makeArticleAd();Source: AppleMacBook Pro Keyboards:Some owners of the 2016 MacBook Pro are having trouble with its keyboard
column4: reportsMacRumors. Owners of the devices have taken to Apple's official support forums to air their complaints. The problems include keys not working
column5: lack of a uniform feel and high-pitched sounds coming from some keys when pressed. Many of these customers have noted that the problems are most prevalent when the laptop is warm.iCloud.net Purchase:AAPL has purchased the domain for iCloud.net
column6: TechCrunchnotes. The tech company bought the domain without any major announcement. It has been working to obtain domains related to its services lately. The iCloud.net domain was owned by a small Asian social networking company. This company has announced to users that the service is shutting down. This puts AAPL one step closer to owning all of the domains connected to its iCloud service. However
column7: it still needs to get its hands on iCloud.co.uk.Cambridge Siri Lab:Apple has finally confirmed the existence of its Siri research and development lab in Cambridge
column8: U.K.
column9: reportsAppleInsider. The company has put up a sign outside of the building that has its logo on it. The lab was the subject of rumors and many leaks lead people to believe that it is indeed an research and development lab for Siri. While the sign doesn't include any text to confirm that the lab is used for Siri research and development
column10: it does at least confirm that the tech company owns the location.Check out more recentApple RumorsorSubscribe to Apple Rumors:RSSThe postWednesday Apple Rumors: 2016 MacBook Pro Keyboard Problemsappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Why Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Needs a New Growth Driver;2/22/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe bull/bear argument for and againstApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) stock is pretty simple. AAPL stock bulls argue that the stock is simply too cheap. Apple is a great company
column3: with roughly $30 per share in net cash; yet Apple stock trades at basically 10x next year's earnings plus cash. Investors are acting as if Apple earnings will decline going forward - which makes no sense for what remains the world's most popular consumer goods company (and the world's most valuable stock).makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockBears reply
column4: in essence
column5: that AAPL stockshouldget a multiple befitting a declining company. As popular as the iPhone is
column6: competition is intense
column7: and only getting tougher.And as smartphones become more commoditized
column8: the edge that the iPhone has over
column9: say
column10: aSamsung(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) Galaxy - let alone Chinese competitors - will narrow. That should pressure pricing
column11: margins and Apple shares.With Apple stock at an all-time high
column12: the bulls are winning the argument at the moment. But from a long-term standpoint
column13: the bears have a point. AAPL may not be the next Gateway Computer
column14: but commoditization is a risk. Apple needs another growth driver to keep its stock rising over the long-term. The company hasn't quite found the right product yet; however
column15: and it's not sure what it will be.Apple Stock Has Been Valued Based on the iPhoneIt's not hard to come to the conclusion that AAPL stock is directly correlated to iPhone sales. It was iPhone-driven optimism that drove Apple shares from under $100 (pre-split; equivalent to ~$12.50 now) in 2009 to $100 by 2012. Since then
column16: Apple stock has declined sharply twice.The 10 Best Stocks to Buy and Hold ForeverThe first time was in 2013. In fiscal 2013 (AAPL fiscal years end in September)
column17: the iPhone growth rate slowed sharply: iPhone unit sales growth dropped from 73% in FY12 to 20.2% in FY13
column18: and those fears knocked down Apple shares. The second decline came in between 2015 and 2016
column19: during a year where iPhone revenuedropped12% year-over-year on an 8% decrease in unit sales.Looking backwards
column20: it certainly seems like AAPL stock is driven by sentiment toward the iPhone. There's one key reason for that: the rest of Apple has been consistently
column21: and almost incredibly stagnant. Here's Apple revenue ex-iPhone sales over the last five fiscal years (per AAPL filings):2012: $77.8 billion2013: $79.6 billion2014: $80.8 billion2015: $78.7 billion2016: $78.9 billionObviously
column22: those sales have come from different sources. Mac revenues have been relatively stable
column23: in the $21 to $25 billion range. iPod sales have faded
column24: but have been offset by the modest growth in Apple Watch sales
column25: leaving ""other products"" revenues rather flat. iPad sales have fallen from $32 billion in FY13 to barely $20 billion last year; growth in services (iTunes
column26: Apple Music
column27: Apple Pay
column28: etc.) has offset that decline.But the point is that
column29: other than the iPhone
column30: Apple stock really isn't a growth stock. In fact
column31: it looks a lot like the bears view Apple as a whole. And that raises the question of if AAPL can become a true growth stock
column32: and drive upside from its current all-time highs.But AAPL Stock Needs Another HitAt this point
column33: I wouldn't bet against AAPL stock
column34: but I'm skeptical the company can really drive growth beyond the iPhone. A simple breakdown of the ~$79 billion in trailing twelve-month non-iPhone revenue shows there really isn't much in the pipeline. $23 billion (30%) comes from Mac notebooks and desktops. That's a great
column35: high-margin product
column36: but overall desktop/notebook sales are declining and Mac revenue declined 10% in FY16 (it did rise 7% in Q1 FY17); $19 billion (24%) comes from the iPad.Those sales are declining
column37: falling 23% in FY15
column38: 11% in FY16 and a concerning 22% in Q1. Services revenue is double what it was after FY12
column39: and drives about one-third of non-iPhone revenue. But those businesses still comprise just ~12% of total sales.Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Is Itching to Break All-Time HighsOther products make up the rest of non-iPhone revenue
column40: with that segment including Beats headphones
column41: Apple TV
column42: the iPod (yes
column43: Apple still sells them) and
column44: of course
column45: Apple Watch. Apple Watch has been cited as a potential driver for AAPL stock
column46: but Apple still doesn't break out revenue. CEO Tim Cook did say on the AAPL Q1 earnings call that Watch sales hit an all-time high in the December quarter.But ""other products"" sales over the last four quarters still are under $11 billion. That's about 5% of total revenue. And Apple Watch is only a portion of those sales.iPhone Reliance Could Hurt Apple StockAnd that's the key problem for Apple stock at the highs
column47: in my opinion. The iPhone is so dominant that everything else pares in comparison. The Apple Watch would be considered a success for nearly every company on Earth. But its revenue over the last year is probably
column48: at best
column49: in the range of $6 billion. Over the same period
column50: the iPhone generated$139 billionin revenue.The point is that AAPL stock remains indistinguishable from the iPhone. Apple Watch
column51: Apple Pay
column52: Beats and other ancillary products are good products
column53: and drive excellent sales. But the iPhone is such a phenomenon that they almost don't matter - and it's almost impossible to create a product that can drive anywhere near that level of success. And I believe that creates a long-term risk for AAPL stock
column54: even if that risk isn't playing out at the moment.As of this writing
column55: Vince Martin did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceThe 10 Best Oil Stocks to Buy Now for Big-Time Gains7 S&P 500 Stocks Poised For Explosive GrowthThe postWhy Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Needs a New Growth Driverappeared first onInvestorPlace."
