column1: 4 Stocks at 52-Week Highs That Are Still Worth Buying Today;2/22/2017;"While we Fools are generally bargain hunters
column2: we recognize   that some companies are so fantastic that it can make sense to   buy them while they're on the upswing. With that in mind
column3: we   asked a team of Fools to each highlight a stock trading near its   52-week that is still worth buying today. Read on to see why they   selectedVisa(NYSE: V)
column4: Brookfield Infrastructure Partners(NYSE: BIP)
column5: Paycom Software(NYSE: PAYC)
column6: andApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) .Charge ahead with this payment-network giantDan Caplinger(Visa):Financial stocks have skyrocketed since the presidential election   in November
column7: as investors hope that deregulation in the banking   and investment industry will lead to faster growth and new   prospects for business expansion in the months and years ahead.   Yet Visa stands to win in a couple of ways
column8: and it's better   positioned to prosper no matter what happens to the global   economy and the state of regulation in the U.S. financial   industry going forward.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Unlike banks
column9: Visa carries no credit risk with its payment   network. Instead
column10: it simply takes a small cut of transactions   using its infrastructure
column11: and as more people use electronic   payments to make purchases
column12: Visa has carved out its share of the   growing market.There are a couple of reasons to be bullish on Visa even after   its big share-price gains. First
column13: most indications suggest that   the economic expansion is continuing in the U.S.
column14: and that should   spur greater consumer activity that can help contribute to   greater overall purchase and transaction volumes. Also
column15: Visa   recently acquired Visa Europe
column16: reintegrating its global   operations and putting it in a position to benefit from   recoveries elsewhere in the world. Combine that with emerging   market economies where consumers are only now starting to adopt   electronic payments
column17: and you can see how Visa could continue to   make progress despite already having rewarded shareholders with   25% gains over the past year.Riding high but undervaluedMatt DiLallo(Brookfield Infrastructure Partners):Units of Brookfield Infrastructure Partners are up more than 50%   over the past year
column18: recently hitting a new 52-week high. Fueling   that growth was the company's strong showing in 2016 when it grew   funds from operations (FFO) by 17% after completing a slew of   growth projects and acquisitions. Those strategic growth   initiatives enabled the company to increase its distribution by   11% for 2017.The company still has plenty of growth left in the pipeline.   In fact
column19: it has added $1.4 billion in new organic projects to its   backlog and is close to closing three more acquisitions. These   new additions have the potential to drive FFO up double digits   again this year if everything goes according to plan
column20: well   ahead of the company's long-term guidance for 5% to 9% annual FFO   growth.That said
column21: despite the robust growth in the pipeline
column22: Brookfield's units trade for a higher yield compared to its   peers. Because of that
column23: Brookfield believes the market has   significantly undervalued its units. In fact
column24: as the following   slide suggests
column25: units would trade for around $50 if the market   valued its yield closer to the peer group average:Image source: Brookfield Infrastructure Partners Investor     Presentation.While units aren't quite as undervalued as they had been
column26: they're still a bargain compared to what Brookfield believes   they're worth. That suggests the potential for more upside on the   horizon
column27: especially as the company continues building and buying   assets that grow its cash flow and distribution. Speaking of   which
column28: at a nearly 5% yield
column29: investors get paid a pretty penny   while waiting for the market to wake up and realize that   Brookfield still trades at a hefty discount.A boring but mission-critical serviceBrian Feroldi(Paycom Software):I don't know many people that would show up at work if they   weren't receiving a paycheck. Employers certainly know this
column30: too
column31: which is why they take payroll processing so seriously. And yet
column32: legacy payroll systems can be a big hassle to deal with since   they generally don't play well with other HR systems.Chad Richinson certainly understands this dilemma
column33: which is   why he founded Paycom Software back in 1998. His solution was to   create a software system that handled multiple HR functions from   a single
column34: cloud-based system
column35: thereby making it far more   attractive to employers.Paycom's solution has proven to be a big hit with small and   medium-sized businesses everywhere. The company now counts more   than 17
column36: 800 clients on its platform. With more employers signing   on every day
column37: Paycom's revenue and profits have been soaring.Paycom'sstrong growth rateshave certainly caught Wall Street's attention
column38: pushing its   stock to a fresh 52-week high. Taking a closer look at the   company's performance
column39: it is not hard to figure out why Wall   Street is excited. Revenue grew by 35% and exceeded expectations.   Net income soared by 80% and also blasted past analyst's   projections. Customer retention rates remain strong
column40: and   management is guiding for revenue growth of nearly 30% in   2017.While Paycom's stock is most certainly pricey -- the company's   trailing PE ratio is 71 -- I can't help but feel that the   blistering revenue growth and soaring profitability more than   justify its high valuation. That puts Paycom high on my shopping   list
column41: even though shares have already enjoyed a great run.Apple is still a screaming buyTravis Hoium(Apple):Critics can criticize Apple's level of innovation or the   design of the new iPhone or Macs
column42: but it's tough to criticize the   company's incredible earnings machine. The company has a net cash   balance of $158.5 million and in the last year earned $45.2   billion. And the company doesn't show any sign of letting up its   earnings power.The iPhone has become such a powerful device that customers   are locked into the Apple ecosystem almost from the moment they   buy one. And owning an iPhone makes customers more likely to buy   a Mac
column43: Apple TV
column44: iPad
column45: or even AirPods. The fact that everything   works together so well
column46: and operating system updates come   regularly is incredibly valuable if you've ever tried using   competitors like Android or Samsung's Smart TV operating   system.With Apple's shares at a 52-week high
column47: the stock isn't as   attractive as it was a few months ago
column48: and the 1.7% dividend   yield won't wow most investors. But shares still only trade at 16   times trailing earnings
column49: and that's without considering the   $158.5 billion in net cash on the balance sheet. The iPhone is   also showing no signs of slowing down as a technology powerhouse
column50: and the ecosystem of products and apps surrounding the smartphone   will generate value for Apple for the foreseeable future. Even as   the largest company in the world

column1: Tech Stock Roundup: FB TV App
column2: AAPL Original Content;2/22/2017;"Technology stocks had a relatively quiet week although there were increased signs that companies like FacebookFBand AppleAAPLwere getting more serious about not just content acquisition but also content creation. While this may not be in direct competition with NetflixNFLXit does look like competition for Alphabet'sGOOGLYouTube
column3: Spotify and PandoraP. It's also definitely competition for eyeballs in what is limited free time for all-Facebook TV AppFacebook has launched a new TV app for Amazon Fire TV
column4: Apple TV and Samsung Smart TV
column5: with possible plans to further expand to other platforms like Microsoft Xbox
column6: Sony PlayStation and other streaming devices. While this will likely enable/support longer video formats
column7: Facebook has said its intention is not to compete with Netflix but rather to enable Facebook users to watch their preferred video on just about any screen of their choice (and that includes TV screens).Of course that's not the only video announcement Facebook made. The company says that henceforth
column8: videos will play automatically with the sound turned on by default (if the device sound is turned on) and the window will retreat to the bottom corner of the screen so you can keep watching the video while scrolling through your newsfeed. Facebook says that testing is showing a positive reaction from users
column9: although it's obvious that not everyone will be overjoyed.Facebook is also reportedly in talks with music labels to bring their content to the app
column10: which seems like an open challenge to YouTube
column11: Google's competing site. For labels
column12: the new distribution channel will increase their leverage against YouTube for more favorable terms. On the flip side
column13: the chances of piracy will increase given the nature of Facebook's free platform.The increased scope for advertising is also an indication that the company is gearing up to grab its share of TV ad dollars.Apple Getting Ready to Debut Reality ShowEddie Cue
column14: Apple's SVP of Internet software and services used the Recode Media Conference to express a lot of enthusiasm for Apple's soon-to-be released ""Planet of the Apps"" reality show on its music subscription service. Contestants will get 60 seconds to explain their idea on an escalator and could win up to millions in venture capital funding if judges will.i.am
column15: Jessica Alba
column16: Gary Vaynerchuk and Gwyneth Paltrow approve. This is the first attempt by Apple to create original content and will likely be joined by Carpool Karaoke in April (Apple bought out the unscripted version of this show in the summer of last year).Google Fiber RestructuringAlphabet has been trimming staff at its Access unit
column17: which is responsible for its high-speed Internet service called Fiber. But last week
column18: the trimming was more in the nature of hacking as it transferred hundreds of employees to other units
column19: retaining just enough to work in the field. The unit also has a new CEO in Greg McCray
column20: who was formerly CEO of Aero Communications and currently also serves on the board of telecom company CenturyLink.The changes while significant are not really surprising
column21: because Google has had a lot of trouble with Fiber not only because of the expense but also because of tussles with telecom companies over their control on telecom poles. In fact
column22: ever since its acquisition of WebPass last year
column23: speculation has been rife that the company will replace or reduce fiber deployment with a cheaper wireless service. That plan seems to have crystallized now as Google cuts staff but remains committed to expanding its Fiber service.CompanyLast WeekLast  6 MonthsAAPL+2.36%+22.12%FB+2.45%+7.12%GOOGL+1.79%+3.68%MSFT+0.50%+10.23%INTC-3.23%+0.86%CSCO+0.61%+1.61%AMZN+2.12%+7.94%Other stories you might have missed-CorporateAussie Banks Respond to Apple Statement: In response to Apple's contention that the Commonwealth Bank of Australia
column24: National Australia Bank Ltd.
column25: Westpac Banking Corp. and Bendigo & Adelaide Bank Ltd were looking for a free ride
column26: they have told the Australian Competition & Consumer Commission (ACCC) that on the contrary
column27: Apple's policies attempted to prevent competition in wallets. Because if Apple allowed them access to its NFC antenna
column28: they would pledge their participation in the Apple Pay rollout.Australian law allows such collective bargaining
column29: provided it is approved by the government. In its draft ruling
column30: the ACCC denied the banks' request. The final ruling is expected in March and in the meantime
column31: the Australian Retailers Association have backed the banks
column32: making their own submission that the collective negotiations would be beneficial for ""all banks
column33: merchants
column34: app developers and ultimately customers in Australia and overseas.""Facebook Seeks Independent Media Audit: Facebook has agreed to be audited by Media Rating Council
column35: an industry body that advertisers trust for ad measurement metrics. Ad prices on the social network have been rising despite the fact that Facebook has repeatedly come out with statements seeking to rectify viewership numbers.The company has therefore been under slight pressure to mend relationships with advertisers. The agreement should increase transparency and instill confidence in advertisers
column36: which are directly responsible for its bread and butter.Mark Zuckerberg Talks: The Facebook CEO wrote a long-winded essay sharing his long-term vision for the social network that mainly covered the importance of a global community in an increasingly individualistic world. The purpose of the ""mission statement"" wasn't really clear since most government bodies in the U.S. and elsewhere don't have a problem with people connecting on the social network and there aren't any bans as such on people connecting even if they later turn out to be terrorists. Of course Facebook has access to a boatload of data on people that governments might ask for (as they have been doing).New Technology/ProductsFacebook Gets into Recruitment Services: Facebook has found another use for its sprawling network: it is now connecting employers with employees. While LinkedIn (now part of Microsoft) has been around for a while
column37: the site is more popular with higher-income groups. Facebook on the other hand has people from every walk of life and employers of every kind on its network
column38: so it's in a very good position to corner a much larger section of the market than LinkedIn ever reached.Google Loon Tech Improves: Google's Project Loon may get to market sooner now that the company has found a way of moving them more efficiently. According to a blog post from Astro Teller
column39: head of its moonshots division called Google X
column40: the company now has the algorithms necessary to direct groups of balloons from their point of launch to their points of deployment (remote area where Internet access is required) within a few weeks. Earlier this took a few months.The announcement was made after the company successfully launched its Internet beaming balloons from Puerto Rico and directed them towards Peru. The loon project is already testing in Sri Lanka and Peru although testing in Indonesia
column41: the other country that has approved the project
column42: is yet to commence.Amazon Echo
column43: Google Home Taking Calls: The home automation devices from Google and AmazonAMZNmay soon be equipped with phone calling capabilities according to the WSJ
column44: which cited its sources. The idea is to keep users away from their phones as much as possible when in the house
column45: so they don't get distracted into using other services like Facebook. Or maybe it's just to help people get their calls even when they have both hands full.AWS Launches Chime: Amazon's AWS has launched a video conferencing software suite called Chime that competes with Microsoft's Skype for Business
column46: Cisco's WebEx and others. Other than the basic version for which it doesn't charge
column47: a Plus version with IT admin tools and screen-sharing comes for $2.50 per user per month and a Pro version that supports upto 100 attendees at $15. Microsoft charges $5 and $12.50 for the Office 365 Business Essentials and Business Premium packages
column48: respectively. Cisco charges $69 on the basis of the number of hosts
column49: irrespective of the number of attendees.HP-Sure Click: HP has collaborated with Bromium to introduce a hardware based security solution for unsafe Internet browsing. The solution
column50: called HP Sure Click is activated every time a user accesses the browser
column51: which then isolates the browsing session from other files/documents. So if malware or other malicious software opens up
column52: other tabs or the system itself remains uninfected.M&A and CollaborationsMicrosoft Collaborates with India's Tata Motors: The two companies have inked a technology collaboration deal that will see MicrosoftMSFTdeliver its connected vehicle technologies (artificial intelligence
column53: machine learning
column54: IoT) through Azure. In exchange
column55: Tata Motors customers will have a better experience
column56: whether by way of location-based points of interest
column57: shopping centers or route assistance
column58: or things like information on road conditions
column59: vehicle health
column60: etc.Some NumbersGoogle Leads in Digital Travel Ads: Based in part on a meeting with industry research firm Skift

column62: i.e. it will never compete in travel fulfillment (including distribution and customer service). Skift estimates that Google accounted for 90% of travel ads in 2016
column63: generating $12 billion in revenue. The biggest spenders on Google are Priceline
column64: Expedia and TripAdvisor.Just Released - Driverless Cars: Your Roadmap to   Mega-Profits TodayIn this latest Special Report

column1: Apple Park: Apple Inc (AAPL) Sets Grand Opening for ‘Spaceship’ Campus;2/22/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) is almost done with its Apple Park campus and is planning to start letting employees in soon.makeArticleAd();Source:FlickrApple Inc. says that it will be ready to start moving employees to the ""Spaceship"" campus in April. The tech company notes that construction will still continue on the Apple Park campus into the summer. It also expects it to take about six months to move the 12
column3: 000 employees from its old campus to the new one.While the Apple Park will finally be ready to open in April
column4: Apple Inc. hasn't set down a definitive date for the grand opening. However
column5: it did announce the naming of the location's new theatre. It will be named after AAPL co-founder Steve Jobs
column6: who passed away in 2011.The Apple Park was part of Steve Jobs' vision. He was determined to make a campus that would allow employees to be more creative and achieve their ideas. The location takes an area previously filled with asphalt and covers it with green meadows
column7: drought-resistant trees and more.One of the major design aspects of the Apple Park that sticks out is the main campus. This building is circular in shape
column8: thus the Spaceship nickname. It is also made up of the largest sections of curved glass in the world. The building is 2.8 million square feet in size.Another interesting feature of the Apple Park is that it will run entirely off of renewable energy. This includes 17 megawatts of rooftop solar. The building is also designed with natural ventilation that should allow it to go for nine months per year without any heating or air conditioning.More From InvestorPlace7 Ultra-Cheap Value Stocks to Buy Now7 Tech Stocks That Could Implode at Any Minute9 Top Pharmaceutical Stocks to Buy for the DividendsThe postApple Park: Apple Inc (AAPL) Sets Grand Opening for 'Spaceship' Campusappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: The Benefits Of Investing In Companies With A High Rate Of Discretionary Disclosure;2/22/2017;"ByStefano De Caterina:Corporate disclosure and shareholders' value     creationThe positive outcomes of discretionary disclosure are various   and can benefit both companies and their shareholders. I will   focus here on the benefits for the latter.Whilst the mandatory disclosure is imposed by legislation or   regulation (i.e. the Sarbanes-Oxley Act in the U.S. and the   European Transparency Directive in the E.U.)
column2: the discretionary   disclosure consists of any additional information a company's   management intends to provide the investors with.makeArticleAd();Most of the studies show that a disclosure increase creates   value for the shareholders. For instance
column3: a study conducted by   Standard & Poor's shows (see the chart below) that companies   with higher transparency and disclosure (measured by the S&P   transparency score) have a higher P/BV ratio.Source: Standard & Poor'sThe S&P transparency score takes into account the quantity   of disclosure: the more information is given (i.e. information   about ownership structure and shareholders' rights
column4: information   about board and management process
column5: financial and operational   information)
column6: the higher the score is. The same research also   proves that firms with high disclosure and transparency have a   lower market risk as showed in the chart below:Source: Standard & Poor'sOther studies focusing on events such as the introduction of   regulation (i.e. the Sarbanes-Oxley Act) also verified and   confirmed that disclosure either mandatory or discretionary   creates value for the shareholders.A crucial role in conveying the disclosure to the investor is   played by the Investor Relations.The National Investor Relations Institute (NIRI) defines the   Investor Relations as the:""Strategic management responsibility that integrates       finance
column7: communication
column8: marketing and securities law       compliance to enable the most effective two-way communication       between a company
column9: the financial community
column10: and other       constituencies
column11: which ultimately contributes to a company's       securities achieving fair valuation"".Based on this definition
column12: we can assume that if a company   supplies its shareholders with a complete
column13: timely
column14: reliable
column15: punctual and adequate flow of financial information related to   its business
column16: it will definitely help investors make better   investment decisions and allow its stock price to align   progressively with its fair value.In this sense
column17: investor relations help share prices to achieve   a fair valuation. Value gaps between market value and fair value   tend to diminish because investors believe management can   accomplish what it says through the disclosure(management credibility).A flat or negative quarter will not be an automatic sell   signal because investors will seek for explanations by the   management and
column18: when convinced that fundamentals are still strong   and growing
column19: they will be more likely to hold their shares or   even increase their positions because they trust the company's   management and
column20: today more than ever
column21: in the fallout of financial   crisis
column22: markets run more on trust than money. As a matter of   fact
column23: the 2008 financial crisis and the ensuing five years of   economic turmoil clearly revealed the insufficiency of   disclosures
column24: especially in the case of financial   institutions.More transparencyFirst of all
column25: making more financial information available   means more transparency for its investors who can make more   appropriate and accurate investment decisions based on a larger   amount of data to evaluate and compare.Voluntary disclosure decreases the investor's information   asymmetry to the extent of its usefulness. The degree of its   usefulness depends on its relevance
column26: reliability
column27: timeliness
column28: and   clarity.Moreover
column29: the market tends to value more companies presenting   clear and easy-to-understand financial statements than those   filing complex and opaque ones.Many are the communication channels through which investor   relations can convey the company's disclosure to the financial   community. The main channels employed are the press releases
column30: investor and analyst meetings
column31: earnings guidelines
column32: investor   presentations
column33: and the Investor Relations page on the company's   website.Investors are often concerned not with past earnings
column34: but   rather with future ones
column35: thus the way a company communicates that   financial information through the communication channels   mentioned above might convince or not the investors to buy its   stocks.In addition
column36: investing in businesses which implement an   effective voluntary disclosure policy means investing into firms   managed by credible and reliable managers; in other words
column37: transparency leads to credibility and trust.More liquidityThe implementation of an effective disclosure policy aimed to   reduce the information asymmetries between management and   investors will entail a higher liquidity of the shares and   increase the company's visibility
column38: thereby attracting more   analysts to cover the stock and more institutional investors to   buy the company's shares whose price will eventually go up with a   clear and obvious advantage for all the investors.A more liquid stock also means a reduced bid-offer spread (the   empirical measure of market liquidity) for the investors
column39: which   means a cheaper cost of trading. In conclusion
column40: an effective   disclosure policy reduces information asymmetry and increases   liquidity in the equity market.Lower debtIncreased liquidity also brings about a lower cost of capital
column41: thus the company will have to bear a smaller burden of debt
column42: which is great news for the company's investors.The majority of studies have confirmed that the cost of   capital decreases as the company's risk perception dissipates   within the market and
column43: as a consequence
column44: the firm will be able   not only to finance its investments at a lower cost
column45: but also   raise equity capital more easily. Ultimately
column46: disclosure   facilitates external financing
column47: investments
column48: and growth
column49: which   will be eventually reflected in the rise of the stock price.By no surprise
column50: the leading IT consulting firm Infosys (INFY) ranking among the three top companies for disclosure on its   domestic market (BSE100) has approximately a 5.90% weighted   average cost of capital vs. a 45.20% return on invested capital.   In other words it can generate excess returns on the investments   7.6 times more than its cost of capital. Besides that
column51: Infosys   can sport a 10-year track record of consistent growth in sales
column52: profits
column53: free cash flow and dividends.Stock price appreciation and lower volatilityFirms with high levels of disclosure have a higher association   with stock price increase than those with low levels of   information disclosure.A very interesting study published in the ""Financial Management"" journal compares an investment made in high-disclosure   companies with an investment made in low-disclosure companies
column54: and it shows that the high-disclosure portfolio outperforms the   low-disclosure portfolio by an average of 7% per year over a   period of 14 years.Other studies have proved that more transparent firms benefit   from a reduction in the volatility of returns which for the   investors means less risk and more stable returns over time.The increase of liquidity attracts more institutional   investors who generate more volume and therefore push the stocks'   price up. In addition
column55: the increase of the analyst coverage and   the set up of target prices might also contribute in putting   further upwards pressure on the stocks' price.Thestatus quoof disclosure and transparency in the corporate worldIn 2014 Transparency International ((TI))
column56: the watchdog that monitors the international corruption among   countries and corporations published a ranking of the top 10 most   transparent companies and the least transparent firms in the   world among the 124 largest publicly-listed companies based on an   index which takes into account anti-corruption programs adopted   by the ranked companies and their overall organizational   transparency. Seven of the top companies are from Europe while   eight of the bottom 10 companies are from Asia.(click to enlarge)(click to enlarge)TI also published a report whose findings are very interesting   but also surprising.In terms of sectors
column57: telecoms and oil/gas companies lead the   way whilst consumer services
column58: financial
column59: tech and healthcare   firms are the least transparent. Geographically
column60: EU companies   score highest in organizational transparency with an average of   54% and U.S. firms score the lowest at 24%.U.S. tech giants Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN)
column61: Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL)
column62: Google (GOOG) (NASDAQ:GOOGL) and IBM (NYSE:IBM) all score less than three out of 10.Another American famous firm
column63: Berkshire Hathaway (NYSE:BRK.A) (BRK.B)
column64: Warren Buffett's conglomerate
column65: also had a bad   performance
column66: ranking among the last 10.""Tech companies are driving changes that are making our   societies more open and accountable. They should be setting an   example for other companies on transparency"" said Cobus de   Swardt
column67: TI's managing director.The report also shows the positive impact of strong   legislation
column68: with U.K. companies scoring 90% on average compared   to 20% in China.According to the report
column69: financial sector companies still   should be more transparent and accountable to the public if they   want to win back public trust which is yet faltering.The report urges multinational companies to seek more   transparency by disclosing the subsidiaries through which they   operate in different countries which are often impossible to   trace. Obtaining this information through a country-by-country   report is important since it would help people understand the   impact of multinational companies in their own country. In   addition
column70: through a full disclosure of corporate holdings
column71: investors can gain more knowledge of financial flows such as   intra-company transfers and payments to governments.While all the evaluated German companies disclose all their   subsidiaries abroad
column72: no Chinese company discloses any financial   data in any of the 59 foreign countries where they operate.In the country-by-country disclosure ranking
column73: more than 50   companies scored an embarrassing 0% and only three performed   above the 50% level
column74: the pre-tax profits being the least   disclosed financial information while the revenues being the most   disclosed. Amazon
column75: Apple
column76: Google and IBM all fail to publish a   full list of countries in which their subsidiaries operate.The watchdog in its report also highlights the importance for   the investors to be aware of the anti-corruption policies   established by the companies they want to invest in since this   information will help them evaluate better the risk associated   with the investment. U.K. companies perform best on   anti-corruption whilst Chinese and Japanese companies are the   poorest performers in both dimensions.In conclusion
column77: investing in companies with a high rate of   discretionary disclosure and transparency can dramatically   increase the overall shareholders' value and substantially reduce   the risk associated with the investment.See alsoThe iShares MSCI Malaysia ETF Is A Speculative Buyon seekingalpha.com"

column1: Could Apple Inc. (AAPL) Be The First Ever $1 Trillion Company?;2/22/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsI stumbled across a prediction last week that would impress even Mad Money's Jim Cramer.makeArticleAd();According to a recent report from Oxfam
column3: an international charitable organization
column4: Bill Gates has a shot at becoming the world's first trillionaire. Oxfam speculates that if the returns on the tech mogul's $75 billion fortune in the next 25 years are similar to those in the last 25 years
column5: Gates has a shot at jumping the $1 trillion mark.That got me thinking
column6: if one man has a shot at becoming a trillionaire
column7: certainly one of theS&P 500′s biggest companies has a shot at becoming the world's first $1 trillion company?Turns out
column8: a few do.I see five S&P 500 companies with a shot at breaking the $1 trillion mark in the next five years.-Facebook Inc(FB) is the smallest company on the list with a market cap of $386 billion. Facebook's share price would need to hit $345
column9: up 159%.-Amazon.com
column10: Inc.(AMZN) has a market cap of $400 billion. Shares would need to hit $1
column12: up 125%.-Microsoft Corporation(MSFT) has a market cap of $498 billion. Shares would need to hit $130
column13: up 100%.-Alphabet Inc(GOOG) is currently worth $570 billion. Shares would need to hit $1
column15: up 70%.I believe every one of these companies will eventually be worth $1 trillion. However
column16: one other company will beat them all to it.Thanks to a variety of factors
column17: Apple Inc.(AAPL) is set to become the first $1 trillion company in the world in the next five years.The company has been on a roll. After beating fourth-quarter earnings by 4%
column18: shares just hit a new all-time high above $135.That gives Apple a market cap of $710 billion
column19: making it the largest company in the S&P 500. It has also placed Apple within striking distance of the $1 trillion mark. Shares of Apple would only need to climb 50% to $200 to give it a market cap of $1 trillion.7 Tech Stocks With Explosive Growth PotentialThat is well within reach.If its current valuation stayed the same
column20: Apple would need to grow earnings by 8% annually in the next five years to hit that target. As it stands
column21: Apple is expected to grow earnings by 8% this year and another 13% in 2018. Those two years alone get Apple almost half way to 50% earnings growth.But even if Apple's earnings grow slower than expected
column22: it has an ace up its sleeve.Apple Has $246 Billion In Cash On Its Balance SheetApple's cash position is larger than the GDP of most countries. In recent fourth-quarter results
column23: Apple's reported a cash position of $246 billion. Some of that cash is already accounted for in Apple's $700 billion valuation. But not all of it.Using as little as half of its cash balance to repurchase shares adds another $125 billion to Apple's market cap.Apple's Is One Of The Most Undervalued Stocks In The S&P 500Apple is one of the most undervalued stocks in the S&P 500. Its forward P/E ratio of 15 is a discount to the S&P 500s 20. That lower valuation exists despite the fact that Apple is projected to grow earnings faster than the S&P 500 in the next five years.Technically speaking that means Apple should be trading with a higher P/E ratio than the S&P 500. If Apple traded with the same P/E ratio as the S&P 500
column24: shares would shares would climb 25%
column25: giving Apple a market cap of $887 billion.Warren Buffett Just Made A Huge Investment In AppleApple's pursuit of the $1 trillion threshold has attracted the attention of the world's greatest investor. In recent regulatory filings
column26: Berkshire revealed it had quadrupled its ownership in Apple to 57 million shares. Buffett's stake was worth approximately $6.6 billion at the end of 2016.With shares of Apple already up 17% on the year
column27: Buffett has pocketed a quick $1.1 billion gain in less than six weeks.7 Dividend Stocks for the Retirement You DeserveRisks To Consider:Apple has struggled to launch new hits in the last few years. Although sales growth in its most important product the iPhone is still strong
column28: Apple isn't the innovative company it was under Steve Jobs.Action To Take:Apple is on pace to become the world's first $1 trillion company. Even though shares are trading at an all-time high
column29: I see plenty of growth and gains ahead. Buy shares anywhere below the all-time high and hold until Apple becomes the first $1 trillion company in the world.Editor's Note:Tech companieshave a history of turning stockholders
column30: secretaries and even janitors into ""overnight"" millionaires.In 2017
column31: innovations in virtual reality will do the same for owners of these 2 stocks…StreetAuthority's mission is to help individual investors earn above-average profits by providing a source of independent

column34: StreetAuthority doesn't simply regurgitate the latest stock market news. Instead

column36: plus specific investment ideas and immediate action to take based on the latest market events. Visit us atStreetAuthority.com.More From InvestorPlace10 Super-Safe Dividend Growth Stocks to Buy Today7 Marvelous Mid-Cap Stocks to Buy for the Best of All WorldsThe postCould Apple Inc. (AAPL) Be The First Ever $1 Trillion Company?appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Is GoPro Inc. Stock a Buy After Its Earnings Sell-Off?;2/22/2017;"It's been a rough past few years forGoPro(NASDAQ: GPRO) stock. Surging to prominence in the   post-recession
column2: venture-capital-fueled ""age of the unicorn
column3: GoPro and its innovative action cameras initially drew   comparisons to a youngApple(NASDAQ: AAPL)
column4: the poster child a for successful   hardware-driven electronics business.That comparison has turned out to be optimistic
column5: to say the   least
column6: and GoPro shares have marched downward in the roughly two   years since its stock price bubble burst.makeArticleAd();GPROdata byYChartsAfter GoPro engaged in some painful restructuring in 2016
column7: its   earnings report earlier this month offered investors a glimpse   into what it sees around the bend for its business. Investors   responded by sending its shares southbound.But how low is too low? With its shares in the tank
column8: let's see   whether GoPro is finally cheap enough to deserve investors'   interest.GoPro earnings: What we learnedJust about everything that could go wrong for GoPro did in   2016. During its Q3 conference call
column9: the company alerted   investors to the production problems that affected the company's   then-forthcoming HERO5 Black action camera. The Q3 spillover   effect from its production issues hampered GoPro's ability to   supply enough HERO5 Black devices to some of its key retail   partners. These retailers
column10: in turn
column11: pulled promotional   support for the HERO5 Black
column12: which caused the company to capture   less holiday season demand than it had anticipated.Image source: GoProCompounding its problems
column13: GoPro encountered issues with the   launch of its much-touted Karma drone
column14: as problems with the latch   that held its battery in place caused the Karma to lose power in   midair. GoPro halted production of the Karma until a redesigned   latch could be introduced
column15: and that setback also led to   underwhelming Karma sales during the fourth quarter.The quarter wasn't without some positives
column16: though. For the   quarter
column17: sales rose 24% to $540.6 million
column18: the second largest   revenue total for a quarter in GoPro's 14 years in operation. The   company also enacted a major cost restructuring
column19: including   killing its GoPro Entertainment division and eliminating 200   full-time employees -- efforts that the company expects will   reduce its operating cost structure by $100 million annually to   an annual run rate below $600 million.In the year ahead
column20: GoPro plans to focus its efforts on a small   handful of initiatives
column21: including increasing its emphasis on its   image-editing software
column22: Quik; expanding its brand reach by   creating new ways to engage its user base; growing   internationally; and continuing to create compelling hardware.   All of this sounds encouraging
column23: in theory. However
column24: I'm still not   sold that the company's new strategic vision and increasing focus   on execution are enough to create a sustainably profitable   business.Still skepticalGoPro's strategy makes perfect sense. Creating new types of   devices
column25: like the Karma
column26: and attempting to create an end-to-end   software and hardware ecosystem should help expand the breadth   and depth of its business footprint. This strategy mirrors the   closed ecosystem that Apple has employed to such spectacular   results since the launch of the iPod. However
column27: GoPro's devices   differ from Apple's in a few important ways that reduce the   strength of GoPro's business model in comparison.Image source: GoPro.The first is the size of its addressable market. For the   iPhone
column28: Apple enjoys a potential addressable market of all   smartphone users -- which means billions of potential customers
column29: compared with the several million users who buy GoPro each year.   Moreover
column30: the smartphone's place as the Swiss Army knife of our   digital lives makes it an essential tool for many consumers
column31: compared with the more recreational nature of GoPro's products.   Finally
column32: Apple's closed app ecosystem provides a far richer set   of user experiences than GoPro'sThe point here isn't just to compare and contrast Apple and   GoPro. Rather
column33: we're looking at the ways in which a consumer   hardware business model needs to differentiate itself to produce   meaningful profit. When it comes to the size of its market
column34: the   importance of its product to its users
column35: and the stickiness of its   software
column36: GoPro falls well short of Apple's template for   success.The analyst figures further bear this out. Wall Street's   estimates see GoPro generating single-digit sales growth and   continued net losses both this year and next. So while GoPro is   indeed employing a sensible strategy to improve its prospects
column37: investing in shares of the action-camera pioneer still seems like   a risky proposition.10 stocks we like better than GoProWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Garmin (GRMN)'s Remarkable Turnaround;2/22/2017;"Corporate turnarounds are a wonderful thing to behold
column2: but are quite rare
column3: particularly in certain industries. Consumer electronics
column4: for example
column5: is a business dominated by trends with phenomenal growth possible when something catches on. The flip side of that
column6: however
column7: is that when a brand loses its luster
column8: the decline is usually as rapid as the rise. That is what makes the turnaround achieved at Garmin (GRMN) so remarkable.As the below 5 year chart for the stock ably demonstrates
column9: from mid-2013 on GRMN was all the rage for a year or so. The company’s GPS navigation systems had dealt with some serious competition from other hand held devices and reached the point that manufacturers dream of
column10: where their brand name becomes synonymous with the product.The thing that people attached to their dashboard to give directions was
column11: to a large percentage of the population
column12: a Garmin
column13: regardless of the actual brand of the device.makeArticleAd();The stock reacted accordingly
column14: almost doubling in a year. The peak came at the end of June 2014
column15: and then just eighteen months later
column16: at the end of 2015
column17: GRMN was back around the $33 mark from which the rise began. At that time forecasts of the company’s demise were commonplace
column18: if a little premature.As Apple maps gained ground and built in navigation systems became standard in many cars
column19: dashboard GPS devices began to seem anachronistic. Throughout 2015
column20: Garmin posted negative year on year growth in both revenue and earnings and the stock was written off by many.Cliff Pemble
column21: the CEO of the company since 2013
column22: however
column23: had other ideas. He took a gamble and promoted a focus on wearable technology. At the time that was not seen as a smart move by many people. After all
column24: it meant taking on not just established companies in that area such as Fitbit (FIT)
column25: but also Apple (AAPL)
column26: who were moving into the watch business. If today’s release of Q4 2016 earnings is any guide
column27: though
column28: that opinion could not have been more wrong.Garmin reported big beats on revenue ($860.8 million vs. $800 million estimated) and Earnings per Share (73 cents vs. 58 cents estimated). Even more significantly in many ways
column29: they also boosted their revenue outlook for 2017 to above current Wall Street estimates
column30: and said that it was growth in the wearables area that was in large part driving the performance.GRMN had already gained around twenty three percent over the past year
column31: but jumped another nine percent or so in early trading this morning as a result of those numbers.It could be argued that as a result of that
column32: any value that there may have been in the stock is now gone. A quick glance at the usual valuation metrics would support that view
column33: but the long term case for GRMN is a little more subtle. As I said earlier
column34: turnarounds of this magnitude are rare anywhere
column35: but especially so in consumer electronics. The fact that Pemble was able to engineer this one
column36: though
column37: is a very good reason to own the stock.Recognizing the fact that the market was changing and making changes to adjust for those changes took a lot of guts
column38: but also demanded skilled execution. That combination of being prepared to take calculated risks and having the skill to execute a turnaround effectively is exactly what investors should look for in a CEO
column39: and the knowledge that at Garmin there is a management team that fits that bill is enough to make GRMN a good long term investment."

column1: 3 Warren Buffett Dividend Stocks to Buy;2/22/2017;"Warren Buffett ownsApple Inc.(NASDAQ: AAPL)

His stake   is particularly significant because it suggests Buffett   believes there's been a fundamental change in an industry that he   once labeled as a ""terrible"" industry for investors.Perhaps Buffett's change of heart is due to an industry wide   shift in how airlines approach their business. In the past
column24: airlines increased the number of routes they offered and competed   fiercely on price. Today
column25: they focus on fewer routes and fuller   flights

column30: and with economists   predicting GDP and personal income growth in 2017

column37: bigger profitsWells Fargo is Berkshire Hathaway's second biggest position

column39: shares have recovered their losses and are   trading near 52-week highs.Wells Fargo's rebound has a lot to do with the Fed's   increasingly hawkish approach to interest rates.Over the past few years
column40: the spread between bank lending rates   and borrowing costs has been hamstrung by rock-bottom fed funds   rates and government bond buying programs that have depressed   Treasury yields. Recently

column1: Intel Corporation's 5G Apple Inc. iPhone Opportunity;2/22/2017;"Microprocessor giantIntel(NASDAQ: INTC) surprised many when it was revealed that it had   won a significant portion of the cellular modem orders forApple's(NASDAQ: AAPL) iPhone 7 series smartphones.The company's public commentary suggests that this isn't just   a proverbial flash in the pan
column2: either -- Intel seems to have theiPhone 8(or whatever Apple calls the follow-on devices to this year's   iPhone 7 series) as well as thefollow-on to thatin the bag.Image source: Apple.makeArticleAd();In this article
column3: I'd like to go over why I think there's an   opportunity for Intel to gain dollar content share at Apple with   the 2018 iPhone.The shift to 5GBoth Intel and wireless chip giantQualcommboth intend to sample 5G modems in 2017 with commercial   shipments beginning in 2018.To my knowledge
column4: both companies' 5G modem solutions will   require separate 4G LTE modems (either as discrete parts or   integrated in the smartphone applications processor) for phones   implementing the 5G solution to work on today's 4G networks.Apple was late to adopt LTE relative to some of its peers in   the smartphone market
column5: but given that Apple has ""grown up"" quite   a bit from a technical perspective (substantially higher research   and development budget) and the industry has gottenmuchmore competitive (forcing Apple to try to adopt cutting-edge   technology for its devices)
column6: it may be one of the first to deploy   5G modems.Intel's opportunityShould Apple choose to adopt 5G functionality in its 2018   iPhone models
column7: this could be a solid win for Intel's cellular   modem business.Indeed
column8: if Intel goes from selling a single LTE baseband (and   associated components) to selling both an LTE baseband as well as   a 5G modem (and any additional components)
column9: then it makes sense   that the chipmaker's dollar content per iPhone could   increase.Given that Intel's only significant exposure to the large   smartphone chip market is via the sale of cellular modems to   Apple
column10: a big boost in dollar content at Apple should mean a big   boost in the revenue -- and ultimately profits -- that Intel can   harvest from the smartphone market.A big step for Intel's modem business
column11: a small step for Intel   in totalIntel is an extremely large company
column12: generating nearly $60   billion in revenue during 2016. Intel's revenue run rate from   sales of modems to Apple is likely in the ballpark of $1 billion   per year (assume $10 per modem
column13: 100 million iPhone units with   Intel modems sold per year).If Intel were to see its dollar content rise by 50%
column14: then   roughly $1 billion in annual sales becomes $1.5 billion; a   doubling of dollar content would mean that $1 billion in annual   sales goes up to $2 billion.Of course
column15: Intel is already investing significantly to develop   these cellular modems
column16: so the more revenue that the company can   wring out of those investments
column17: the better. However
column18: any   potential revenue growth from additional dollar content in a   future iPhone isn't going to be a game changer for Intel   stock.To put things into perspective
column19: though
column20: few things have the   potential to move the needle for Intel stock -- what the company   needs to do (and has been doing) is looking to capitalize on as   many reasonably sized opportunities as possible in the hopes   that
column21: in aggregate
column22: they add up to enough additional revenue to   deliver revenue growth even as its largest business (personal   computer processors) declines.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: 3 Reasons Why Apple Isn't Buying Netflix;2/22/2017;"We'll never hear the end of the buyout buzz when it comes toNetflix(NASDAQ: NFLX) . As long as it remains the top dog in premium   video streaming and the niche is still booming there will always   be chatter about how good Netflix would look on the arm of a tech   or media giant.Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) is a potential buyer that comes up every so often
column2: and it did so again in aCNBC articlelast night. Anita Balakrishnan's piece argues that the   ""best argument"" for Apple buying Netflix is that App Store   spending on entertainment programs is soaring
column3: and the consumer   tech giant may as well nab the top dog to beef up its growing   services revenue.Don't wait up for a wedding invitation.makeArticleAd();A Motley Fool social media poll -- gauging investor opinions   on a potential deal between Apple and Netflix -- has ""No Chance""   as the runaway answer with 48% of the votes among four choices as   of last night.Will Apple buy Netflix in 2017?- The Motley Fool (@themotleyfool)February 22
column4: 2017Let's go over a few of the reasons why Apple buying Netflix   doesn't make a lot of sense.Apple buying Netflix? I've seenStranger Things. Image source: Netflix.1. Apple isn't going to play favoritesThe CNBC article leans ondata from Sensor Tower
column5: showing that the App Store's Entertainment category saw   spending soar 130% over the past year. Netflix's chunk of that   business is growing even faster
column6: going from $7.9 million in gross   revenue during the fourth quarter of 2015 to more than $58   million a year later. Netflix began monetizing subscriptions   through Apple's app marketplace during the fourth quarter of   2015.The growth may seem impressive
column7: but what will Apple be   telegraphing if it snaps up Netflix? Developers turn to mobile   marketplaces because of the level playing field. Fellow video   apps may not feel that the playing field is very level with the   top dog in Apple's arsenal.Apple has homegrown apps in streaming entertainment. However
column8: Apple Music is not the niche leader. Yes
column9: it did buy Beats Music
column10: but mostly for its headphones business. Apple buying Netflix   could shift development by other platforms away from iOS.2. Netflix may not move the needle at AppleApple has a ton of dough on its books. There is more than $246   billion in cash and marketable securities on its balance sheet
column11: and between a president that may relax repatriation rules and a   tech behemoth hungry for growth it may only be a matter of time   before Apple goes on a shopping spree.A purchase of Apple may seem to help with growth on the   surface. Apple's revenue declined 7.7% in fiscal 2016
column12: unlike   Netflix which saw its top line soar by 30.2% last year. However
column13: Netflix going from $6.8 billion to $8.8 billion last year would   only be a drop in the bucket at Apple which went from $233.7   billion to $215.6 billion. The combined company would have seen   its revenue decline 6.7% to $224.4 billion.An argument could be made that Apple could use Netflix as a   tool to drive hardware sales by making the service or some parts   of the platform exclusive to iOS and MacOS
column14: but that would also   likely shave the total revenue at Netflix.3. It's going to take a fat premium to nab NetflixThere are a couple of tech
column15: cable
column16: and media companies that   could take advantage of Netflix's competitive position
column17: and the   purchase would be dilutive in all cases. However
column18: it would   probably be a lot more dilutive to the buyer than it appears at   current market prices.There's no reason for Netflix to settle for a modest buyout   premium. This is a stock that was the S&P 500's biggest   gainer in 2013 and 2015
column19: more than doubling each year. It's up   another 15% less than a sixth of the way through 2017. How much   would you accept to punch out?Netflix is a great company in a great place
column20: but it's also a   hot stock -- and that's not the kind of situation where   shareholders will go along with a 20% to 30% premium. Apple is   one of the few companies with that kind of dough in its arsenal
column21: but you just know that Netflix will not come cheap. With a likely   drawn-out regulatory approval process if a deal were to be   announced
column22: Netflix would be right to command a lot of money to be   waiting in the wings while its stock has been one of the hottest   stocks over the past four years. Apple and Netflix make sense
column23: but it's just not going to happen.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Here’s Where Two Vocal Bulls Think Stocks Are Heading;2/22/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsU.S. equities are on a surprising rally and the voice of reason suggests that the current market rally has gone on quite far too fast.makeArticleAd();However
column3: investors have fewer reasons to believe in the prophets of doom because the rally is still going on strong. Two top Wall Street analysts have lent their voice to the bullish sentiments.This article seeks to explore where equities are actually headed amidst the din of unending stream of analysis from different commentators on the wisdom/foolishness of chasing the rally.Why are Investors Worried About Equities?If we were to go by the voice of 'reason' U.S. stocks should have been struggling to stay afloat since Donald Trump won a surprise victory during the 2016 election. Prior to the election
column4: Wall Street had largely been worried about the potential implications of a Trump presidency for the stock market.Analysts were worried that a Trump presidency could lead to an unprecedented level of uncertainty in the global market.Interestingly
column5: Trumpwon the electionand stocks have been on a massive rally ever since. The chart below shows how stocks have fared since Trump won the election last year until Wednesday February 15.The performance of U.S. equities was particularly bullish on Wednesday February 15. TheS&P 500marked 87 consecutive sessions through which it didn't record a 1% decline - the index has booked a decent gain of 9.80% since Trump's victory.7 Dividend Stocks for the Retirement You DeserveTheDow Jones Industrial Averageis up 12.43% since Trump's victory and it has crossed the elusive 20
column6: 000 mark. The tech-heavyNASDAQ Compositehas gained 12.05% since Trump's victory despite the fact that Trump has had some spats with some tech firms such asApple Inc.(AAPL) andAmazon.com
column7: Inc.(AMZN) during his campaign. The uptrend in the NASDAQ marks the seventh straight session of gains in the index.From the foregoing
column8: market bears have legitimately strong reasons to be worried about the fate of the market. The fact that stocks are rising when Wall Street analysts had largely expected it to fall is enough reason to be worried that the rally is too good to be true.In fact
column9: someLionexo binary optionstraders have started calling the current rally the ""Icarus Rally"" because it is resplendent of a Greek mythlogy in which Icarus flew started flying higher and higher on a wing of wax until he flew too close to the sun. Of course
column10: his wax wings melted and he crashed to his death - if the Icarus trade is true for equities
column11: stocks might eventually have a sharp and rapid correction into bear territory.These Two Wall Street Analysts Think Stocks Have a Way to Go…For NowThe first vocal analysts making strong argumentsin support of the current rallyin the market is Binky Chadha
column12: chief global strategist atDeutsche Bank. He submits that stocks are actually soaring because Trump's vocal nature provides a strong direction about the intents and plans of the current administration. He believes that the fact that Trump's words can help you know what he is planning per time removes much of the fears of uncertainties that Wall Street had forecasted under his government.Of course
column13: one can make strong arguments on both sides of the debate about whether Trump's policies are good or bad.Nonetheless
column14: the fact that he says what is on his mind eliminates uncertainty and you can then make informed trading and decisions in response to the government's plans and actions. Binky Chadha believes that the S&P 500 still has more room to soar. He expects the S&P 500 to reach 2600 by the end of year to mark 11% upside from the current price.Michael Hartnett
column15: chief investment strategist atBank of America Merrill Lynchis also vocal in his support for the bullish rally. He believes that U.S. equities still have more room to soar before the inevitable correction eventually begins. Hartnett's bullish stance is hinged on the thesis the current rally in stocks is already a self-fulfilling prophecy because the rally is attracting new investors and the inflow of funds from new investors is further fuelling the bullish sentiments in the market.7 Tech Stocks With Explosive Growth PotentialHartnett submits that U.S. indexes could record another 6% in gains as investors continue to pile into the market in order to book gains. In his words
column16: ""measuring fear is easier than measuring greed"" and greed will continue to drive the rally until the rally becomes unsustainable. He submits that the rally willend in a sharp reversal- when massive profit taking starts or when earnings fail to live up to expectations.The postHere's Where Two Vocal Bulls Think Stocks Are Headingappeared first onValueWalk.Many academics claim investing is a ""random walk."" We believe this to be only partially true. It is our core belief that value investing can outperform the market
column17: hence the name ""ValueWalk."" column1: Is Apple Stock a Buy Ahead of iPhone 8?;2/21/2017;"Apple's(NASDAQ: AAPL) upcoming iPhone 8 is looking as if it could   represent a total overhaul to the current iPhone design. Recent   rumors suggest that the upcoming flagship version of the iPhone   could have an edge-to-edge OLED 5.8-inch display
column2: integration of   Touch ID into the display
column3: the elimination the home button
column4: 3D   facial-recognition capabilities
column5: wireless charging
column6: and a cost   upwards of $1
column7: 000. A major overhaul like this could easily   solicit a monster upgrade cycle
column8: akin to huge growth in iPhone   sales sparked by the iPhone 6 and 6 Plus launch several years   ago.With such a significant update possibly around the corner
column9: is   now a good time to buyApple stock? Or should investors stay on the sidelines until speculation is   replaced by facts?Image source: ApplemakeArticleAd();I'd argue that Apple stock is a buy ahead of the iPhone 8   launch. But it's not necessarily because the iPhone 8 might   represent the first significant redesign to the iPhone in three   years. It's because Apple's underlying iPhone business already   has some concrete trends working in its favor
column10: whether the next   iPhone gets a radical revamp or not.Even with an outdated form factor
column11: the iPhone is     growingApple's 2016 flagship iPhone launch broke from the company's   usual practice of redesigning the smartphone's form factor every   other year. The iPhone 7 and 7 Plus sported the same general   design as 2015's iPhone 6s and 6s Plus and even 2014's iPhone 6   and 6 Plus. Nevertheless
column12: iPhone sales hit a record high in the   company's most recent quarter. In Apple's first fiscal quarter of   2017
column13: iPhone revenue and units were up 5% year over year.This bodes well for the strength of Apple's iPhone business.   If Apple can continue growing iPhone units and revenue in its   important holiday quarter with a three-year-old form factor
column14: Apple's iPhone business may be better off than investors   realize.Apple's pricing power is as strong as everA testament to Apple's clout with its customer base
column15: customers   are paying more for iPhone than ever before. Apple has   continually offered higher-priced options for customers by   rolling out Plus versions of its flagship device with the iPhone   6 and 6 Plus
column16: offering higher storage tiers
column17: and simply byincreasing the price of its iPhones. And customers don't seem to mind. In Apple's most recent   quarter
column18: the iPhone's average selling price hit an all-time high   of $695
column19: up from $691 in the year-ago quarter
column20: and up   significantly from $637 three years ago.This incredible pricing power vouches for the premium price   Apple customers remain willing to pay for an iPhone.iPhone owners are extremely satisfiedApple has always put customer satisfaction at the top of its   priorities. And it continues to pay off for the company. Citing   the latest data from 451 Research
column21: Apple CFO Luca Maestri noted   in the company's most recent earnings call that iPhone owners had   a 97% overall satisfaction rate in the U.S.
column22: with 99%   satisfaction for owners of the iPhone 7 Plus.With satisfaction like this
column23: it's unlikely that iPhone buyers   will be switching to another brand.Image source: AppleMore consumers are upgrading and switching to iPhone     than everCustomers appear as willing as ever to buy an iPhone. Apple's   absolute number of iPhone upgraders and the number of buyers   switching from another smartphone were both at an all-time high   in the company's most recent quarter
column24: CEO Tim Cook said in   Apple's first-quarter earnings call.Put all of this against the back drop of Apple's conservative   price-to-earnings ratio of just 16.4 and a healthy iPhone segment   alone looks like a reason to bet on Apple stock. A major redesign   to the iPhone
column25: with potential to spark a monster upgrade cycle
column26: could just be icing on the cake.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column27: it can pay to listen. After all
column28: the newsletter they have run for   over a decade
column29: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column30: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of them!   That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better   buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

column1: Why Investors Should Be Optimistic About Apple's China Rebound;2/21/2017;"Last year was rough onApple's(NASDAQ: AAPL) business in China for a few reasons. The ongoing   strength in the U.S. dollar continued to weigh on results
column2: which   also affected Apple's performance in Hong Kong (which is included   in Apple's Greater China segment)
column3: since the Hong Kong dollar has   been pegged to the U.S. dollar for over three decades. In terms   of investor sentiment
column4: 2015 was so strong that Apple faced tough   comparisons throughout 2016.But the Mac maker is mounting a rebound in the Middle Kingdom.   On the last call
column5: CFO Luca Maestri noted that mainland China   revenue was ""even with the all-time record results from a year   ago
column6: and grew in constant currency terms."" Local rivals Oppo and   Vivo
column7: which are both owned by BBK Electronics
column8: enjoyed aprecipitous riselast year as Apple fell to the No. 5 spot in China. Despite   intense competition from low-cost rivals
column9: investors have reason   to be optimistic about Apple's rebound.Word on the StreetMorgan Stanley analyst Katy Huberty put out a research note   (viaTech Trader Daily) earlier today
column10: in which she believes that Apple will be able to   win over switchers from Oppo and Vivo. Huberty estimates that 20%   of smartphone users that are currently using Chinese brands will   switch to the iPhone the next time they upgrade. With   expectations running high for this year's 10th-generation iPhone
column11: combined with Chinese consumers' sensitivity to form factor   changes
column12: Apple could enjoy extremely high upgrade and switcher   rates.makeArticleAd();iPhone 7 Plus. Image source: Apple.Huberty's surveys show that 24% of current Oppo users and 28%   of current Vivo users are already planning on switching to the   iPhone. Including surveys that cover other local brands and an   assumption of a two-year upgrade cycle
column13: she believes that upwards   of 127 million non-Apple smartphone users in China will be   looking to upgrade or switch for this iPhone cycle. Meanwhile
column14: Apple enjoys much higher loyalty among its users -- 74% of   surveyed customers are sticking with Apple -- a commonly cited   competitive advantage.Brand loyalty is hard to come by in ChinaWhile Apple's high customer retention rates aren't news
column15: they   are more impressive when you consider the context. Chinese   consumers have historically been notorious for extremely low   brand loyalty rates
column16: although this has started to improve more   recently.For instance
column17: McKinsey noted in 2010 that while Chinese   consumers are brand conscious
column18: that doesn't really translate into   loyalty. Kantar observed something similar in 2012. In the years   since
column19: there has been a growing subset of consumers that are   ""becoming loyal to single brands
column20: McKinsey said in 2016. Here's   McKinsey principal Fang Gong in April of last year:A couple years ago
column21: when we talked to our clients in the     consumer and retail industries
column22: we heard a lot of complaints     about the low loyalty level of Chinese consumers. Today
column23: based     on the reports
column24: we cannot say that it's completely changed
column25: but     we can say that the loyalty level of Chinese consumers has been     improving. Probably not to a single brand
column26: but to a short list     of brands that are in the consumer's consideration set -- and     not only in their daily consumption category
column27: such as food or     apparel
column28: but also in big items
column29: such as automotive.This is most prevalent for premium brands
column30: and Apple certainly   qualifies as a premium brand. Throughout most of the developed   world
column31: Apple enjoys this same dynamic: capturing consumers from   rival brands and retaining them much better
column32: resulting in a slow   but steady increase in its installed base. The fact that Apple   can do this in a region known for low brand loyalty is   particularly impressive
column33: and goes to show that despite negative   storylines
column34: Apple's business in China still has room to run.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column35: it can pay to listen. After all
column36: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column37: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column38: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of them!     That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better     buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

column1: How to Invest in the "Internet of Things";2/21/2017;"All around us
column2: the world grows more intertwined every day. Thanks in part to our global web connections
column3: we have the ability to interact with people and things on an incredible level. This online experience can be life-saving and important
column4: or it can be as arbitrary as simplifying monotonous tasks.There are many industries and companies that aim to advance this experience. One growing market
column5: known as the Internet of Things (IoT)
column6: connects our household or commercial items to a wireless network by embedding them with electronic
column7: software
column8: or sensor technology. This network of devices allows us to take the next step into a wireless world that relies less and less on direct human-to-computer interaction.You might actually be using products in the IoT without knowing it. Some common examples include the remote operation of a house's security system
column9: wearable motion and activity tacking products
column10: and even public trash bins that automatically alert a municipality when it is full.The Internet of Things is definitely present in our everyday lives right now
column11: but it also has a lot more room to grow. According to research firm IDC
column12: via theWall Street Journal
column13: the IoT market could nearly triple in the coming years. In 2014
column14: the global IoT market was worth $655.8 billion
column15: but it could reach up to $1.7 trillion by the year 2020.With the industry showing that much room for growth
column16: investors need to start thinking about investing in the IoT now
column17: and we've highlighted a few companies and strategies for those who would like get the IoT into their portfolios.ETF SuccessPerhaps the easiest way for investors to make a play on the Internet of Things is with a themed ETF. If that interests you
column18: check out Global X Internet of Things Thematic ETFSNSR
column19: the first IoT-related ETF on the market.Big Name Patent HoldersOne of the most important steps a company needs to take to capitalize on emerging technology is locking down patents at the earliest possible point. In regards to the Internet of Things market
column20: we've seen a lot of companies filing for patents that put them in a good position to grow as the IoT grows.One such company is technology behemoth AppleAAPL. Apple holds a patent named ""Local Device Awareness""
column21: which describes an automated relationship between multiple close-range devices. The technology could be used for position tracking
column22: such as finding a lost remote control
column23: or even proximity-based virtual reality
column24: like a video game that depends on one's actual position in a room.Another major IoT patent holder is IBMIBM. Primarily an information technology-focused company
column25: IBM figures to be a major player in the IoT. Currently
column26: IBM holds a patent regarding data filtering in Internet of Things devices
column27: which describes a process in which devices receive and interpret information. This patent puts IBM amongst the frontrunners in technology that allows devices to communicate without human interaction.Furthermore
column28: IBM just announced an Internet of Things partnership with Cisco SystemsCSCO. IBM will implement its Watson technology into Cisco's wide network of edge devices and end points in an effort to provide real-time feedback and data for the oil & gas
column29: manufacturing
column30: shipping
column31: and mining industries.Today's Leading ProductsWhile patents are important for future growth and development
column32: we also have to look at the already-available IoT devices. Again
column33: we are looking at some of the world's biggest tech companies here.One of the more obvious industry leaders is Alphabet Inc.GOOGLand its line of Nest home monitoring products. Alphabet
column34: under the Google name at the time
column35: acquired Nest for $3.2 billion in early 2014
column36: and since then the brand has become one of the biggest names in home automation with its smart thermostats
column37: smoke detectors
column38: and safety cameras.Another leader in the IoT market right now is AmazonAMZN. Amazon's Dash Buttons
column39: which allow users to re-order specific products with the click of an actual physical button that can be placed anywhere in the home
column40: could be considered an entry-level IoT device. Additionally
column41: the company's Echo smart speakers
column42: which utilize its Alexa home connectivity technology
column43: are probably the most popular consumer IoT product on the market right nowGoogle actually recently responded to Amazon's Echo speaker with a home automation device of its own
column44: the Google Home. The Home runs on Google's new voice assistant
column45: which also powers its new Pixel phone and represents Google's new era of hardware/software interaction.(Also read:Google's New ""Home"" Internet of Things Device   Challenges Amazon Echo)Finally
column46: SamsungSSNLFis another major player with its SmartThings brand. Samsung SmartThings are a series of in-home products
column47: ranging from electric outlets to motion sensors
column48: which allow for easier control of a users' entire home.Unsung HeroesThe technology giants will certainly be leaders in the IoT market
column49: but investors should also look into the smaller companies that will be the manufacturers of the actual hardware. For every product IoT product sold by Apple
column50: the supplier who built one of the components within the device also stands to benefit.One of Apple's key suppliers is Skyworks SolutionsSWKS. Skyworks is the industry leader in semiconductor manufacturing and currently produces a chip that is a vital part of the iPhone. Similar technology will be the backbone of the IoT movement
column51: as semiconductors and sensors move beyond their usual homes in phones and computers and into our other household items. Skyworks is currently a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).Investors should also focus on some smaller cap stocks that have potential to grow in correlation with the IoT market. One such company would be Sierra WirelessSWIR
column52: a wireless communications expert with a product line that should fit perfectly in the IoT market. Sierra is currently a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).Another company to consider is Iridium CommunicationsIRDM
column53: a low-Earth orbit satellite company that has recently partnered with IoT platform providers as the industry has discovered a use for LEOs in connecting the world. IRDM currently has a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).Bottom LineThe Internet of Things has the potential to change the consumer electronics industry as we know it. The growth of the market will be another indication of humanity's expansion into an autonomous world
column54: and investors need to start taking note of the IoT now.Whether you want to focus on the major technology players or the small companies at the heart of the IoT movement
column55: the time is now to add this industry to your portfolio.Also
column56: investors interested in the Internet of Things should check out this episode of theZacks Friday Finish Linepodcast:Zacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017In addition to the stocks discussed above
column57: would you like to know about our 10 finest buy-and-hold tickers for the entirety of 2017?Who wouldn't? Last year's market-beating Top 10 portfolio produced 5 double-digit winners. For example
column58: oil and natural gas giant Pioneer Natural Resources and First Republic Bank racked up stellar gains of +44.9% and +44.3% respectively. Now a brand-new list for 2017 has been hand-picked from 4
column59: 400 companies covered by the Zacks Rank.See the 2017 Top 10 right now>>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today
column60: you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days.Click to get this free reportmakeArticleAd();Cisco Systems
