column1: Does Warren Buffett Still Matter to Value Investors?;2/15/2017;"(1:00) - What Is Warren Buffett's Current Holdings?(5:05) - Should You Be Buying What Warren Buffett Buys?(9:40) - Tracey's Top Three Picks: Investing Ideas(13:00) - Episode SummaryWelcome to Episode #30 of the Value Investor PodcastAs the editor of theValue Investor portfolio service
column2: I love looking at value stocks. Every week
column3: I share some of my top value investing tips and stock picks.You might have noticed that the big hedge fund and money managers had to file their Form 13F filings
column4: which disclose what stocks they bought and sold in the fourth quarter of 2016
column5: by February 15.While it's backward looking by at least 45 days
column6: it still shines a window into what some of the biggest names in the investing business are doing with their money.One of the biggest of them all is Warren Buffett. Among value investors
column7: he is considered to be the greatest value investor of all time. I know some investors who are so in awe
column8: they try and mimic his stock moves in their own portfolios.What were those moves in the fourth quarter?Berkshire added three new positions:1.      Southwest Airlines (LUV) which is the fourth airline Berkshire has bought in the last 2 quarters. He also owns Delta
column9: America and United. I'm not a big fan of this trade. You can check out theValue Investor Podcastwhere I discussed Buffett's third quarter airline buys
column10: why I didn't like those 3 buys
column11: and whether or not the airlines were true value stocks.Listen here>>.2.     Monsanto (MON) which is just 0.57% of his portfolio.3.     Sirius XM Holdings (SIRI)
column12: which is also a small position overall
column13: at just 0.5% of the portfolio.Buffett also added to his Apple (AAPL) position which is now among the top 10 and is about 4.5% of the portfolio. I've discussed how Apple is a value stock in prior podcasts so this larger position isn't a surprise.Concentration at the TopHis largest position continues to be The Kraft Heinz Company (KHC)
column14: which is about 19.2% of his portfolio. It is hitting new 52-week highs in 2017.Although the portfolio was holding 46 stocks in the fourth quarter
column15: it was heavily concentrated in the top 10 holdings. Those accounted for over 80% of the portfolio.The top 5 positions
column16: many which have been held for years
column17: read like a who's who of the Dow Industrials.What Happens When You Have Too Much CashThanks to a record stock market
column18: the market value of Berkshire's holdings has soared to about $150 billion. That's a lot of cash to invest. The Kraft Heinz position alone
column19: in the fourth quarter
column20: was worth $28 billion.But this also means that Buffett and his managers are stuck in a one-trick pony. They basically have to buy big cap stocks. The only way to get small cap exposure is by buying the company outright.Buffett has talked
column21: in the past
column22: about wishing he were in his 40s again and investing. He would have a smaller portfolio and a longer time horizon in which to invest. These are ideal conditions.Seize the Opportunity to Go SmallBuffett may be stuck with the large caps
column23: but you don't have to be.I've talked about small cap value
column24: and how historically it is one of the best investments in the entire stock market (yes
column25: it beats growth over long periods).You can listen to theValue Investor PodcastonSmall Caps for the Winto get all the details on why value investors should be in small caps.Listen here>>While buying airlines and Apple aren't awful strategies
column26: for those of us who don't have $100 billion to invest
column27: there are so many other intriguing options.3 Small Cap Value Stocks to Consider Instead of Buffett's   Picks1.      Gray TelevisionGTNhas a forward P/E of 13.9 and a market cap of $821 million.2.     Malibu BoatsMBUUhas a forward P/E of 14.5 and a market cap of just $400 million. But
column28: alas
column29: it's not based in Malibu. It's headquartered in Tennessee.3.     Republic Bancorp Inc.RBCAAis one of the many community banks that are publicly traded. It's headquartered in Louisville
column30: Kentucky. It has a forward P/E of 14.5 and a market cap of about $750 million. It pays a dividend
column31: currently yielding 2.4%.While Warren Buffett still fascinates value investors
column32: I'm urging you to look beyond his moves in the Berkshire portfolio.There are plenty of hidden value opportunities among the small caps that Buffett
column33: no matter how much he wants to get in
column34: just can't buy.But you can.Find out what else I think about Berkshire Hathaway's fourth quarter stock moves and value stocks in this week's podcast.Subscribe to our podcast below:Souncloud:TuneIn:iTunesWant more value investing insights?Check out my weekly Value Investor service to receive more in-depth analysis on value companies and see which stocks I think are the best bargains now.It holds between 20 and 25 value stocks for the long haul.Click here to learn more.Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today
column35: you can download 7 Best Stocks for the Next 30 Days.Click to get this free reportmakeArticleAd();Southwest Airlines Company (LUV): Free Stock Analysis ReportGray Television

column37: Inc. (MBUU): Free Stock Analysis ReportRepublic Bancorp
column38: Inc. (RBCAA): Free Stock Analysis ReportTo read this article on Zacks.com click here.Zacks Investment Research"

column1: Universal Display's Next Stop: $100?;2/15/2017;"Shares ofUniversal Display(NASDAQ: OLED) enjoyed a strong day today
column2: closing out trading   with 5% gains. The stock had risen as much as 10% during trading   before giving back some of those gains. The driver behind today's   move was Susquehanna initiating coverage on the organic   light-emitting diode (OLED) pioneer with a ""positive"" rating   alongside an ambitious $100 price target. That valuation   represents meaningful upside relative to the all-time high of   around $74 set last August
column3: a level flirted with today.What will it take for Universal Display to hit three-digit   prices?OLED adoption may (finally) accelerateAnalyst Mehdi Hosseini says that OLED adoption within the   smartphone and TV markets is ""set to accelerate."" However
column4: this   is a storyline that's been repeated for years
column5: as investors   patiently await for the adoption curve to spike. To be clear
column6: OLED adoptionislikely to spike meaningfully
column7: and when it does it will translate   into major upside for Universal Display's financials
column8: but the   timing is what's so hard to predict.makeArticleAd();Emitter materials that are used in OLED displays. Image     source: Universal Display.Universal Display also enjoys a fairly easy competitive   environment
column9: as the company lacks any meaningful rivals that can   compete in terms of intellectual property and patent licensing.   Hosseini notes that Universal Display recently announced that it   was doubling its manufacturing capacity for the OLED materials   that it subsequently resells to customers. The company said last   week that it would invest $15 million inPPG's(NYSE: PPG) manufacturing facility in Ohio to double capacity   for Universal Display's proprietary UniversalPHOLED   phosphorescent emitter products. The expansion is set to be   completed by the third quarter.The analyst believes that Universal Display's business of   materials sales combined with patent licensing (which is not   unlike acertain mobile chip giant) gives it an enviable position once OLED adoption accelerates   further. OLED penetration of the smartphone market is currently a   mere 16%
column10: according to Hosseini's estimates
column11: but this is expected   to rise to around 30% by 2019. The TV market moves much slower
column12: and OLED penetration in TVs is a minuscule 1%
column13: although this may   triple to 3% over the same time frame.Flexible designs are expected to be the key driver of   adoption
column14: as manufacturers can explore a wide range of innovative   new use cases that are currently unavailable with traditional LCD   displays.In other newsSeparately
column15: Bloombergreported yesterday thatApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) is in negotiations with China-based BOE Technology   Group to provide OLED displays. BOE is already planning on   investing nearly $15 billion to build two AMOLED manufacturing   facilities in Sichuan. That could potentially supplement the $4.3   billion supply agreement that Apple has reportedly inked with   frenemySamsung
column16: one of the largest proponents to date of OLED displays.Apple's adoption of OLED is very much baked into broader   expectations of OLED adoption throughout various markets
column17: given   the Mac maker's unique ability to bring new technologies to the   mainstream. By the looks of it
column18: Apple appears intent on reserving   OLED displays for itsmost expensive iPhonemodel due to the added costs associated with OLED panels. As   costs naturally come down over time
column19: you can expect that the   company would bring OLED to the rest of the lineup
column20: much like it   has done with other technologies.More than most
column21: Universal Display investors recognize that   patience is a virtue
column22: and that patience is finally paying   off.10 stocks we like better than Universal     DisplayWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column23: it can pay to listen. After all
column24: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column25: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column26: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Universal Display wasn't     one of them! That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are     even better buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

The Motley Fool has the     following options: long January 2018 $90 calls on Apple and     short January 2018 $95 calls on Apple. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: Tech Stock Roundup: INTC Analyst Day
column2: AAPL Smartphone Lead;2/15/2017;"Intel Analyst DayIntel's analyst day was mostly about the growing importance of the data center business as a driver of both revenue growth and margin pressure. Within data center
column3: the enterprise and government segment is expected to be the weakest due to delays related to the transition from on-premises to public cloud-based deployment
column4: which is why it will grow a mere 2%.But this will be strongly supplemented with 15%+ growth in cloud service provider (helped by TAM expansion and higher prices) and 10%+ growth in communications service provider revenues. The much larger CPU portion will post a 6% CAGR dropping from 87% of revenue in 2017 to 75% in 2021. Non CPU parts of the data center business will record a 30% CAGR during the same time period.Intel put out some rather convincing charts showing the artificial intelligence opportunity and Intel's position within it along with its significance for total server revenue. Accordingly
column6: AI was just 7% of revenue
column7: of which 60% was classic machine learning with the remainder being deep learning.In 2010
column8: when NVIDIANVDAentered the market
column9: Intel HPC accounted for 93% of the market with NVIDIA making up the rest. NVIDIA grew strongly for the next two years but Xeon Phi has started taking back share again. As a result
column11: Intel's combined technologies gained back some market to end at 84%.Because of the huge opportunity
column12: Intel will be devoting more R&D dollars to strengthen this business and its new chips starting from the last iteration of 10nm will be first available to its data center customers. Increasing costs will therefore have a negative impact on this business over the next few years.In 2017
column13: management expects revenue growth in the low single digit range
column14: a gross margin of around 63% and EPS of around $2.80. DCG will be up high single digits
column15: CCG will be down mid single-digits
column16: NSG up 20%+
column17: IoTG up 10%+ and PSG up mid-single-digits.Intel expects to spend $12 billion (+/- $500 million) on capex this year
column18: of which $2.5 billion will be on memory. But capacity additions will account for most of the rest.Management also pointed to future opportunities: memory ($100 billion TAM)
column19: autonomous vehicles in 2025 ($10 billion TAM) and 5G connected devices (more than $50 billion TAM).Intel's U.S. Factory Endears It to TrumpIntel CEO Brian Krzanich met with Trump and promised to invest an additional $7 billion in an Arizona factory it originally started building back in 2011. The plant will employ 3K high-tech high-wage employees and it is estimated that indirect jobs relating to it will take employment up by about 10K.Intel has struggled to take the x86 architecture below 10nm
column20: which could be partially responsible for construction being put on hold. Intel is one of the few technology companies that stuck with its U.S. fabs as a matter of policy even when many of its peers moved offshore. Intel owns leading edge IP that it wouldn't want to outsource to places where IP laws are suspect.The CEO made no bones about the fact that conducive tax and regulatory measures had prompted the company's decision to complete the investment now
column21: so he may have eked out some concessions from Trump.Apple Sells More Smartphones Than SamsungAccording to IDC data published Feb 1
column22: Apple shipped slightly more smartphones in the holiday quarter than Samsung
column23: despite the fact that iPhone shipments were down for the first time in 2016. This is the first time in five years that the company gained the top spot.Apple's success was attributed to the iPhone 7 and Samsung's Galaxy Note 7 fiasco. Samsung said the exploding phones cost it $3 billion in sales. Overall smartphones grew just 2.3% in 2016 compared to 10.4% the previous year. Apple's 4.7% growth rate was better than the industry. Samsung shipments declined 5.2%.IDC expects the market to rebound this year
column24: in part because of expectations of a landmark phone from Apple and renewed demand in the Middle East and Latin America
column25: which didn't have a good 2016. Separately
column26: Canaccord Genuity has said that while Apple accounted for just 18% of the smartphone market last quarter
column27: it took 92% of the profits.Google Selling Its Satellite CompanyGoogle has agreed to sell its high-resolution satellite imaging business
column28: Terra Bella
column29: to imaging startup Planet Labs for somewhere between $300 and $500 million. Planet Labs has a number of medium resolution satellites that will complement the ones it has acquired
column30: according to Planet.Google is not quitting the mapping business and a long-term agreement to license the technology back from Planet is reportedly a part of the deal. This may not be a hugely profitable deal for Google given that it originally acquired Terra Bella for $500 million in 2014 when the company was called Skybox. But it may be a part of the realignment of its business units and goals under CFO Ruth Porat.CompanyLast WeekLast  6 MonthsAAPL+2.36%+22.12%FB+2.45%+7.12%GOOGL+1.79%+3.68%MSFT+0.50%+10.23%INTC-3.23%+0.86%CSCO+0.61%+1.61%AMZN+2.12%+7.94%Other stories you might have missed-CorporateApple Submits on Aussie Bank Boycott: Apple has submitted a statement to the Australian Competition & Consumer Commission (ACCC) charging the top four banks (Commonwealth Bank of Australia
column31: National Australia Bank Ltd.
column32: Westpac Banking Corp. and Bendigo & Adelaide Bank Ltd) in Australia of delaying the expansion of Apple Pay
column33: which could prove detrimental to smaller card issuers while reducing options for consumers.The banks
column34: which are in the process of developing their own mobile technology
column35: are seeking to bargain collectively with Apple to have their apps included in Apple Pay. Apple would rather have card issuers add their cards to its wallet and have the banks pay for inclusion. Apple said it won't give the banks a ""free ride"" while the banks responded saying Apple's assertion was ""incorrect and unsupported."" In its draft ruling
column36: the ACCC denied the banks' request. The final ruling is expected in March.Apple Hires Away Amazon Executive: Timothy D. Twerdahl
column37: who formerly headed Amazon's Fire TV unit as its general manager and director
column38: has now joined Apple as its VP in charge of marketing Apple TV. Pete Distad who previously played that role will now help Apple negotiate content deals. Twerdahl has vast experience in streaming: before his four-year stint at Amazon he was VP of consumer devices at Roku and before that
column39: he was an executive at Netflix. The executive changes seem to indicate that Apple is finally going to make some bold moves in this business
column40: which hasn't really done that well versus competitors.Facebook VR Demo Stations Shutting Down: Facebook (FB) is closing down around 200 of its 500 VR demo stations at Best Buy stores. It appears that the Oculus wasn't as much of a success as anticipated because few people came in for a demo at all and store attendants said that frequent software issues with the headsets made them unsellable. But the headsets aren't going out of circulation. The stores will continue to sell them and Facebook has promised that there will be pop up and other stores that will continue with the demos. The program started with 50 stores that were later expanded to 500 in August last year.Facebook Hires MTV Executive: Facebook is very serious about content
column41: video content in particular. On the earnings call
column42: Zuckerberg mentioned how video was the next big thing just like mobile. So it has done everything possible to help share videos of every description and host Facebook Live streams. But in order to increase differentiation and the price of ads running adjacent to these videos
column43: Facebook needs a little bit more. And now it's apparent that that is original content. The company has snapped up Mina Lefevre
column44: who was in charge of scripted programming at MTV to head up its content development efforts. She will report to Ricky Van Veen
column45: co-founder of CollegeHumor.Legal/RegulatoryMicrosoft Battles with Govt Spying: The court hasn't allowed the government's request to throw out a MicrosoftMSFTlawsuit
column46: in which it contended that the Electronic Communications Privacy Act violates the first amendment. The act allows the government to issue gag orders when asking for data housed on third-party servers like those owned by Microsoft.The Justice Department had asked the government to dismiss the lawsuit saying that it needed to keep investigations confidential so as not to alarm possible wrong-doers and that they did eventually get to know when charges were filed. Microsoft succeeded in convincing the judge that this affected its ability to do business. But the court held that Microsoft couldn't assert constitutional rights for someone else
column47: so it couldn't talk on behalf of its customers.Google Wants Warrants for Govt Snooping: Google's head of information security Richard Salgado visited senators to speed up the passage of a bill that has previously been endorsed by the House of Representatives. The bill seeks to do away with one clause of the current law that allows the government to obtain access emails that are more than 180 days old without a warrant. Google would like the law to be applicable for all emails irrespective of age. The bill was in the hands of Senator Jeff Sessions prior to the elections
column48: when he was elevated to the position of Attorney General by President Trump.New Technology/ProductsCisco Announces First SIG: CiscoCSCOhas created a new Secure Internet Gateway (SIG) in the cloud that will allow on-field or mobile enterprise users to connect securely to the Internet even when they aren't connected through VPN. Cisco's solution is called Umbrella. Umbrella can identify which SaaS apps are being used and enforce policies to block risky or inappropriate apps; analyze over 100 billion internet requests every day
column49: correlating with over 11 billion historical events to identify patterns
column50: detect anomalies
column51: and create models to automatically uncover attacker infrastructure being staged for the next threat; and other security checks through machine learning
column52: Cisco Talos threat intelligence
column53: and Cisco Advanced Malware Protection (AMP).Microsoft Extends Support to Cloud Customers: Boston Consulting Group says that while IP lawsuits have increased 22% over the last five years
column54: patent trolls - companies that don't have a business but acquire patents to benefit from litigation - increased patent acquisitions by 35%. It is perhaps these trends that prompted Microsoft to expand its patent protection coverage to all users of its Azure infrastructure. Microsoft will give customers one of its own patents to help them deal with the litigation. Microsoft also expanded its indemnification program under which it provides funds or legal counsel to help customers defend themselves.M&A and CollaborationsNES and Google Have a Deal: Nashville Electric Service has withdrawn its lawsuit against the Metro Council and telecom companies filed last October
column55: after Google promised to indemnify it against liabilities that may arise out of Metro's One Touch Make Ready policy. The current law requires that when a new provider's line is added to a utility pole
column56: each existing provider is required to move its line
column57: resulting in needless delay and disruption on the sidewalk.The new policy allows one person to move the poles
column58: thus making the process more efficient. Existing providers like AT&T and Comcast object to the law on the grounds that Metro is not authorized to make the law
column59: which is a matter for the Federal Communications Commission (FCC). The deal is significant because NES owns 80% of the utility poles in Nashville and Google is likely to succeed because the action promotes competition in the market and can force incumbents to match Google Fiber's high-speed services.Some NumbersMicrosoft Azure Price Cuts: Microsoft has taken the lead in announcing price cuts for its Azure Virtual Machines. The company said that compute-optimized F Series instances would cost its customers up to 24% less
column60: while A1 Basic instances would drop by up to 61%. Azure HotBlock Blob Storage and Cool Block Blob Storage costs are also down. Suntrust analyst Kunal Madhukar expects Amazon to follow soon
column61: as price cuts are ""business as usual"" for cloud infrastructure service providers.Amazon Payments: Amazon's payments service called Pay With Amazon
column62: which allows people to check out quickly using the details saved on Amazon says that the service now has 33 million users
column63: 32% of which access it with mobile devices. Pay With Amazon had 23 million users last April. Amazon's alliances with companies like PrestaShop
column64: Shopify and Future Shop have brought more users over the past few months.Zacks' Top 10 Stocks for 2017In addition to the stocks discussed above
column65: would you like to know about our 10 finest buy-and-hold tickers for the entirety of 2017?Who wouldn't? As of early December
column66: the 2016 Top 10 produced 5 double-digit winners including oil and natural gas giant Pioneer Natural Resources which racked up a stellar +50% gain. The new list is painstakingly hand-picked from 4
column67: 400 companies covered by the Zacks Rank.Be among the very first to see it>>Want the latest recommendations from Zacks Investment Research? Today

column1: Buffett Signals Shift on Long-Standing Tech Stance With Big 4Q Apple Bet;2/15/2017;"Berkshire Hathaway Inc. increased its bet on Apple by more than 200% in the fourth quarter
column2: upping its position in the iPhone maker to a whopping $6.6 billion as of December 31. Warren Buffett's big move came just ahead of a major 2016 turnaround for Apple. The big Apple bet also signals a shift for Buffett
column3: who has stayed away from tech stocks for decades.Berkshire held 57.4 million Apple shares at the end of 2016. Those shares would now be worth roughly$7.74 billion based on the tech giant's Tuesday closing. BerkshireBRK.Ashares rose 0.8% yesterday
column4: and it is up 0.10% after early Wednesday trading to $250
column5: 673.Apple Inc.AAPLshares rose 1.3% Tuesday to $135.02. Ahead of the Berkshire announcement
column6: the tech company onMonday closed at an all-time highas anticipation for the 10thanniversary iPhone continues to grow.Apple's stock is up 15% since the beginning of 2017.  Now
column7: on the back of Buffett's faith and its own growth
column8: Apple looks poised to build on its already stellar 2017.The tech giant took a bit of dive when its first quarter 2016 earnings report showed iPhone sales fell year-over-year for the first time in the smartphone's nearly 10-year history. Berkshirefirst announced it invested in Apple in May 2016
column9: around the same timeApple stockhad hit a two-year low.Ted Weschler and Todd Combs
column10: Buffett's right-hand men
column11: pushed for the first Apple play. Apple shares rose nearly 4% the day Berkshire's initial stake was made public. And Apple's stock has been on the rise ever since.Buffet and Berkshire had previouslystayed away from technology companiesbecause Buffett was not as familiar with the space. But Weschler and Combs
column12: who are in line to take over all of Berkshire's investments when Buffett steps down
column13: seem to have convinced the ""Oracle of Omaha"" that Apple is a solid investment.Berkshire's big Apple bet came along with news that itmade major investmentsin Southwest Airlines Co. (LUV)
column14: American Airlines Group
column15: Inc. (AAL)
column16: Delta Air Lines
column17: Inc. (DAL) and United Continental Holdings
column18: Inc. (UAL) in the fourth quarter. Yet another signal that Berkshire is moving outside of its comfort zone
column19: as Buffett had a decades-long stance that airlines were money-losers.It is no secret that Buffett and Berkshire love to invest long-term. Buffett has famously said
column20: ""our favorite holding period is forever."" And this must come as great news for Apple.However
column21: since 1992
column22: only two of Berkshire's ten biggest investments have remained
column23: Coca-ColaKOand Wells FargoWFC. But the company now owns a third
column24: GEICO. Berkshire's market value has grown by 2
column25: 300% since '92 when the Omaha
column26: Nebraska-based company first began to skyrocket into the behemoth it is today.Still
column27: even if Berkshire doesn't actually hold a company forever
column28: it bets on companies it thinks have staying power. Apple has once again reached an elusive $700 billion market value
column29: after becoming the first publicly traded U.S. company to do so in February 2015. And Berkshire now owns over 1% of Apple.Stocks that Aren't in the News. Yet.You are invited to download the full

column1: Wednesday Apple Rumors: AAPL Files Patent for New Smart Keyboard;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsLeading theApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) rumor mill today is a patent for a new smart keyboard. Today
column3: we'll look at that and otherApple Rumorsfor Wednesday.makeArticleAd();Smart Keyboard:Apple has filed a patent for a new smart keyboard
column4: reportsMacRumors. The new smart keyboard that appears in the patent seems to be designed with social media in mind. The patent shows that it includes ""Share"" and ""Emoji"" buttons. The smart keyboard also includes a ""Magnifying Glass"" key that could serve multiple functions. This includes a short press for searches
column5: two short presses for shortcuts and holding it to bring up Siri.South Korea:An Apple Pay launch in South Korea is still in its early stages
column6: AppleInsidernotes. While the tech company has met with some officials in the country to explain how the system works
column7: it hasn't been taking part in detailed discussions
column8: yet. A recent report also claims that it still hasn't set up a schedule for any meetings of this nature. A card company in South Korea has confirmed that this is the case and says that it has only had early talks with AAPL.Right to Repair:A new report claims that Apple is planning to fight ""right to repair"" legislation
column9: reportsMotherboard. Nebraska state legislature is considering the bill and an inside source claims that AAPL will step up against it. The legislation would make it so that customers would have access to repair parts and service manuals for the company's devices. AAPL has fought against similar bills in the past. There are currently eight states that are considering right to repair legislation.Check out more recentApple RumorsorSubscribe to Apple Rumors:RSSThe postWednesday Apple Rumors: AAPL Files Patent for New Smart Keyboardappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Could Win Big With ‘Windows Cloud’;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsNot long ago
column3: Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) perfected the art of the big reveal. New Apple product announcements would be shrouded in mystery for weeks
column4: and then the late Steve Jobs would get up on a stage and wow consumers and investors alike with the first-ever iPhone
column5: the first-ever iPad or the first-ever iPod. AAPL stock would get an automatic 10% to 15% bump in the days that followed. CouldMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) have a similarly secretive catalyst in its so-called Windows Cloud product?makeArticleAd();Source:Mike Mozart via Flickr (Modified)Windows Cloud is a mysterious operating system that was revealed via leaks
column6: prompting a ""nothing to share"" response from Microsoft last week.What Is the Windows Cloud?A couple websites posted screen shots of Microsoft's yet-to-be-announced operating system
column7: which would only run Windows Store apps designed to run on both desktop computers and mobile devices. The thought is that the Windows Cloud would supplement
column8: not replace
column9: the company's Windows 10 platform
column10: which is only 18 months old.The Windows Cloud is already being viewed as Microsoft's answer toAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column11: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Chrome OS. And by utilizing only its own apps
column12: the platform could have a security advantage over Chrome
column13: which uses non-native apps. That could position Windows 10 as a more appealing option to public institutions like schools
column14: where protecting students' computers from outside apps or games can be difficult.Not much else is known about the Windows Cloud platform. And that's probably how Microsoft likes it. Although Wall Street didn't immediately embrace the top-secret new product by snatching up MSFT stock in droves
column15: the real test will be when the company actually does its big Windows Cloud reveal. Will the platform impress enough to have an AAPL-like effect on Microsoft stock?7 Dividend Stocks Rewarding Shareholders With a RaiseClick to EnlargeFirst
column16: let's look at how MSFT stock has been behaving lately.There was  big spike in MSFT stock last month has since been followed by a sharp retreat; however
column17: the stock is still hovering above its 25- and 50-day moving averages
column18: as well as two-month support in the $62-range.What you don't see is any kind of Microsoft stock price movement in the days since the Windows Cloud leak occurred. That means investors aren't quite sure exactly what the Windows Cloud is and how it could affect MSFT's business
column19: which is why there has been no sudden rush to buy MSFT.If more details leak out
column20: that could potentially move the needle. For now
column21: though
column22: the Windows Cloud remains a relative mystery that likely has Wall Street more confused than excited.MSFT Stock Is Strong Even Without the 'Cloud'In the meantime
column23: Microsoft looks good on its own merits. MSFT stock is up nearly 30% in the last year
column24: nearly 50% in the last two years
column25: still trades at less than 20 times forward earnings estimates
column26: and is expected to grow earnings-per-share by more than 6% this year and more than 9% next year. Sprinkle in a potential game changer in the Windows Cloud
column27: and there's no reason to suspect Microsoft stock is going to suddenly backtrack.On the contrary
column28: the recent mini-dip is a prime buying opportunity
column29: so long as it holds above those short-term moving averages. I'd buy MSFT stock right here
column30: with the hope that a future Windows Cloud unveiling could spark a quick run-up the way Apple's secret product launches used to.As of this writing
column31: Chris Fraley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 Super-Safe Dividend Growth Stocks to Buy Today7 Tech Stocks That Could Implode at Any MinuteThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock Could Win Big With 'Windows Cloud'appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Should I Buy Qualcomm
column2: Inc. (QCOM) Stock? 3 Pros
column3: 3 Cons;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsA few years ago
column5: Qualcomm
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) seemed like a sure bet. Hey
column7: with its CDMA platform
column8: the company was at the heart of the fast-growing mobile market. QCOM stock was essentially a cash machine.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockYet lately the company has been in a slump. Since the summer of 2014
column9: QCOM stock has lost about a third of its value. Of course
column10: the tech industry is chock-full of examples of darlings that fell on hard times.And yes
column11: it can take time to get back into growth mode again. Although
column12: when this happens
column13: the gains can certainly be standout. Just look at the comeback ofMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column14: which is up about 90% during the past couple years.So in the case of Qualcomm stock
column15: is there much upside or should investors remain wary? Let's take a look at three pros and three cons and find out:QCOM Stock ProsMobile Powerhouse:The roots of QCOM go back to the mid-1980s
column16: when seven engineers teamed up to capitalize on the mobile industry. At first they focused on technologies to provide location-based services and messaging for the trucking industry. Then after a few years
column17: QCOM would go big - that is
column18: develop a standard
column19: called CDMA
column20: which would allow for better cellular communications.The business model was to license the technology
column21: which would mean getting aggressive with patents. While success was not immediate
column22: QCOM was determined to make CDMA a critical part of the mobile industry. And of course
column23: this wager ultimately paid off handsomely. For example
column24: just some of QCOM's marquee customers includeApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL)
column25: Samsung Electronics(OTCMKTS:SSNLF)

column1: Should I Buy General Motors Company (GM) Stock? 3 Pros
column2: 3 Cons;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsGeneral Motors Company(NYSE:GM) has certainly made a tremendous comeback since 2008
column4: after having to declare bankruptcy. But there has been little for investors to cheer about. Back in late 2010
column5: the company pulled off its IPO at $33 a share. But now GM stock is at only $37.20.makeArticleAd();Source:William Oliver via Flickr (Modified)To put things into perspective
column6: InvestorPlace.com'sDana Blankenhorn has noted: ""Ever since the 2008 crash and government bailout
column7: General Motors stock has been treated like dirt. No matter what GM does
column8: it can't get out of first gear.""I actually think this is an understatement!Of course
column9: Wall Street can be inexplicable. Yet eventually investors will recognize the value. Hey
column10: this has happened with other stocks that languished for a long time
column11: such asMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT)
column12: right?OK then
column13: so would GM stock be a good play right now? Or should investors hold off? Well
column14: to see
column15: let's take a look at 3 pros and cons on General Motors:3 Pros On GM StockMomentum: For the past two years
column16: General Motors has posted record earnings
column17: net revenues
column18: EBITDA and free cash flows. As forlast year
column19: revenues increased by 9.2% to $166.4 billion and free cash flows came to $6.9 billion
column20: up $4.7 billion from the previous year.7 Tech Stocks That Could Implode at Any MinuteThen again
column21: General Motors has continued to pump out popular cars
column22: with global sales at 10 million (making the company the No. 3 player). A big part of this has been the continued success in North America. But of course
column23: China remains a major factor as well. Last year GM reported3.87 million car sales in the country. Keep in mind that the company sells more in China than any country
column24: including the U.S.But GM has also been judicious with discounts and promotions. For the most part
column25: GM is focused on making sure it makes profits
column26: not just on increasing marketshare.Innovation: One of the hottest categories in technology is the auto industry
column27: as seen with the efforts with operators likeAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL
column28: NASDAQ:GOOG)
column29: Apple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andTesla Inc(NASDAQ:TSLA). The good news is that GM has been ramping up its investments. To this end
column30: the company made a $500 million investment inLyft(a top ride-sharing startup) as well as a $1 billion acquisition ofCruise Automation(a developer of autonomous car systems).Already there are signs that GM is getting traction. For example
column31: the company is testing over 40 autonomous Bolt EVs. But there are also some other innovations
column32: like Maven. This is a mobile platform that allows a person to search and reserve a car and unlock it with a smartphone. According toGM: ""With more than 25 million customers around the world projected to use some form of shared mobility by 2020
column33: Maven is a key element of our strategy to changing ownership models in the automotive industry.""It's important to note that GM has the advantage of leveraging its experience with OnStar
column34: which has been around for two decades. In fact
column35: during this time
column36: the system has logged about1.5 billion customer interactions.Yield & Valuation: GM has certainly been shareholder friendly. Last year
column37: the company returned a hefty $4.8 billion - in a combination of share buybacks and dividends. In fact
column38: GM stock has a nice yield of 4.1%.But the valuation is also attractive. Consider that the forward price-to-earnings ratio is at a lowly 6.1X. True
column39: this may be deserved for a company that is showing declining growth. But as for General Motors
column40: the company expects to increase the top line for 2017.In other words
column41: the stock does look like a great value play right now.3 Cons on GM StockCompetition: The environment is brutal. And with more dealmaking
column42: things will only get more intense. An example of this is the alliance ofRenault SAandNissan Motor Co Ltd (ADR)(OTCMKTS:NSANY) - which also involved the purchase of a large stake inMitsubishi Motors. With this
column43: the companies were able to realize significant cost savings and also hit a global sales number of nearly 10 million last year.Although
column44: accordingFiat SpA(ADR)(OTCMKTS:FIATY) CEO Sergio Marchionne
column45: an automaker may need to reach levels of15 million cars sold annually to be competitive! The reason is that R&D will inevitably increase because of the enormous costs of new technologies.As a result
column46: a company like GM may have little choice but to look for a similar alliance or a transformative acquisition
column47: which would definitely be risky and expensive.Politics: The election of Donald Trump is a wild card for the auto industry. On the one hand
column48: there are potential positives
column49: such as with lower corporate tax rates and less onerous regulations.But these may not offset the issues with Trump's anti-trade bent. If there is a border tax
column50: this could hurt GM because of its substantial production in Mexico. Actually
column51: about 20% of light production is in the country. So if there is a border tax
column52: it could mean higher prices in the U.S. - and yes
column53: lower sales. According to theWall Street Journal: ""Even a more modest border tax under consideration would wipe out a quarter of GM's regional profit.""Global Issues:While the markets in China and North America have been robust for GM
column54: there has been much softness in many other areas
column55: such as in Europe and South America. Granted
column56: there are signs of improvement - but the progress has been fairly slow. For example
column57: in South America
column58: GM has been able to cut back on the losses. But there was still $374 million in red ink last year.As for Europe
column59: the growth has been sluggish across the continent. It also does not help that England has enacted the Brexit
column60: which has caused a lot of uncertainty. As a result
column61: GM lost $300 million in Europe last year and it appears there will not be break-even until 2018. To put things into perspective
column62: the company has not seen a profit in the region since 2000!Bottom Line On GM StockPerhaps the biggest issue facing GM stock is the uncertainty regarding Trump's trade actions. Although
column63: given the importance of the auto industry to the US economy
column64: it does seem reasonable that any moves will likely be taken with care. Besides

column66: she is doing a great job managing the core operations of the company. Note that there will be 18 new or refreshed models for five main brands in 2017
column67: up from 13 last year. And yes
column68: Barra has been aggressive with investments in new technologies.OK
column69: so is GM stock a good buy right now? I think so

column1: Universal Display Stock Upgraded: What You Need to Know;2/15/2017;"It's been three full months since reports thatApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) would be adding organic light-emitting diode   (OLED) displays to only one of its three new iPhone 8 models sent   shares of OLED specialistUniversal Display(NASDAQ: OLED) stock tumbling 5% in a day. But this week
column2: the   momentum is reversing.On Tuesday
column3: news broke that Apple has gone ahead and   signed a licensing deal withSamsungto order OLED displays for its iPhones. While the rumor doesn't   extend to whether Apple will be putting OLED displays in all   models of the iPhone 8 or just one
column4: investors are taking the bait   either way. Yesterday
column5: Apple stockhit a new all-time intraday high of $135.09 -- and it's pulling   Universal Display stock up alongside it.makeArticleAd();Here are three things you need to know about that.OLED screens -- and OLED stock -- are in focus today. Image     source: Getty Images.1. Susquehanna hails the newsIt's well-known thatUniversal Display is a supplierof OLED technology and OLED materials to Samsung -- which we now   know will in turn supply OLED screens to Apple. So naturally
column6: Universal Display shares shot 3.6% higher in Tuesday trading
column7: and   were up a further 4% on Wednesday morning. Helping to keep   the momentum train moving was a new initiation of coverage on the   stock from Susquehanna. As reported onStreetInsider.comaround about midnight last night
column8: Susquehanna has initiated   coverage of Universal Display stock with a ""positive"" rating and   a big
column9: round price target of $100.2. Stay tuned for more newsSusquehanna's new rating implies a one-year profit potential   of nearly 50% on Universal Display stock
column10: which currently sells   for just $67 and change. That's a big return for just one year's   investment
column11: and we'll get our first clue as to whether it's a   realistic hope next week.On Thursday
column12: Feb. 23
column13: Universal Display plans to release its   financial results for fiscal Q4 and full-year 2016.3. What analysts predictHere's what Wall Street analysts are telling investors to   expect from that report: Profit growth of 8%
column14: from $0.39 per   share earned a year ago to $0.42 in profits for Q4 2016. And   sales growth of only 10%
column15: with $68.6 million in quarterly sales   expected.If these modest numbers seem like pretty slim reeds to be   supporting Susquehanna's expectation of a 50% surge in stock   price at Universal Display -- well
column16: they may be. Based on its   most recent reported results
column17: Universal Display stock currently   sells for nearly 79 times trailing earnings
column18: and 46 times   trailing free cash flow. But these numbers could be shrinking   soon
column19: as Universal Display's sales (and earnings) increase to   meet the new demand for OLED smartphone screens.According to data fromS&P Global Market Intelligence
column20: analysts are looking for Universal Display stock to earn only   $0.88 for fiscal 2016 as a whole. But that number is expected to   jump 40% to $1.23 in fiscal 2017
column21: then rise to $2.08 in 2018
column22: and   $2.80 in 2019. Put it all together
column23: and forecasts currently call   for a compound annual earnings growth rate of 47%.What it means for investorsAnd I think you'll agree --ifUniversal Display can hit the numbers Wall Street is laying out   for it
column24: then 47% annualized growth should be sufficient to   support a stock selling for 46 times trailing free cash flow.Whether Universal Display stock can hit and maintain   Susquehanna's new $100 target price though

It probably depends a   lot on whether Universal Display can both achieve the growth   rates Wall Street is already expecting -- and then keep those   rates growing further.10 stocks we like better than Universal     DisplayWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: 5 High-Tech Cash Cows Yielding Up To 6%;2/15/2017;"By Brett OwensThe technology sector has long been the growth investor's best   friend
column2: with tomorrow's innovations fueling the breakneck gains   necessary to generate big price returns. Traditionally there   hasn't been much to interest us dividend investors - until   now.Some tech companies have finally grown up. And while their   profit growth has slowed
column3: their shareholder returns have actually   accelerated. These companies literally make more money than they   know what to do with - so they are increasingly dishing it back   as dividends.Here are five tech titans with big cash flows paying yields up   to 6%.makeArticleAd();Qualcomm (QCOM)Dividend Yield:4%Qualcomm (QCOM)has wandered its way back into 4% yield territory
column4: but right now
column5: the wireless technology specialist is in extremely choppy   waters.QCOM shares have eaten 20%-plus losses since mid-January after   Apple (AAPL) filed suit against the company
column6: and the Federal Trade   Commission filed charges against QCOM

column11: because Qualcomm has been a serial dividend   raiser that still had plenty of ceiling with a 65% payout   ratio.Could Qualcomm's (QCOM) Dividend Generosity Be in Peril?QCOM might be a playground for speculators banking on a big   pop if the Apple

column15: and currently has the stock   sniffing at all-time highs.Spintronics
column16: according to the company
column17: ""utilizes electron spin   rather than electron charge to acquire
column18: store and transmit   information."" The technology has a wide range of uses. For   instance
column19: in Q3
column20: the U.S. Army awarded NVE Corp a small $141
column21: 000   contract for ""new ultra-fast spintronic radar detectors and   spectrum analyzers based on arrays of metallic or metal/insulator   nano-scale magnetic diodes.""However
column22: the stock's rise doesn't match up with the   fundamentals
column23: which include years of fairly stagnant top and   bottom lines. But the real issue is the dividend
column24: which doesn't   seem to add up. NVEC pays out $1 quarterly
column25: yet earned just $2.53   last year
column26: and is expected to bring in $2.76 and $2.73 in profits   over the next two years. On an annual basis
column27: dividends have   outstripped operational cash flow over the past couple years
column28: too.NVE Corp (NVEC) Might Be Reaching a PlateauNothing here screams imminent collapse
column29: but this doesn't look   like a particularly secure payout
column30: and if anything
column31: hikes to the   dividend seem unlikely. Plus
column32: a forward P/E in the high 20s and   prices near all-time highs signal that now would be a terrible   time to speculate.Seagate Technology (STX)Dividend Yield:5.5%Seagate Technology (STX)is a longtime maker of hard disk drives
column33: solid state drives and   other electronic data storage solutions. It also has been the   source of heartburn for investors
column34: who enjoyed 600% gains from   mid-2011 through 2015
column35: then watched the bottom fall out by 70%   through mid-2016.Since then
column36: STX has logged a 130% rebound to reach its current   price around $46.The one constant over that time has been a rapidly improved   dividend that surged from 18 cents to the current 63-cent payout   - a 250% increase that has shares yielding well more than 5% even   as shares continue to run hot.Looking forward
column37: the company's improved profitability means   the dividend is safe and likely has room for improvement.   Analysts are tracking earnings of $4.49 per share this year and   $4.55 next
column38: which puts the company's payout ratio at a   comfortable 55%.But growth seems almost entirely out of the picture. Revenues   have been on the decline since 2012
column39: and the top line is expected   to slip in each of the next two years - all of this mirroring the   shrinking PC market that Seagate feeds off.Seagate's (STX) Dividends Compensate for a No-Growth StorySeagate should continue to be a considerable source of income   going forward
column40: and may yield well more than the 5.5% it currently   boasts. Any additional capital gains from here would simply be   gravy ... but don't bet the farm on them.Iron Mountain (IRM)Dividend Yield:6%Data storage real estate investment trustIron Mountain (IRM)has been pointed in the same general direction - up - ever since   its 1996 initial public offering
column41: but the going over the past few   years has been simply nauseating. In just the past year's worth   of trading alone

column43: a 25% dive and   a 16% rebound.Still
column44: if you're willing to close your eyes and wait out the   roller coaster

column46: including cloud backup and data management
column47: it also provides   actual physical records storage
column48: shredding and even business   solutions. In other words

The company's most recent 48.5-cent payout is an 80% improvement   over its last quarterly distribution from its pre-REIT life. And   IRM's substantial yield has powered the majority of the stock's   returns over the past few years.Iron Mountain (IRM) Keeps Cranking Out     DividendsIron Mountain's financials are as temperamental as the share   price
column52: with revenues and earnings vacillating from year to year.   But the pure income potential makes IRM worth it.Nokia (NOK)Dividend Yield:6%Nokia (NOK)is no longer the fine purveyor of seemingly invincible cellular   phones

column54: like Qualcomm

column7: in trading today Apple Inc (Symbol: AAPL) is up about 0.3%
column8: Microsoft Corporation (Symbol: MSFT) is down about 0.6%
column9: and Amazon.com Inc. (Symbol: AMZN) is up by about 0.3%.For a complete list of holdings

Comparing the most recent share price to the 200 day moving average can also be a useful technical analysis technique --learn more about the 200 day moving average ».makeArticleAd();Exchange traded funds (ETFs) trade just like stocks
column14: but instead of ''shares'' investors are actually buying and selling ''units''. These ''units'' can be traded back and forth just like stocks
column15: but can also be created or destroyed to accommodate investor demand. Each week we monitor the week-over-week change in shares outstanding data
column16: to keep a lookout for those ETFs experiencing notable inflows (many new units created) or outflows (many old units destroyed). Creation of new units will mean the underlying holdings of the ETF need to be purchased
column17: while destruction of units involves selling underlying holdings
column18: so large flows can also impact the individual components held within ETFs.Click here to find out which 9 other ETFs had   notable inflows »"

column1: Free Profits on Groupon Inc (GRPN) Stock After Q4 Earnings;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsJim Cramer saidGroupon Inc(NASDAQ:GRPN) ""is a beast"" today on CNBC. All I know is that if I can find it on Groupon
column3: that's where I'm buying it. The company isn't going anywhere
column4: and that's enough for me to trade GRPN stock virtually worry-free.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockI could spend an hour dissecting the technical aspect of Groupon's price charts and poring over its fundamentals
column5: but I won't. Why not? Because GRPN options give the flexibility to create income based on the aforementioned logic without even spending a penny out of pocket.I want to sell downside risk against levels I deem safe. This is
column6: as I like to say
column7: the equivalent of me selling someone else a losing lottery ticket. I'll collect the premium today
column8: but it won't be mine to use until the contracts expire or I close the trade. If the price of GRPN stock stays above my level
column9: I win the bet - and whoever bought the lottery ticket loses their price premium to me.How to Trade GRPN Stock HereThe bet:Sell a GRPN Jan 2018 $3 put for 40 cents to open. By selling naked puts
column10: I commit to buying the stock at that price if it falls below it. So my breakeven price is $2.60 per share. I feel comfortable owning Groupon stock at $2.6 should the worst-case scenario happen. This would be close to the all-time low in the stock.9 Top Pharmaceutical Stocks to Buy for the DividendsA really bullish trader could spend the premium on buying calls to further make their position in GRPN stock even more bullish. That's not for me. I have more faith that buyers will step in to support the stock on dips than I am of chasing the rallies.Usually I like to balance my trades by selling opposing bearish risk
column11: but in this case
column12: I feel like I would be opening myself to undue risk. So I will leave this trade one-sided as written.I am not required to hold my trade through its expiration. I can close it at any time for partial gains or losses. Also

column1: Will Apple
column2: Inc. Really Double Its Services Business in 4 Years?;2/15/2017;"About a year ago
column3: Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) began spending more time discussing its services   business during its quarterly earnings calls. It's pretty clear   why it decided to do so -- the services segment is the only   aspect of Apple's business that is still growing   consistently.On the first quarter earnings call last month
column4: Apple CEO Tim   Cook announced an ambitious goal of doubling the company's   services revenue in the next four years. That's a big reason whyApple stockhas rallied more than 10% in the past few weeks
column5: reaching a new   all-time high.makeArticleAd();Apple YTD Stock Performance
column6: data byYCharts.Plenty of analysts and other pundits areskeptical that it will be feasibleto double the services business in four years
column7: barring a big   acquisition. But here are three reasons why doubling the services   business might not be so hard after all.Services growth is acceleratingFirst
column8: the services segment's growth trajectory is better than   it seems. For Q1 of fiscal 2017
column9: Apple reported an 18% year over   year increase in services revenue
column10: down from 26% growth a year   earlier.These figures make it seem like Apple's services growth is   already slowing. Considering that Apple needs to grow its   services revenue at a 19% compound annual rate to double it in   four years
column11: this would be an ominous sign.However
column12: in the first quarter of fiscal 2016
column13: Apple benefited   from a one-time $548 million gain related to a patent   infringement lawsuit. Excluding that patent revenue
column14: Apple's   services revenue grew only 15% in Q1 2016
column15: but surged 30% year   over year last quarter. Thus
column16: Apple doesn't even need to maintain   its recent services growth rate to hit its target.The App Store is gaining scaleA second factor working in Apple's favor is that the App Store   has recently become the largest contributor to Apple's services   revenue.App sales have been growing at a fast clip for many years
column17: but   Apple only reports its net revenue from the App Store. The   portion of App Store sales that goes to developers -- which   ranges from 70%-85% -- doesn't show up in Apple's financial   statements. Apple earns an extremely high profit margin on App   Store revenue due to this accounting policy
column18: but the growth of   this revenue stream hasn't been very material until recently.Wall Street analyst Toni Sacconaghi estimates that Apple's net   App Store revenue reached $7.3 billion in the 2016 fiscal year   that ended last September. That would make it the largest piece   of Apple's services segment
column19: ahead of iTunes
column20: which faces secular   revenue declines.Furthermore
column21: the App Store continues to grow at a phenomenal   pace. Last month
column22: Apple reported that developers' earnings rose   more than 40% year over year during 2016. The pace of growth is   sure to slow over time
column23: but App Store revenue is on a trajectory   to more than double in the next four years
column24: providing a good   chunk of the services revenue growth Apple is targeting.The iPhone Upgrade Program could lift AppleCare revenueGrowth of the iPhone Upgrade Program is a third factor that   could contribute to increases in Apple's services revenue. For as   little as $32.41/month
column25: this program allows customers to get a   new iPhone every year by trading in their old one. Purchases   under the iPhone Upgrade Program include AppleCare+ enhanced   warranty coverage
column26: which is worth $129.The iPhone Upgrade Program is boosting AppleCare+ revenue.     Image source: Apple.Many iPhone fans have already enrolled in the iPhone Upgrade   Program
column27: but there's still plenty of room for growth. Apple could   potentially expand the program to more countries. It could also   consider creating similar programs for other devices like the   Apple Watch.These Apple-operated upgrade programs can drive significant   services revenue growth because AppleCare+ is part of the bundle.   Very few of these customers would be buying AppleCare+ if it were   still sold separately.A big reason for optimismApple's services business produced more than $24 billion of   revenue in fiscal 2016
column28: up from less than $20 billion a year   earlier. This allowed it to surpass both the iPad and Mac product   lines to become Apple's second-largest segment by revenue.Even if Apple misses its target of doubling its services   revenue by 2020
column29: it will certainly get a meaningful amount of   revenue growth from that segment. With strong services growth   ensuring that Apple's non-iPhone revenue will rise consistently   in the years ahead
column30: Apple will be well positioned to return to   strong earnings growth as the next iPhone sales cycle heats   up.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column31: it can pay to listen. After all
column32: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column33: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column34: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of them!     That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better     buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6

The     Motley Fool is long January 2018 $90 calls on Apple and short     January 2018 $95 calls on Apple. The Motley Fool has adisclosure policy."

column1: New Facebook Inc (FB) Video App Is Part of a Greater Plan;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsVideo is becoming increasingly important toFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB). Social media users are big on watching video
column3: and video ads are an important revenue stream. But FB was missing out on the video action when members put down their smartphones to fire up the big screen in their living room. Not any longer. The company announced it's releasing a new Facebook video app for TV. The app will soon roll out to two of the most popular set-top streaming boxes.makeArticleAd();Source: FacebookYesterday
column4: FB made the announcement that it will bereleasing a new Facebook video app for TV.This will be an app that's available for some of the most popular set-top streaming boxes and Smart TVs. Specifically mentioned wereApple Inc.'s(NASDAQ:AAPL) Apple TV
column5: theAmazon.com
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN) Fire TV and Smart TVs fromSamsung Electronics Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF). Facebook also notes that more platforms will be supported in the future.Facebook Video App for TVLast year
column7: the company enabledsupport for mirroring Facebook videos on a TVfrom a mobile device. This required using Apple Airplay orAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOG
column8: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google Cast capabilities.7 Tech Stocks That Could Implode at Any MinuteThe new Facebook video app for TV cuts the Wi-Fi tether to a mobile device and lets users interact directly with the videos on their TV without picking up their device.""With the app
column9: you can watch videos shared by friends or Pages you follow
column10: top live videos from around the world
column11: and recommended videos based on your interests. You can also catch up on videos you've saved to watch later
column12: as well as revisit videos you've watched
column13: shared or uploaded.""Why Focus on Getting Facebook Video Onto TV Screens?FB CEO Mark Zuckerberg is intent on making video a priority for Facebook. He wasquoted in an investor callat the start of the month making that emphasis clear:""I see video as a mega trend on the same order as mobile. That's why we're going to keep putting video first across our family of apps and making it easier for people to capture and share video in new ways.""In 2016
column14: FB's push to video had resulted in users watching 100 million hours of video every day. Now the company is getting more aggressive about monetization. In January
column15: it began testing a feature that let video publishersinsert ads 20 seconds into watching their Facebook clips
column16: with FB taking 45% of the revenue generated.Yesterday's announcement of the Facebook video app for TV also included several new features for the company's core mobile users. Videos in the News Feed will now play with sound by default and the videos will be able to stay playing in picture-in-picture windows as users scroll through their News Feed.No
column17: Apple Inc. Is Not Releasing the iPhone 8 EarlyIn December
column18: FB was reportedlytaking to TV studios about the possibility of licensing content
column19: including traditional scripted shows
column20: live sports events and game shows. If the company ends up releasing licensed content from media companies (or even its own original content)
column21: a Facebook video app for TV means it can appeal to consumers who want to watch it as actual TV programming. And that introduces additional revenue opportunities - without having to split the cash with content uploaders.When Can We Expect the Facebook Video App for TV?FB is being a little vague about when it will actually release the app. The announcement says it will ""roll out soon to app stores for Apple TV
column22: Amazon Fire TV and Samsung Smart TV
column23: with more platforms to come."" So stay tuned. But with its lofty video ambitions

column1: Stock Market News for February 15
column2: 2017;2/15/2017;"Benchmarks sealed their fourth consecutive record highs on Tuesday after Fed Chair Janet Yellen indicated that a rate hike could occur sooner than expected. Following Yellen's statements
column3: banks rallied strongly following optimism about a higher interest rate regime. Apple also notched up yet another record high. Indicators of business optimism and inflation also registered good readings during the day
column4: leading to further optimism among investors at large.For a look at the issues currently facing the markets
column5: make sure to read today'sAhead of Wall Streetarticle.The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJI) increased 0.5%
column6: to close at 20

column8: 337.58. The tech-laden Nasdaq Composite Index closed at 5
column10: gaining 0.3%. The fear-gauge CBOE Volatility Index (VIX) decreased 1.2% to settle at 10.94. A total of around 6.7 billion shares were traded Friday
column11: matching the last 20-session average. Advancers outpaced declining stocks on the NYSE. For 50% stocks that advanced
column12: 46% declined.What Boosted The Benchmarks?Fed Chair Janet Yellen's first day testimony before Congress solidified the views that the Fed is more hawkish now. Yellen left the possibility of a rate hike open as early as the central bank's next policy meeting in March on Feb 14. Citing an improving economy and solid labor market
column13: she noted that waiting too long to hike rates would be unwise since it might hamper the broader financial markets. She reiterated some of the language from the Fed's last policy meeting that adopted a more hawkish outlook
column14: while indicating that she is concerned about the possibility of holding off rate hike for too long.Yellen expects gradual rate increases to occur amid a modestly expanding economy and inflation that should touch the Fed's desired target rate of 2% in the near term. She said that ""at our upcoming meetings
column15: the Fed will evaluate whether employment and inflation are continuing to evolve in line with…expectations
column16: in which case a further adjustment of the federal funds rate would likely be appropriate"".As Yellen signaled that the central bank could gradually raise interest rates sooner rather than later

column19: and 4.2% this month alone.Bank stocks jumped after Yellen's hawkish comments on interest rates. Higher longer-term interest rates can boost bank profits
column20: as they increase the spread between what banks earn by funding longer-term assets
column21: such as loans
column22: with shorter-term liabilities. Bank of America (BAC) rose 2.8% on Feb 14 to its best levels since Nov 2008

column1: Gas Up With Chesapeake Energy Corporation (CHK) Stock;2/15/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsGood news fromChesapeake Energy Corporation(NYSE:CHK) has this trader thinking it's time for investors to ""spend"" a little on CHK stock. But before you do
column3: take some of the speculation out of owning shares using a ""married put"" strategy to hedge your bet.makeArticleAd();Natural gas outfit Chesapeake delivered some good news to Wall Street Tuesday morning
column4: announcing it will spend $1.9 billion to $2.5 billion in 2017. The new capex data narrows prior guidance and provides clarity for CHK stock investors.Clarity-seeking investors should also be impressed withChesapeake's production forecast.The company's now sees 5% to 15% annual growth through 2020. The more upbeat narrative is a far cry from a year ago when Chesapeake's survival as an ongoing business was in question both off and on the CHK stock price chart.Chesapeake's rebounding prospects have been supported by asset sales
column5: debt reduction and some re-inflation of oil and gas prices over the past twelve months after hitting decade lows. And according to CEO Doug Lawler
column6: ""The execution of our 2017 capital program will position Chesapeake for significant production and earnings growth and cash flow neutrality in 2018.""With an improving picture for Chesapeake on the price chart
column7: it's time investors consider their own capital investment and spend a little something on CHK stock.CHK Stock Daily ChartClick to EnlargeI'm a sucker for stocks that appear to be making all the right moves technically
column8: but still maintain a flaw or two. The daily chart of CHK illustrates a bullish setup with a nice risk-to-reward. The situation is too good to be true.Over the past year CHK stock has gone from volatile short-covering style reactions
column9: up and down
column10: and into a more developed and stable uptrend.7 Tech Stocks That Could Implode at Any MinuteWith last week's low
column11: shares have pulled back 28% from an early and sudden December double-top high to successfully test the longer-term 200-day simple moving average and up-channel support lines.Traders using the chart for guidance are risking roughly 50 cents on the downside to see $1.50 to perhaps as much as $3 upside if CHK can resume its rally and retest the prior highs or possibly reach the upper channel line.Chesapeake Energy Married PutGiven the favorable risk-to-reward situation on the CHK price chart
column12: I like approaching CHK as a married put or synthetic long call. With earnings slated for late next week
column13: the protected position with its open-ended upside makes all the more sense.Reviewing the Chesapeake options board
column14: the April $6 married put for $6.78 is attractive. With shares at $6.42 this trader is paying 36 cents for more than two months of protection at a key low on the CHK chart.A trader that simply purchases CHK stock is of course
column15: free to set a stop-loss at the $6 level and the strike of the protective put. But at the end of the day - and particularly with earnings in the picture - there's always the possibility for major slippage when it comes time to actually exit the position.Apple Inc. Stock Keeps Rising
column16: Putting A Chokehold On Short-Sellers (AAPL)With the married put the trader is also initially leaving the upside open in an attempt to take advantage of a larger bullish reaction in CHK. If shares were to rally in front of the earnings event
column17: I'd personally consider selling the April $8 call if it trades for 20 cents or greater versus a current market price of 12 cents.Investment accounts under Christopher Tyler's management do not currently own positions in any of the securities or their derivatives mentioned in this article. column1: Warren Buffett Nearly Quadrupled His Apple
column2: Inc. Position Last Quarter;2/15/2017;"So much for that aversion to tech.The Oracle of Omaha made waves last year whenBerkshire Hathaway(NYSE: BRK-A) (NYSE: BRK-B) disclosed that it had picked up a   cool$1 billionworth ofApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) shares
column3: enough to scoop up 9.8 million shares.   It's worth noting that this initial investment decision was not   made by Buffett himself
column4: but rather one of his lieutenants.Berkshire then proceeded to buy an additional 5.4 million   shares in the second quarter of 2016
column5: increasing its position to   15.2 million shares valued $1.5 billion at the time. There was no   reported change in the number of shares during the third quarter
column6: although Berkshire enjoyed some gains as shares rose. Berkshire   has just filed itsForm 13Ffor the fourth quarter
column7: and it nearly quadrupled its Apple   position.makeArticleAd();Data source: SEC filings. Chart by author.Berkshire is now sitting on 57.4 million shares of the Mac   maker
column8: valued at $6.6 billion at the end of last year. Not many   investors can say this
column9: but Buffett now has a 1% stake in Apple
column10: which is a pretty tall order when we're talking about a $700   billion company. You can count on one hand the number of   institutional investors that have a stake greater than or equal   to Buffett's
column11: and most of those are fund families that aggregate   reported holdings across different funds.Apple was a big chunk of Buffett's buying spreeIn an interview with Charlie Rose a few weeks back
column12: Buffett   noted that Berkshire had acquired $12 billion in common stock in   the wake of the election
column13: which represented a significant   increase in buying activity. In contrast
column14: Berkshire bought   approximately $10 billion worth of equities throughallof 2015.Apple Store Third Street Promenade. Image source: Apple.While some of that $12 billion was seemingly purchased after   the new year
column15: and we don't know what prices Berkshire was buying   Apple at
column16: it's safe to say that a good chunk of that money was   allocated to the Mac maker. Apple's average share price during   the fourth quarter was right around $113
column17: which would translate   into $4.8 billion based on the additional 42.1 million shares   purchased during the quarter.Of course
column18: Buffett is far from a market timer
column19: but with shares   currently trading at all-time highs
column20: the increased position is   already faring quite well. Shares are already up 17% year to   date
column21: thanks in part to a record fourth-quarter earnings   release.AAPLdata byYCharts.Cash flow is one of Buffett's favorite investing metrics
column22: particularly compared to figures like net income
column23: which are   subject to more qualitative judgments from management and more   prone to manipulation in general. Apple has cash flow in spades
column24: and currently has thelargest cash positionof any company ever. The tech titan generated over $65 billion in   operating cash flow in 2016
column25: of which $52 billion was free cash   flow.If Buffett thinks Apple is undervalued enough to nearly   quadruple Berkshire's position
column26: he's probably on to   something.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column27: it can pay to listen. After all
column28: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column29: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column30: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of them!     That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better     buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of February 6
column31: 2017Evan Niu
column32: CFAowns shares of Apple. The Motley Fool owns shares of and     recommends Apple and Berkshire Hathaway (B shares). The Motley     Fool has the following options: long January 2018 $90 calls on     Apple and short January 2018 $95 calls on Apple. The Motley     Fool has adisclosure policy."
