column32: it's a global one.What Can Slow AmazonAmazon doesn't have to be stopped for AMZN stock to suffer. Any sign of a slowdown could cut its value by half
column33: or perhaps even more.Source:FlickrJeff Bezos has been honest about what could happen. He is worried about""trade and protectionist measures""from the new Administration
column34: and he isfiercely opposedto the Administration's recent orders on immigration.Political risks may have moved Bezos to buya $23 million housein Washington D.C. - and politics costs money. However
column35: thosepolitical risks are not just Americanand they are not just physical. A Balkanization of the Internet - the requirement that local data only be used locally
column36: and that citizens of each country read or see only what leaders want - could prove costly to implement. But
column37: it's already happeningin the world of books.Despite efforts to control costs by owning its own logistics
column38: delivery costs remain a concern.Is it Really Good to Be the King?Amazon may be King
column39: but the crown hangs heavy. AMZN managers know thatcompetitors are catching up in the cloud space
column40: Alphabet Inc.(NASDAQ:GOOGL) is challenging Alexa and has the capital to beat it in the cloud
column41: and Amazon's success with tabletshas the potential to threatenApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL).7 Marvelous Mid-Cap Stocks to Buy for the Best of All WorldsNo tree grows to the sky
column42: and likewise
column43: no business can conquer the whole world of technology
column44: media and retail. Amazon has a host of challengers wherever its managers look
column45: and its ambitions are also facing political resistance.Does this mean I'm selling out of Amazon stock and predicting a crash? No. But
column46: when everyone's telling you to buy something
column47: that's actually when you should start to worry
column48: and I've started to worry about Amazon.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column49: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing he owned shares in AMZN

column1: Nordstrom and Others Dump Trump: Here's Who Still Sells the Trump Brand;2/13/2017;"Ivanka Trump's fashion line has come under fire recently as the political turmoil surrounding President Donald Trump and his administration rages on. And now

column6: FacebookFBand MicrosoftMSFT
column7: took to the courts to fight against the controversial travel ban from seven Muslim-majority nations.The Trump Brand BattleMacy'sMstopped selling Donald Trump's line of menswear in Summer 2015
column8: after the then presidential candidate made inflammatory remarks regarding Mexican immigrants. NBC Universal
column9: owned by ComcastCMCSAended its business relationship with Trump for the same reason when it opted to no longer air his Miss USA and Miss Universe pageants.Donald Trump's critics have urged consumers to stop shopping at retailers that sell Trump family brands

column1: Apple Inc. Hits New All-Time Highs. What’s Next?;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsThe world's single most important stock and the largest U.S. issue in terms of market capitalization - tech giantApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) - is continuing its post-earnings melt-up on Monday. In fact
column3: AAPL stock is pushing to fresh record highs after eclipsing its early 2015 peak of $129.36 last week.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockThe catalyst for Apple stock wasbetter-than-expected quarterly resultsfeaturing a return to growth for the critical iPhone after a few quarters of declining sales. Despite criticisms over the loss of the analog headphone jack and the continuance of the 3-year-old iPhone 6 form factor
column4: the iPhone 7 has been a surprising hit.The buzz is building big-time for theexpected launch of the all-new iPhone 8later this year. Reports have been circulating that the new handset will debut exciting new features such as a wireless charging station that might allow users to charge the device from 15 feet away.So
column5: where does AAPL stock go from here?The 10 Best Stocks to Buy for 2017: The Experts' PicksRBC Capital Markets analysts surveyed investors over the last few weeks and discovered a few interesting takeaways that suggest prices could continue to grind higher from here.Many investors were neutral to underweight Apple stock heading into earnings on expectations of a modest pullback. Now
column6: they're debating whether they should build larger positions or wait for a pullback
column7: possibly in anticipation of an air pocket of iPhone 7 demand in the second quarter.Some hedge funds were using AAPL stock as a short play while holding longs in related component supplier stocks. Those trades are underperforming now
column8: resulting in some short covering demand for shares.Given Apple's large cash holdings
column9: there could be a surprise announcement at some point related to capital return to shareholders that could potential push shares toward the $180-a-share level.More modestly
column10: Goldman Sachs upped its price target on AAPL stockto $150
column11: which still is about 14% higher from here.Apple will next report results on April 25 after the close. column2: 700 mAh Battery;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsLeading theApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) rumor mill today is includes lots of iPhone 8 news. Today
column4: we'll look at that and otherApple Rumorsfor Monday.makeArticleAd();iPhone 8 Battery:A new rumor claims that the iPhone 8 will have a 2
column5: 700 mAh battery
column6: reportsAppleInsider. This rumor claims that the 2
column7: 700 mAh battery will fit inside a device with a similar form factor to the current 4.7-inch iPhone models. However
column8: the 2
column9: 700 mAh battery will give the device a battery life closer to the 5.5-inch devices sold by the company. The rumor claims that this is possible due to changes in how the logic board is set up. KGI Securities analyst Ming-Chi Kuo is the source of this rumor.iPhone 8 Accessories:Rumor has it that the iPhone 8 won't come with many accessories
column10: MacRumorsnotes. According to this rumor
column11: the tech company won't be including a Lightning to 3.5mm Headphone Jack Adapter with the device. This rumor also claims that there won't be a Lightning to USB-C Cable that comes with it either. The final bit of the rumor states that the iPhone 8 will be the only of the three rumored iPhone devices this year that will include wireless charging. However
column12: it claims that owners will have to buy a separate accessory to achieve this.iPhone 8 Display:A new report claims that Apple has signed a deal withSamsung Electronics Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) for more OLED panels
column13: reports9to5Mac. This report claims that SSNLF has agreed to make 160 million OLED panels for AAPL. These panels will likely go into the iPhone 8
column14: which is rumored to have an OLED display. This deal with Samsung appears to be an extension of a previous one for 100 million OLED panels.Check out more recentApple RumorsorSubscribe to Apple Rumors:RSSThe postMonday Apple Rumors: iPhone 8 May Use 4.7-Inch Form Factor with 2

column1: Alphabet Inc – Is Google Assistant Going Everywhere? (GOOGL);2/13/2017;"InvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAlphabet Inc's(NASDAQ:GOOG
column3: NASDAQ:GOOGL) Google Pixel Phone holds a significant advantage over third-party Android smartphones. Since its release
column4: Google Assistant - the new AI powered personal assistant - has been a Pixel Phone exclusive. Third-party smartphones remain stuck with the previous generation Google Now. However
column5: Google released an Android ""alpha"" build late last week and the new Android release enables Google Assistant on third-party smartphones.makeArticleAd();Source: GoogleGOOGL's third-party Android smartphone partners have been feeling a little betrayed since the release of the Pixel Phone last fall.Up until then
column6: Google had not been directly competing against them. It developed Android and allowed them to use the operating system on their phones for free - a fair trade off for the hundreds of millions of mobile devices defaulting to revenue-generating Google search. Google did release the Nexus line of smartphones
column7: but they were more of a showcase for Android than an attempt to compete against its partners.The Pixel Phone's Google Assistant AdvantageThe Pixel Phone changed the equation. It was stamped with the Google name for the first time and it was designed to compete head-to-head with the best of the Android smartphones. In another first
column8: a key new Android feature - Google Assistant - was a Pixel Phone exclusive. Google Assistant leverages Alphabet's latest AI technology in a personal digital assistant that goes beyond Google Now
column9: even gaining the ability to participate in two-way conversations.The situation was serious enough to help convince Android smartphone leaderSamsung Electronic Co Ltd(OTCMKTS:SSNLF) that it needed its own personal assistant. Samsung'sBixby is expected to debut on the Galaxy S8.7 Tech Stocks That Are Bucking the DowntrendNew Android Release Spills the Beans: Google Assistant for All?Android Policeexamined a developer ""alpha"" release of Android over the weekend and discovered thatGOOGL may be having a change of heartabout keeping Google Assistant to itself.Its team was able to activate and use Google Assistant on several non-Pixel smartphones
column10: including a Samsung Galaxy Note 5 running Android Marshmallow and a Nexus 6P running Android Nougat.This means that GOOGL is at least experimenting with making Google Assistant available to third-party smartphones in an upcoming new Android release.Where Would This Leave the Pixel Phone?While Google's Pixel Phone has premium design and a very nice camera
column11: its primary advantage over third-party smartphones is the exclusive availability of Google Assistant. Take that away and it's more or less competing on a level footing with the big guns from the likes of Samsung. True
column12: the Pixel Phone is guaranteed Android updates
column13: but that's no different than the Nexus phones.No
column14: Apple Inc. Is Not Releasing the iPhone 8 EarlyWith AI and digital assistants in the spotlight
column15: Google may have decided that having Google Assistant become a standard Android feature is important to maintain its lead overApple Inc.'s(NASDAQ:AAPL) iPhones and Siri.I wrote a few days ago about Google's struggle againstAmazon.com
column16: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMZN)in the smart home. The Amazon Echo and Alexa have taken a huge lead there and Google Assistant on the Google Home speaker and Pixel Phones may not be enough to catch it. If it were to give up its exclusivity and enable Google Assistant on third-party smartphones
column17: GOOGL would suddenly have hundreds of millions of additional devices in play. This would give it far more leverage against Amazon
column18: at the cost of the Pixel Phone competing on a more level playing field.And the company has always marketed the Pixel Phone as being the ""first phone"" with Google Assistant - not the ""only phone"" - leaving the door open for an eventual general roll-out.Of course
column19: at this point we aren't certain that GOOGL will pull the trigger. The new Android release in question is alpha software - that'sbeforebeta. The company may simply be having some developers test Google Assistant compatibility with third-party hardware with no intention of actually opening up the feature. However
column20: hints like the message ""New! You just got the Google Assistant"" suggest that GOOGL is leaning toward ending Pixel Phone exclusivity and rolling out the AI-powered feature as part of a general Android release.As of this writing
column21: Brad Moon did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceIs Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Ending the Age of Intel (INTC)?Report: Apple Inc. iPhone 8 Could Cost More Than $1
column22: 000 (AAPL)The postAlphabet Inc - Is Google Assistant Going Everywhere? (GOOGL)appeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 2 Bullish Analyst Notes Push Apple
column2: Inc. Closer to All-Time Highs;2/13/2017;"It's been nearly two long years
column3: butApple(NASDAQ: AAPL) shares are back at all-time highs last seen in   April 2015. The record trade set back then was $134.54
column4: and   shares are currently trading within pennies of it. Investors have   spent much of the past year fretting about peaking iPhone sales
column5: with the modest gain posted in the fourth quarter quelling some   concerns.Shares are rising today as at least two Street analysts are   taking bullish stances: Goldman Sachs analyst Simona Jankowski   and UBS analyst Steve Milunovich.Services should be worth moreMilunovich believes that even at record prices
column6: Apple shares   are still undervalued. The analyst points to the company's   services business
column7: believing that investors aren't fully   appreciating the growing segment. For reference
column8: services revenue   comprises 12% of total sales over the past four quarters. While   Apple doesn't break out profitability by segment
column9: services are   generally always higher-margin than hardware. That's particularly   true for the agency model used in the App Store
column10: since Apple only   recognizes the net portion of what it keeps (as opposed to the   wholesale
column11: where Apple must record costs as well
column12: which is used   for iTunes Music downloads).makeArticleAd();Apple Pay is part of Apple's growing portfolio of services.     Image source: Apple.Apple's installed base continues to grow
column13: and the company   enjoys extremely high levels of customer retention. New and   existing customers continue to spend more and more on digital   content and services. The number of customers transacting is   jumping double digits
column14: as is the average revenue per paying   customer; Apple is hoping todouble services revenueover the next four years. Milunovich believes that if the market   were to value Apple's services business in line with other   publicly traded comparable peers
column15: shares would ""be at least 10%   higher.""The analyst reiterated a buy rating this morning alongside a   $138 price target.3D sensing and augmented reality could be the next big   thingJankowski similarly reiterated a buy rating this morning
column16: but   meaningfully increased her price target from $133 to $150.The analyst is bullish on the prospect of this year's   10th-generation iPhone including innovative new features like3D-sensing technologyfromLumentum(NASDAQ: LITE) . The potential iPhone supplier reported earnings   last week and noted on the call that it had ""shipped our first   revenue into what we believe could be a high-volume mobile device   application
column17: and that the company is ""very encouraged by the   progress and key milestones achieved to date on this   application."" When pressed further about receiving ""more   visibility into one customer in particular
column18: CEO Alan Lowe said   there were multiple mobile device manufacturers that are sampling   the company's offerings. Lowe added: ""I would hate to give away   any of their secrets
column19: and as we start including meaningful   revenue in our guidance
column20: we will talk more and more about it. But   suffice it to say that the milestones that we achieved over the   last six months increase my confidence in our ability to make 3D   sensing a meaningful part of our business as we look   forward.""Jankowski believes that Apple could be using 3D sensing to   implement some type of augmented reality (AR) application
column21: which   CEO Tim Cook has beentalking an awful lot aboutlately. This has the potential to be the next iPhone's killer   feature.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Why Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Holders Shouldn’t Sweat Snapchat;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsLast month
column3: yours truly here opined thatFacebook Inc(NASDAQ:FB) had nothing to worry about with online messenger rival Snapchat. The service has become big enough to merit its parent company going public as a means of taking Snapchat to the ""next level."" But when all is said and done
column4: I think FB stock - even with its new challenges - still will be the better investment of the two.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockSome new data and details about Snapchat's parent Snap's IPO have materialized in the meantime.After giving that new information some thorough thought
column5: I'm actuallymoreconvinced Facebook stock is the better pick of the two.What's Snapchat?Snapchat
column6: for the unfamiliar
column7: is an internet messaging platform. Its ""shtick"" is simply thatthe posted videos
column8: photos and messages self-destruct a few moments after they're viewed. Its relatively new ""story"" feature will aggregate all your messages over the past 24 hours
column9: but after that
column10: they still vanish.More important
column11: Snapchat has a decent following. As of the latest look
column12: Snapchat boasts 158 million daily users
column13: which means it has a list of158 million consumersthat advertisers can market to. Not bad
column14: particularly given its age. Facebook still dwarfs Snapchat with its 1.23 billion daily users
column15: but Facebook had a multiyear head start andshouldbe bigger.7 Dividend Stocks for the Retirement You DeserveBesides
column16: Snapchat's year-over-year user growth pace wasin the mid-40%s overallas of the fourth quarter of last year. For its most recently-reported quarter
column17: Facebook'sdaily user growth was only up 17% year-over-year. Throw in the fact that advertisers are stoked about the fact that Snapchat is new and chic
column18: and FB stock holders have good reason to be concerned.Thing is
column19: looking beyond the table-pounding bullish rhetoric
column20: Snapchat (and by extension the upcomingSnap IPO) Facebook doesn't really have much to worry about.Losing SteamGiving credit where it's due
column21: Instinet's Anthony DiClemente may have said it best early this week when hereiterated the firm's Facebook stock price target of $165 and ""Buy"" rating:""Snap Inc. appears to be coming public later in its growth cycle than other internet companies
column22: adding just 5mn global daily active users (DAUs) last quarter
column23: demonstrating just 3% sequential growth. By contrast
column24: at the time of their respective IPOs
column25: Facebook and Twitter were growing nearly twice as fast. During 2016
column26: Snapchat added 51mn DAUs
column27: globally; by comparison
column28: Facebook added 190mn DAUs in 2016. Our checks indicate that Facebook maintains a substantial lead in mobile app downloads… We come away reassured that Facebook maintains the ability to mitigate competitive threats via product innovation […] Snapchat's user growth decelerated through 2H16
column29: following the launch of Instagram Stories.""In other words
column30: when Facebook went public back in 2012
column31: it was picking up steam. Snap is decelerating as it moves into its IPO.It's not just the notion that most social networking and messaging users have already made their choice that bodes poorly for Snap
column32: however. There's also the nagging reality that the strength of Snapchat's advertising model is still an unknown quality. Some of what we do know
column33: however
column34: isn't encouraging.Case in point: In November
column35: AdAge reported that the average video ad shown via Snapchat was viewed less than three seconds before that viewer skipped past it. That's not enough to pay off for an advertiser.Oh
column36: and let's not forget that Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerbergonce offered to acquire Snapchat for $3 billion. When Snap's chiefs said no
column37: Zuck boughtInstagraminstead
column38: and is now using it to club Snapchat into submission.Snapchat's growth pace was almost cut in halfafter Instagram's ""Stories"" - comparable to Snapchat's ""Story"" - was launched.Why Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Can Hit Goldman's $150 TargetAnd if the recent rise of Facebook stock is any indication
column39: the market agrees Snapchat just isn't going to play the role of David to the Goliath that Facebook is. FB stock is up 16% since the end of 2016 against a backdrop of Snap buzz.Bottom Line for FB StockCalling a spade a spade
column40: Snapchat is a wannabe
column41: jumping into the messaging fray when the premise of messaging was hot even if the business model wasn't proven. As is so often the case
column42: though
column43: the wannabe simply can't dethrone the entrenched powerhouse.That's not to say owners of FB stock have nothing to worry about.Chief Financial Officer David Wehner recently acknowledged
column44: ""We continue to expect ad revenue growth rate will come down meaningfully (in 2017)."" It is to say
column45: though
column46: the established cash cow can easily fend off Snapchat.The Snap IPO isn't as much a fundraiser to arm the company as it is an exit strategy for its insiders who didn't want to sell to Facebook five years ago.As of this writing
column47: James Brumley did not hold a position in any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlaceCan the Snapchat IPO Show Investors the Money?7 Stocks to Buy That Could Double by 20185 Income Tax Deductions You Can't Afford to MissThe postWhy Facebook Inc (FB) Stock Holders Shouldn't Sweat Snapchatappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: iShares Russell 2000 Index (ETF) (IWM) Is About to Break Out;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsBuyers continue to reign on Wall Street. Large-cap indices across the board tagged new all-time highs last week. But what's particularly interesting heading into the new week is the mega-breakout looming in small-caps. TheRussell 2000Index and its accompanying ETF - theiShares Russell 2000 Index (ETF)(NYSEARCA:IWM) - are poised to play some catch-up.makeArticleAd();Since screaming higher following the election
column3: IWM has been in a two-month holding pattern. Let's call it a high base
column4: and a tight one at that. For all its shaking and baking
column5: the IWM ETF has remained stuck in a 3.6% range between $133.50 and $138.50. With Friday's pop
column6: small-caps are now testing the top-end of the range.And since the rest of the broad market indices have already soared to new heights
column7: I see little reason why the Russell 2000 can't follow suit.One of the reasons why breakout patterns appeal to the chart-watching class is the ease with which trades can be built around them. A common trigger is to enter bullish trades once the stock finally succeeds in breaking above resistance. Such a victory is telling. It signals that buyers have finally mustered the strength to breach a ceiling that was previously unbreachable.7 High-Risk
column8: High-Reward Stocks to Buy NowThat type of force often results in multiple days of follow-through until the buying binge eventually exhausts itself.Click to EnlargeSource: OptionsAnalytixFor IWM
column9: the level to watch going into the new week is $138.82. Although Friday's rally rose above a few minor resistance levels
column10: $138.82 remains the all-time high for the fund.This price needs to broken for the bullish party to begin in earnest.Embrace Small-Caps for Big ProfitsWith implied volatility circling the drain
column11: long option trades remain a cheap way to grab exposure to IWM. Buy the April $138/$143 bull call spread for around $2.25. The $5-wide vertical consists of buying the $138 call while selling the $143 call. The initial cost of $2.25 represents the max risk and will be forfeited if IWM sits below $138 at expiration.To minimize the damage
column12: you could consider exiting if IWM falls below the lower end of its range at $134. A decline below that threshold will invalidate any breakout attempt.On the profit side
column13: the IWM call vertical spread offers $2.75 of potential reward that you will capture if the ETF can rise above $143 by expiration.As of this writing
column14: Tyler Craig owned bullish positions on IWM.More From InvestorPlaceGo Long Advanced Micro Devices

column2: Inc. (AMD) Stock … With Insurance!;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsLast year's turnaround inAdvanced Micro Devices
column4: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMD) is back in play and looking good for investors. But with key product rollouts looming
column5: don't be too Zen about the trend being your friend. Instead
column6: control your destiny with a little insurance against AMD stock.makeArticleAd();Source:Matthew Rutledge via FlickrAs I wrotelast monthin front of earnings
column7: 2016 was the best of times for AMD stock
column8: and for good reason. Of course
column9: 2017 is looking good as shares continue to gain on the company's improving business trend. Shares were catapulted to new multiyear highs after fourth-quarter earnings topped Wall Street's views.Still
column10: the rest of the year is looking like make-or-break time for the semiconductor outfit for two reasons: Ryzen and Vega.Ryzen is set to be released in early March as Advanced Micro Devices' new CPU for PCs and servers. The main competition is chip giantIntel Corporation(NASDAQ:INTC) - a company facing itsown design challengesand whose manufacturing lead will shrink markedly with the release of Ryzen.On the conference call
column11: Advanced Micro Devices teased investors
column12: stating it had secured a number of high-end PC design wins for Ryzen
column13: which is based on AMD's next-gen Zen CPU core architecture.Advanced Micro Devices is also releasing its Vega GPU line in 2017. The product is expected to come to market during the second quarter and has its sights on gaining market share in the server and high-end PC markets.7 High-Risk
column14: High-Reward Stocks to Buy NowThe big competition in this space isNvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA). Nvidia's software dominance will be a substantial challenge for AMD to crack
column15: but one it's readying for with an open-source approach.Advanced Micro Devices must successfully execute for AMD stock to have any chance to keep building on its red-hot 2017. If not
column16: it would undo a significant amount of price action.AMD Stock ChartClick to EnlargeSince discussing AMD back in January (yellow oval highlight)
column17: shares have confirmed what we saw as a fairly common corrective move by blasting higher to new multiyear highs.It goes without saying that the price action has been very generous for AMD investors. But notwithstanding the company's obvious business risks
column18: there's no reason to believe the stock's bullish trend won't still be friendly
column19: and won't still improve.The better part of last week has been spent digesting the bullish gains in AMD stock
column20: though not to point of finding support from an overbought stochastics. It's a minor concern. My technical point of view? AMD's constructive price action and potential for improvement outweighs this secondary price indicator.How to Trade AMD Stock Right NowWith AMD stock at $13.58
column21: I like the April $17/$12 collar.The collar - priced for $13.78
column22: or 20 cents over a naked long stock purchase - allows for guaranteed downside protection at $12 and amounts to an effective stop-loss of about 13%.Why Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock Can Hit Goldman's $150 TargetThe insurance policy afforded by the $12 put is stationed a few percent below December's highs in AMD and pennies under the post-earnings closing print. The protection could come in handy.If bullish momentum does prevail
column23: profits are initially capped by the $17 call. At April expiration
column24: that works out to a gain of more than 23% if shares are at or above the sold strike. column1: Trading Freeport-McMoRan Inc (FCX) Stock’s Battle with Indonesia;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsDriven by rising metals prices and uncertainty surrounding global metals trade
column3: Freeport-McMoRan Inc(NYSE:FCX) kicked off 2017 with a bang. FCX stock surged more than 26% in January
column4: hitting a fresh 52-week high in the process. But unsavory developments at its most profitable mine
column5: the Grasberg mine in Indonesia
column6: have created quite a stir for Freeport-McMoRan investors so far in February.makeArticleAd();Source:Nick Bastian via Flickr (Modified)The question is
column7: ""Is it time to double down on FCX stock
column8: or bail on the shares until the Grasberg situation rights itself?""The Grasberg mine is the world's most productive gold mine and the second-most-productive copper mine. It also Freeport's biggest revenue generator. The trouble revolves aroundmining and export permitswith the Indonesian government.Specifically
column9: the government is happy to issue a new mining permit
column10: but is balking on the original terms of the export agreement - which included lax export taxes. Freeport says it needs the original agreement in for its long-term investment plans to work out.So far
column11: there is no deal
column12: though Freeport remains hopeful an agreement will be reached.7 Dividend Stocks for the Retirement You DeserveIn the meantime
column13: copper prices spiked on Friday
column14: and are likely to continue higher afterBHP Billiton Limited (ADR)(NYSE:BHP) declared force majeure at its Escondida mine in Chile
column15: the world's biggest copper mine. Production at Escondida is now on hold
column16: and copper prices surged 4.6% following the news.The jump in copper was a boon for FCX stock
column17: which added 2.6% on Friday - though the shares are still down more than 3% month-to-date. Technically
column18: support lies in the $15 region for Freeport-McMoRan
column19: with 50-day moving average providing additional leverage for the shares. Resistance is thick in the $16.50-$17 region
column20: however
column21: and likely won't fall unless the Grasberg mine situation is resolved favorably.Sentiment is understandably mixed as a result. Thomson/First Call reports that 13 of the 20 analysts following FCX stock rate the shares a ""hold"" and the 12-month consensus price target of $14.76 represents a discount to Freeport-McMoran's close on Friday. In short
column22: the resolution of the Grasberg mine issue could elicit a round of upgrades or downgrades depending on how things play out.Click to EnlargeSurprisingly
column23: FCX options traders have sided firmly with the bulls. Currently
column24: the March put/call open interest ratio comes in at 0.58
column25: with calls nearly doubling puts among FCX options set to expire within the next two months. What's more
column26: the most popular March strike is the $18 call
column27: where more than 30
column28: 000 currently reside.Volatility is also notably brisk for FCX stock. March implieds are pricing in a potential move of more than 11% for the shares
column29: placing the upper bound at $17.59 and the lower bound near $14. If the Grasberg mine situation plays out unfavorably
column30: $14 is a definite possibility
column31: while the upper bound near $17.59 could fall in short order on a positive outcome - especially given BHP's trouble in Escondida.2 Trades for FCX StockCall Spread:With March calls leaning toward a bull run for FCX
column32: I'm inclined to side with the majority here. Traders looking to bet on a resumption of January's rally might want to consider a March $16/$17 bull call spread. At last check
column33: this spread was offered at 37 cents
column34: or $37 per pair of contracts. Breakeven lies at $16.37

column2: Inc. (QCOM) Stock: Is the Worst Over?;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column3: Stock Advice & Trading TipsAll's fair in love and war .. and apparently business
column4: at least until you get caught and sued
column5: that it. That's the situation leading wireless communications chipmakerQualcomm
column6: Inc.(NASDAQ:QCOM) finds itself in right now. The company is being sued by both the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) andApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) for allegedunfair licensing practices and monopolistic behavior. QCOM stock has taken a serious hit in the wake of these lawsuits
column7: leaving many to wonder if the worst has already been factored in.makeArticleAd();Source: ShutterstockToday
column8: we have a pair of trade ideas for those eyeing the bullish side of QCOM.The aforementioned lawsuits
column9: combined with additional selling pressure due to a poor showing withfirst-quarter earnings
column10: has Qualcomm stock trading down more than 18% so far in 2017. But the shares showed some signs of bouncing back on Friday
column11: with QCOM bouncing off support near $52 and reclaiming its 10-day moving average in the process.Bargain hunting is the most likely culprit
column12: as QCOM stock traded in oversold territory for roughly a week heading into Friday's session. If the market has decided the worst is now factored into shares
column13: the stock could have plenty of short-term upside.Take Qualcomm's sentiment backdrop
column14: for example. Despite the lawsuits and poor earnings showing
column15: the stock has yet to see a single ""sell"" rating from the brokerage bunch. According to Thomson/First Call
column16: there are 14 ""holds"" and 16 ""buy"" ratings levied at QCOM stock
column17: and the 12-month consensus price target is holding at $65.53 - a full 21% north of the shares' current perch.7 Marvelous Mid-Cap Stocks to Buy for the Best of All WorldsWhat's more
column18: short sellers are abandoning QCOM in droves. During the most recent reporting period
column19: the number of shares sold short plunged 9% to 12.4 million
column20: representing less than 1% of the stock's total float. With short sellers jumping ship
column21: it's a good bet that worst is already priced in - and Qualcomm could be headed higher once more.Click to EnlargeQCOM options traders
column22: meanwhile
column23: have taken up a bearish stance. Currently
column24: the March put/call open interest ratio rests at 1.08
column25: with puts and calls in near-parity. That said
column26: the biggest spike in OI in the March series has been at the $50 strike
column27: and appears to be almost entirely made up of sell-to-open activity
column28: indicating bullish-to-neutral put sell action.Checking in with March implieds
column29: options are pricing in a potential move of about 6% for QCOM in the coming month. This places the upper bound at $57.20
column30: while the lower bound rests near $50.80.In short
column31: the March $50 strike appears to be an excellent place for put selling activity
column32: while a rally to $57.20 would leave the shares well short of overhead resistance near $60.2 Trades for QCOM StockCall Spread:For those looking to bet on a short-term comeback for QCOM stock
column33: a March $55/$57.50 bull call spread has some impressive profit potential. At last check
column34: this spread was offered at 57 cents
column35: or $57 per pair of contracts.Breakeven lies at $55.57
column36: while a maximum profit of $1.93
column37: or $193 per pair of contracts

column40: this put was bid at 38 cents

column4: Stock Advice & Trading TipsU.S. stock futures are trending higher this morning
column5: as Wall Street looks toward softening trade rhetoric from the White House on Japan and China. Furthermore
column6: while there is a lack of economic data
column7: President Donald Trump is scheduled to meet with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau. On the corporate front
column8: Verizon Communications Inc.(NYSE:VZ) is making headlines after offering its first unlimited wireless data plan since 2011.makeArticleAd();At last check
column9: futures on theDow Jones Industrial Averagewere up 0.27%
column10: withS&P 500futures rising 0.22% andNasdaq-100futures up 0.16%.On the options front
column11: volume was brisk on Friday
column12: with about 17.3 million calls and 14.8 million puts changing hands on the session. Over on the CBOE
column13: the single-session equity put/call volume ratio rose to 0.70
column14: but the 10-day moving average ticked lower to 0.70.Turning to Friday's volume leaders
column15: Nvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA) saw mixed options activity and dropped 2.4% on Friday despite posting record holiday quarter earnings results. Meanwhile
column16: Twitter Inc(NYSE:TWTR) puts were active after the company logged its 10th straight year-over-year drop in quarterly revenue andActivision Blizzard
column17: Inc.(NASDAQ:ATVI) announced blowout results and a $1 billion buyback program.Nvidia Corporation (NVDA)Nvidia traders were looking for a reason - any reason - to take profits off the table after the stock returned to all-time-high territory near $120 last week. And they got it inThursday night's quarterly report. Despite record earnings of 99 cents per share and sales of $2.2 billion - both of which beat Wall Street's targets of 83 cents per share on revenue of $2.1 billion - traders instead focused on Nvidia's conservative first-quarter guidance of $1.9 billion (plus or minus two percentage points)
column18: versus expectations for $1.88 billion.NVDA stock dropped nearly 2.4%
column19: pushing the shares below their 10-day moving average and driving heavy put volume heading into the weekend. In total
column20: NVDA saw 828
column21: 000 contracts cross the tape on Friday
column22: with puts and calls nearly split on the session.That said
column23: NVDA is still trading north of peak Feb call and put open interest at $110
column24: which totals 9
column26: 000 contracts
column27: respectively. Additionally
column28: while put adds were seen building at the Feb $107 strike
column29: so too were traders targeting the Feb $115 call strike. Once profit taking plays out
column30: NVDA should begin to move higher once again.Twitter Inc (TWTR)TWTR stock continued to see fallout from itsdisastrous fourth-quarter earnings report. The struggling social media firm logged its 10th straight year-over-year quarterly decline and its slowest revenue growth since it went public four years ago.Many TWTR bulls were hoping that Twitter would get a ""Trump bump"" from the political stir President Donald Trump has caused since his election
column31: but ad revenue from the increased Twitter attention didn't materialize.The poor report sent many scrambling for the exits
column32: and TWTR options traders flooded the stock with puts on Friday. Total volume rose to 609
column33: 000 contracts
column34: with calls snapping up 55% of the day's take. Twitter is now trading at its lowest point since June last year
column35: with the dip below $16 threatening to push the stock below peak Feb put OI of nearly 20
column36: 000 contracts at the $15 strike.And there are plenty of put traders looking for just such a break later this week
column37: with 11
column38: 800 Feb $13 put contracts and another 7
column39: 200 puts open at the Feb $14 strike. TWTR stock is trading slightly higher in premarket action this morning
column40: and it may be only a matter of time before takeover and buyout rumors start swirling once again.Activision Blizzard
column41: Inc. (ATVI)With graphics chip makersAdvanced Micro Devices
column42: Inc.(NASDAQ:AMD) and Nvidia reporting record holiday profits
column43: it should come as no surprise that one of the largest video game makers in the world would also post a blowout quarter. Activision Blizzard said itearned 92 cents per share in the fourth quarter
column44: besting the consensus by 19 cents. Revenue also topped the Street's view
column45: coming in at $2.45 billion.Trade of the Day: Play a Torrid Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock RallyBut while ATVI surged nearly 19% on Friday
column46: options traders didn't appear to be chasing the stock. Total volume came in at 316
column47: 000 contracts
column48: with calls only managing 52% of the day's take. In fact
column49: puts easily outnumber calls in the Feb series
column50: indicating that ATVI options traders are looking for a correction or a pullback in short order.That said

column52: and it could be a bit before options traders adjust to the stock's new perch in the $47 region.As of this writing

column1: BlackBerry Ltd (BBRY) Might Actually Make Money Again Someday;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsRememberBlackBerry Ltd(NASDAQ:BBRY)? Yes
column3: BBRY is still in the game. It's in a minor league
column4: a software and services league
column5: but it's still trying to play.makeArticleAd();Source:WEi WEi via FlickrBlackBerry stock is up a little so far this month
column6: as the company has signed licensing deals around the world
column7: one of which will result in a phonebeing shown at the next Mobile World Congress. BBRY is also getting a push higher in Monday's premarket trading.The company is like a faded star plotting a comeback by playing in tiny bars. But
column8: under CEO John Chen
column9: formerly ofSybase
column10: there is also something now that didn't exist for a long time: hope for a profit.Whether you
column11: as an investor
column12: should be betting on that hope is another matter. But
column13: there is hope for BBRY stock.7 Tech Stocks That Are Bucking the DowntrendHope in SecurityBlackBerry used to be a name to reckon with
column14: a big player in mobility
column15: back when it was all about e-mail and voice
column16: back beforeApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) grabbed the market.Watch early seasons ofThe Good Wife
column17: a CBS legal drama launched in 2009
column18: and you'll see BlackBerry devices in every hand until
column19: without any discussion
column20: they suddenly disappeared late in the run.BlackBerry had a reputation for security. President Obamahad to use a BlackBerrybecause it was considered more secure. All the nonsense about Hillary Clinton and her e-mails involved use of a BlackBerry.Security is still the company's calling card. This month
column21: BBRY launched a software development kitaimed at helping enterprises secure their messaging
column22: voice and video traffic. The hope is that it can compete withTwilio Inc(NYSE:TWLO)
column23: a cloud-based messaging system I profiledearlier this month
column24: and whose market cap of $3 billion compares with BlackBerry's $3.87 billion.There is
column25: unfortunately
column26: less to this than meets the eye.Stripped Down and Sobered UpChen has gotten out of areas where it costs money to compete
column27: like hardware
column28: and focused on extracting cash from the company's old software. He has licensed BBRY's key software to companies in China
column29: Indonesia and India
column30: takingas little as $1 per deviceto get the BlackBerry brand back on the market.The consensus among analysts is that BlackBerry will report a narrow loss of just three cents per share and revenue of $295.8 million when it next reports earnings on March 21. Profits might then follow.Chen has drastically shrunk the balance sheet over the last year and cut debt to less than 25% of assets. The asset base at the end of October was barely half of what it was a year earlier
column31: but with just $607 million in debt on $3.35 billion in assets
column32: there's a real company there.7 High-Risk
column33: High-Reward Stocks to Buy NowBy licensing old software
column34: which only needs to be maintained
column35: and by putting it into the cloud as a low-cost security offering
column36: Chen hopes to resurrect BBRY as a profitable secure messaging vendor.The problem lies in one word: old. Software does not age well. Applications from the last decade
column37: no matter how good their claimed security
column38: are not going to be as powerful or flexible as those that are being custom-designed for today's clouds and devices. I think BlackBerry's dreams of competing with Twilio are just that - dreams.Bottom Line for BlackBerry StockBlackBerry has a lot of dreams right now
column39: though. It dreams of having Asian companies bring its once-valuable trademark back to popularity by putting it into cheap Android hardware with local branding. It dreams of being a cloud-based security vendor. It dreams of immigrant developers choosing to join it instead of an American company
column40: thanks to Trump.I'm an old man with dreams
column41: too. I just won't ask you to bet on me.Dana Blankenhornis a financial and technology journalist. He is the author of the sci-fi novellaInto the Cloud
column42: available at the Amazon Kindle store. Write him atdanablankenhorn@gmail.comor follow him on Twitter at@danablankenhorn. As of this writing

column1: Consumers' 5 Most Beloved Companies;2/13/2017;"makeArticleAd();Market-research agency MBLM has released its 2017Brand Intimacy Report
column2: seeking to understand the part that emotion plays in successful   companies. The report reveals that the top brands ""are exemplars   in building emotional bonds and deep connections with their   customers and creating stronger attachment and engagement.""This deeper relationship leads to stronger financial   performance
column3: as these companies enjoy higher revenue and earnings   than their peers; the study reveals that the stock prices of the   top companies significantly outperformed theS&P 500. It also provides insights into specific demographics such asmillennialsorbaby boomers. Break out the hearts and flowers
column4: as we look at the companies   that have the greatest emotional attachment for consumers.NFLX
column5: HOG
column6: AMZN
column7: DIS
column8: AAPL
column9: SPY Price Percentage Change data   byYCharts.Netflix is most-loved among the 18-34 year demographic.     Image source: Netflix.5. Netflix
column10: Inc.The report found that escapist brands performed well over the   past year. With nearly 50 million U.S. subscribers
column11: Netflix(NASDAQ: NFLX) may provide one of the most popular forms of   escape. Our ubiquitous streaming provider had the highest   percentage of ""bonding"" customers -- those that express   acceptance and trust of the company. It jumped from 25th place to   5th place in the last year
column12: yet was only listed as an intimate   brand by those aged 18-34. This represents a huge future   opportunity
column13: as Netflix is revered by a significant percentage of   the youngest portion of the population. The phrase ""Netflix and   chill"" entering the popular lexicon is an indication of the reach   of this company into pop culture
column14: and the loving feelings of   customers for one of our favorite purveyors of entertainment.A favorite brand among 45- to 64-year olds. Image source:     Pixabay.4. Harley-Davidson
column15: Inc.TheHarley-Davidson(NYSE: HOG) brand is iconic and steeped in Americana. This   company provides distraction of another variety. The report notes   that ""Harley-Davidson offers escape on the road
column16: freedom and   solitary time."" Harley was only listed as an intimate brand by   those aged 45 to 64. It has a higher price point than some   competitors
column17: and distinctive designs give the brand an image of   exclusivity
column18: resulting in an extremely fervent following among a   small percentage of the population. It should be noted that this   company is the exception among consumer favorites
column19: having   underperformed the S&P 500 over the three-
column20: five-
column21: and   10-year periods. We still love you
column22: bro.Amazon is loved across all demographics! Image source:     Amazon.com.3. Amazon.com
column23: Inc.The largest e-commerce company in the world
column24: Amazon.com(NASDAQ: AMZN)  was one of two brands that were the most   successful in eliciting emotion across all ages and income   brackets. It also offers escapism similar to Netflix via its   Prime Video streaming service. Analysts estimate that Amazon has   Prime members in more than half the households in the   U.S. With its ability to provide all things to all people
column25: Amazon can often be found gracing the lists of companies with the   best customer service
column26: as well. This alone may account for a   great many of customers' expressions of amour for this   company.The Happiest Place on Earth. Image source: Author.2. The Walt Disney CompanyDisney(NYSE: DIS) ranked highest for nostalgia -- as the report says
column27: ""memories of the past and the warm
column28: poignant feelings associated   with them."" The House of Mouse has been providing entertainment   and escape for generations of fans since it first releasedSnow White and the Seven Dwarfsback in 1937. It has also continued to grow with fans
column29: adding   such favorites as theStar Warsand Marvel Studios movies in recent years. This shows
column30: as it   ranked No. 1 among millennials and No. 3 among those aged 35 to   44. With a strong showing among the youngest consumers
column31: this   translates to opportunities for relationships with the next   generation of fans.Apple is the most beloved brand. Image source: Apple
column32: Inc.1. Apple
column33: Inc.Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) was the most beloved brand in the survey. With its   cultlike following and consistent marks for quality and user   appeal
column34: it most successfully crossed age
column35: gender
column36: and income   boundaries. Apple scored highest in a variety of measures in the   report
column37: including enhancement (becoming better through use of the   brand)
column38: ritual (ingraining the brand in daily activity)
column39: and   identity (reflecting an aspirational image). It ranked highest in   the fusing category
column40: in which the identities of the customer and   the brand are ""inexorably linked."" It also ranked highest under   ""can't live without it"" and ""frequency of use."" According to the   report
column41: ""Electronics are the things that surround you and involve   you with the world
column42: and nobody does electronics better than   Apple. It brings ""connected"" to a whole new level.Investor takeawayAccording to Mario Natarelli
column43: MLBM's managing partner: ""The   underpinning of intimacy is the closer you get to your customer
column44: the better. That's not a new idea."" As each of the companies on   this list demonstrates
column45: there are a multitude of ways to reach   your customers on an emotional level. Be it by escaping
column46: connecting
column47: or nostalgia
column48: it isn't so much how you establish that   relationship
column49: it's that you do. When consumers feel the love
column50: they will show you the money.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
column51: it can pay to listen. After all
column52: the newsletter they have run     for over a decade
column53: Motley Fool Stock Advisor
column54: has tripled the market.*David and Tom just revealed what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy right now... and Apple wasn't one of them!     That's right -- they think these 10 stocks are even better     buys.Click hereto learn about these picks!*Stock Advisor returns as of January 4

column1: Nvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Has Become a Short Target;2/13/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsShares ofNvidia Corporation(NASDAQ:NVDA) dropped last Friday following the company's latest financial results. NVDA stock
column3: which was one of the hottest stocks of 2016
column4: declined following results in what I deem a classic ""pop-and-drop"" move.makeArticleAd();When bullishness reaches extremes in any given stock
column5: index
column6: commodity or currency
column7: an inevitable period of consolidation (if not an outright correction) sets in. While it is too early to tell which will be the case for NVDA stock at this juncture
column8: following last Friday's post-earnings move
column9: active investors and traders would be wise to respect both sides.On Thursday
column10: Feb. 9
column11: Nvidia reported fourth-quarter earnings of $1.13 per share on revenues of $2.17 billion. Impressively
column12: sales were higher by 55% year-over-year and higher by 8% sequentially. These numbers were great by just about any measure
column13: yet analyst expectations of future results had also risen sky-high.When the going gets too good
column14: investors inevitably exhaust their buying efforts - and upside becomes limited.NVDA Stock ChartsBefore looking closer at last Friday's pop-and-drop in Nvidia shares
column15: let's first gain some perspective from the multiyear weekly chart.Click to EnlargeHere we clearly see the stock's near-vertical ascent in 2016
column16: which has its MACD momentum oscillator at the bottom of the chart dramatically overbought.7 Dividend Stocks for the Retirement You DeserveTo clarify
column17: just because a momentum oscillator is ""overbought"" does not mean a stock can't continue to move higher. In fact
column18: one could have made the ""overbought"" argument through this lens for most of the second half of last year. And look at what happened.NVDA stock continues to trend higher
column19: but last December
column20: a red exhaustion candle appeared on the weekly chart. The stock then paused for a few weeks but began to rally again over the past three weeks. Last Friday's pop-and-drop move left another bearish candle behind on the weekly chart right around the same spot as the December highs (near the $120 mark).On the daily chart
column21: we see that Nvidia stock rose steadily over the past couple of weeks (nearly 20%) as investors and traders bid up the stock ahead of its earnings report.Click to EnlargeThrough the lens of investor psychology
column22: I would argue that this resembled late-comer traders who wanted to possibly profit from another post-earnings rally.On Friday
column23: NVDA managed to stay in the green for a paltry 20 minutes after the earnings report
column24: but enthusiasm was quickly greeted with sellers. After it was all said and done
column25: Nivida shares closed about 2.4% lower on the day
column26: cleanly rejecting the highs from last December.Hate Apple Inc. (AAPL) Stock
column27: But Love This TradeLess risk-averse traders could now try to play NVDA stock from the short side using last Friday's intraday highs and an initial profit target near $105.Alternatively
column28: traders could either wait for another follow-through selling day to initiate small short positions. Option traders may want to sell out-of-the-money call spreads for some income.Like what you see? Sign up for our dailyBeat the Belle-letter and get Serge's investment advice delivered to your inbox every morning!You can also download his6 Keys for Successful Trading and Investing.More From InvestorPlace10 Best Stocks for 20177 Marvelous Mid-Cap Stocks to Buy for the Best of All Worlds7 High-Risk
column29: High-Reward Stocks to Buy NowThe postNvidia Corporation (NVDA) Stock Has Become a Short Targetappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: Apple's iPhone Loses the China Sales Crown: 3 Reasons It Doesn't Matter;2/12/2017;"Cue the blaring headlines about howApple's(NASDAQ: AAPL) iPhone is doomed in China.Late last month
column2: Counterpoint Research stated that the   best-selling smartphone of 2016 in China wasnot an iPhone. The last time an iPhone didn't hold the top spot was 2012. Last   week
column3: IDC piled on
column4: reporting that the iPhone continued to lose   market share in China last quarter
column5: posting a double-digit sales   decline.Various pundits have highlighted these recent reports
column6: claiming that they show Apple is in trouble in China. However
column7: the decline in iPhone sales last year was neither shocking nor   alarming -- and Apple is likely to return to strong growth in   China later this year.makeArticleAd();iPhone sales declined significantly in China in 2016. Image     source: Apple.The proliferation of models dilutes salesOne big reason an iPhone wasn't the top-selling phone in China   last year is that Apple is selling more models there than ever   before. A few years ago
column8: two or at most three iPhones would have   accounted for virtually all of the iPhones sold in China in a   given year. By contrast
column9: Apple sold at least eight different   iPhones at various points during 2016.This proliferation of models is mainly an outgrowth of Apple's   decision to start building 4.7- and 5.5-inch versions of each   year's flagship iPhone. Additionally
column10: Apple's September release   schedule for new iPhones means that its shipments in each year   are split between multiple models.Indeed
column11: Apple shipped 44.9 million iPhones in China last year
column12: according to IDC. Yet it shipped only around 12 million units of   the iPhone 6s
column13: its best-selling model of 2016. Two or three years   ago it would have been unthinkable that the top-selling iPhone   accounted for less than 30% of total iPhone shipments in   China.Revenue has already stabilized in Mainland ChinaLast quarter
column14: Apple reported that its revenue in the Greater   China region fell 12% year over year. That would seem to line up   with the recent IDC report
column15: which found that iPhone shipments   were down 12.8% year over year in China during the quarter.iPhone sales in China are already starting to stabilize.     Image source: Apple.However
column16: on Apple's earnings call
column17: CEO Tim Cook stated that   within Mainland China
column18: revenue was flat last quarter. The big   declines mainly came from Hong Kong. Furthermore
column19: on a   constant-currency basis
column20: Apple's sales in Mainland China   increased 6% year over year.Rising sales for the iPad
column21: Mac
column22: and Apple's services   businesses drove this solid performance. However
column23: given that   iPhone sales dwarf all of these other product lines combined
column24: it's possible that iPhone shipments didn't fall as much as the   preliminary IDC estimate indicated.The next-gen iPhone could be a smashing successThese first two issues suggest that pundits may be   exaggerating the severity of last year's iPhone sales decline in   China to some extent. Nevertheless
column25: it's indisputable that iPhone   sales fell. The bigger problem with these analyses is that they   ignore the strong cyclical trend in iPhone sales that has emerged   in China in recent years.Up until 2014 or thereabouts
column26: Apple's growth in China was   mainly driven by the growth of the middle class and the addition   of new iPhone carrier partners. Revenue in Greater China surged   78% in fiscal 2012 as Apple began selling the iPhone throughChina Telecom
column27: which nearly doubled its addressable market in China.Revenue growth in Greater China slowed to 13% in fiscal 2013   and 17% in fiscal 2014. The uptick in growth in fiscal 2014 was   surprisingly small
column28: given that Apple addedChina Mobile-- with its nearly 800 million subscribers -- as a carrier   partner during that year.The problem was that the iPhone 5s looked almost identical to   the prior-generation iPhone 5. Since iPhones function as status   symbols in China
column29: most potential buyers want one thatlooks distinct from older models. They got that with the iPhone 6 and iPhone 6 Plus
column30: which both   were significantly larger than any of Apple's previous iPhone   models. This helped Apple grow its revenue in Greater China by   84% -- nearly $27 billion -- in fiscal 2015.By contrast
column31: the iPhone 6s and iPhone 6s Plus looked very much   like their predecessors. (The main draw was the addition of a   ""rose gold"" color option.) The iPhone 7 didn't do much to   distinguish itself from older models
column32: either. It
column33: too
column34: had a new   color option -- jet black -- and the larger iPhone 7 Plus model   has a dual-lens camera
column35: but otherwise it looks quite similar to   the two-year-old iPhone 6 design.But Apple is likely to introduce a radically redesigned iPhone   later this year. Doing so will give Chinese consumers the   distinctive iPhone they want. As a result
column36: iPhone sales are   likely to return to strong growth in China in late 2017 or 2018
column37: depending on availability.Sluggish iPhone sales in China aren't an indication that Apple   is in trouble. The extreme preference for distinctive new models   virtually ensures a ""two steps forward and one step back"" growth   pattern in China. Apple's next leap forward could be less than a   year away.10 stocks we like better than AppleWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: Intel Corporation Expects to Grow Client Computing Group Profit Margin;2/12/2017;"A little while back
column2: microprocessor giantIntel(NASDAQ: INTC) merged its PC client group business with its   mobile group to form its client computing group. CCG is Intel's   largest business by revenue
column3: generating nearly $33 billion in   sales during 2016.Most of that revenue comes from sales of processors and   related components into personal-computer systems
column4: although the   company has seen reasonable success from the sale of chips that   power cable gateways and
column5: more recently
column6: cellular modem chips   intoApple's(NASDAQ: AAPL) iPhone.Navin Shenoy
column7: general manager of the company's client     computing group. Image source: Intel.makeArticleAd();At Intel's Feb. 9 analyst day
column8: company management went over   its financial expectations for this segment for 2017 -- and   beyond. Let's take a closer look.Next year's expectationsIntel says it expects CCG revenue during 2017 to drop by a   mid-single-digit percentage
column9: which I take to mean between 5% and   7%. It's worth noting that the chipmaker had originally expected   flat-to-low single-digit revenue growth for this segment in 2016   when it provided a preliminary forecast at the end of 2015
column10: and   then it revised its guidance down during the year to call for a   revenue decline
column11: but it ultimately ended up seeing CCG revenue   grow by 2% for the year.The company's revenue forecast appears to be in line with its   overall personal-computer industry unit forecast
column12: which the   company acknowledges is lower than what some of the estimates   from third-party analysts have published.What this suggests is that Intel is not only taking what it   refers to as a ""cautious outlook"" on the total addressable market   within the personal-computer market
column13: but that it also doesn't   expect a repeat of last year's average selling price performance   in which it saw its processor average selling prices rise
column14: helping to offset the industrywide unit decline.As far as CCG profitability goes
column15: Intel says it aims to see   CCG operating margin outperform CCG revenue growth. Or
column16: put   another way
column17: it expects operating-margin growth.How Intel will grow CCG operating margin longer     termIn a previous column
column18: I went over why Intel expects its profit   margins in its fast-growing data-center group (DCG) todeflate in the coming years.Two of the drivers expected to hurt DCG's operating margin   going forward -- namely adopting newer
column19: more expensive   manufacturing technologies before CCG does and taking on a larger   part of the company's shared operating expenses -- should serve   as tailwinds to CCG operating margin going forward.First
column20: if Intel is allocating more of its shared operating   expenses to DCG and away from CCG
column21: then this should have the   effect of lowering CCG's operating expenses. Lower operating   expenses
column22: all else being equal
column23: means that more of each dollar of   revenue gets turned into operating profit -- in other words
column24: higher operating margin.Next
column25: if Intel's personal-computer processors will adopt new   manufacturing technologies only after DCG has had the opportunity   to break them in
column26: then CCG should get the benefit of higher   manufacturing yields for newer products. Higher yields mean a   lower effective cost per chip
column27: which for a given selling price   means higher gross profit margin. Higher gross profit margin
column28: assuming fixed operating expenses
column29: means higher operating   margin.CCG is a cash machine
column30: not a growth engineIt's clear that Intel is now running its personal-computer   chip business for maximum profitability
column31: not for growth.Now
column32: this doesn't mean the chipmaker can just halt all   investments in future products or even get complacent -- Intel   can't maintain its profit engine here if it builds bad products   or even builds good products but markets them ineffectively.But what it does mean is that CCG is going to have to be more   careful with each of its research and development dollars
column33: and   it's probably only going to adopt new manufacturing technologies   for very high-volume products once the costs of those new   technologies has come down considerably.CCG is still going to be extremely important for Intel over   the long term
column34: but that importance will -- if Intel is successful   -- continue to diminish in the years ahead.10 stocks we like better than IntelWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: 3 Warren Buffett Stocks to Buy in February;2/12/2017;"Warren Buffett will likely go down in history as the greatest   investor of all time. Starting with a relatively small sum while   working out of his Nebraska home in the 1960s
column2: his personal   fortune is now estimated at $73 billion. If you're trying to get   ahead in the stock market
column3: there's nothing wrong with trying to   mimic Buffett's blueprint for success: Invest in wide-moat   companies that have an easy-to-understand business
column4: and throw off   tons of free cash flow.Buffett no longer makes all of the investment decisions atBerkshire Hathaway(NYSE: BRK.B)  -- he has turned some of those duties over to   his younger deputies. But if we look at what Berkshire owns
column5: we   can choose from the list to see which are good buys this   February. Below
column6: I'll share three that stick out.Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();Buffett can't ignore the cash this company is throwing     offIt's highly likely that Buffett wasn't behind Berkshire's   investment inApple(NASDAQ: AAPL)
column7: but he's nonetheless probably very pleased with   it. The Cupertino giant announced earnings last month that   highlighted just how strong the company has become.Fellow Fools have alreadycoveredwhat a big hit the iPhone 7 Plus was
column8: but since this is about   Buffett
column9: let's cover the factors that he would likely focus   on.For starters
column10: the company now has almost a quarter-trilliondollars on its balance sheet. That's mind-boggling. But it   doesn't end there: The company has spit out $53 billion in   free cash flow over the past year alone
column11: and it has only needed   to use 23% of that to pay its dividend. Currently yielding 1.8%   today
column12: there's clearly lots of room for that to grow.But perhaps most importantly
column13: the stock is still much cheaper   than the market. It trades for 16 times trailing earnings and   just 13 times free cash flow.This big dividend is looking pretty good right     nowInvestors are nervous that global car buying has hit a peak.   The cycle is turning
column14: they believe
column15: and we're about to see a   contraction in car sales both domestically and abroad. That helps   explain whyGeneral Motors(NYSE: GM) is so cheap right now. But Buffett likely appreciates   just how high the barriers to entry are in the auto industry
column16: as   this makes the moat surrounding the company formidable.The company came out with earnings this month thatconfirmedsome suspicions: Sales climbed just 1.2% during 2016
column17: and the   company was unable to turn a profit in either Europe or South   America.Image source: GMC.But this company is much more disciplined than its defunct   predecessor: Cost controls are much tighter -- with the company   choosing to slow down production in the face of waning demand.   That discipline means the company should be able to weather any   downturn and emerge much stronger.Currently
column18: GM trades for a measly six times earnings and   seven times free cash flow. At the same time
column19: the company brought   in $7 billion in free cash flow over the past year and used just   one-third of that cash on its dividend. With that dividend   currently yielding 4.2%
column20: the reinvestments that will accumulate   over time will add significantly to Buffett's -- and your --   returns.We've only scratched the surface of non-cash     paymentsFinally
column21: we haveVisa(NYSE: V)
column22: part of the global duopoly of non-cash payments. Like   the others
column23: the behemoth came out with earnings recently that   demonstrated just how strong the company's moat really is. As   more vendors accept Visa worldwide
column24: shoppers are incentivized to   use the card. And as more shoppers use the card
column25: vendors are   incentivized to accept it. It's a virtuous cycle thathelpedrevenue grow by 25% last quarter -- though acquisition of the   company's Europe operations helped there
column26: too.The business is also very capital-light: Net profit margins   can come in as high as 40%
column27: and that produces a lot of cash. Visa   delivered $5.5 billion in free cash flow over the past year
column28: while using only one-third of it to pay out dividends.Image source: Getty Images.Speaking of the dividend
column29: while today's current yield of 0.8%   might not look impressive
column30: it masks management's commitment to   consistently growing the payout. Over the past five years
column31: the   company has grown its payout by over 11%per year. If you're a long-term
column32: buy-to-hold investor
column33: you understand how   those increases can compound over time to produce impressive   gains.If you're new to investing and looking for a place to start
column34: any one of these three stocks -- owned by Warren Buffett himself   -- would be a great starting place for building your own   portfolio.10 stocks we like better than VisaWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip

column1: 3 High-Yield Dividend Stocks You Definitely Want to Consider;2/11/2017;"Many high-yielddividend   stocksare now trading at a premium to the market and their industry   peers
column2: due to the multi-year bull market and low interest rates   inflating demand for income stocks. But with interest rates set   to rise this year
column3: investors should be wary of dividend stocks   that have historically low yields and historically high   valuations.It might seem tough to find undervalued stocks with high   yields in this frothy market. So in this article
column4: I'll highlight   three stocks that still trade at discounts to their industry   peers while offering yields higher than 3% --Qualcomm(NASDAQ: QCOM)
column5: Verizon(NYSE: VZ)
column6: andChina Mobile(NYSE: CHL) .Image source: Getty Images.makeArticleAd();QualcommShares of Qualcomm
column7: the biggest mobile chipmaker in the world
column8: have fallen nearly 20% since the beginning of 2017 due to an FTC   lawsuit regarding the company's licensing practices
column9: several related lawsuitsfrom longtime customerApple(NASDAQ: AAPL)
column10: and mixed first quarter earnings.The main bear case against Qualcomm is that its core business   model -- which uses a high-margin portfolio of patents to support   its lower-margin chip business -- could be crippled if it's   forced to lower its licensing fees
column11: which many OEMs and   regulators claim are too high. Qualcomm's chip business would   continue losing market share to cheaper chipmakers likeMediaTekand first-party chipmakers like Apple andHuawei. To top it off
column12: the probes and lawsuits could derail its   proposed takeover ofNXP Semiconductors(NASDAQ: NXPI)
column13: which would make it the largest automotive   chipmaker in the world.Meanwhile
column14: the bulls believe that a Republican-led FTC will   drop the case
column15: Qualcomm will eventually reach a settlement with   Apple
column16: and the NXP deal can still clear its regulatory   hurdles.Regardless of the outcome
column17: the steep sell-off has made   Qualcomm shares fundamentally cheap at 14 times earnings -- which   is much lower than its industry average of 22. Qualcomm has hiked   its dividend annually for 14 straight years
column18: and currently pays a   forward yield of 4% -- which is comfortably supported by its   payout ratio of 63%.VerizonShares of Verizon have slipped 10% since the beginning of the   year
column19: due to a mixed first quarter earnings report
column20: a (recently   dropped) FCC probe of its zero-rating strategies
column21: and   uncertainties regarding its planned acquisition of Yahoo's   internet business and rumored interest in Charter Communications.   All those question marks made Verizon look riskier than its   primary rivalAT&T(NYSE: T)
column22: which dipped just 3% this year.But that fear also made Verizon a value play at 14 times   earnings
column23: which compares favorably to AT&T's P/E of 17 and   the industry average of 25 for domestic telcos. The company has   also raised its dividend annually for a decade
column24: and currently   pays a forward yield of 4.8% -- which matches AT&T's yield.   Verizon's payout ratio of 66% also gives it plenty of room for   dividend hikes in the future.Regardless of questions surrounding Verizon's near-term moves
column25: the telco remains the  largest wireless carrier in the U.S.
column26: and won't likely lose that title anytime soon. Analysts expect   Verizon's revenue and earnings growth to remain nearly flat this   year
column27: but the company's low valuation
column28: high yield
column29: wide moat
column30: and   expanding digital ecosystem still make it an ideal income play   for conservative investors.China MobileInvestors looking for an overseas domestic telco might   consider buying China Mobile
column31: thebiggest wireless carrierin China (and the whole world). The carrier had 849 million   customers at  the end of 2016
column32: and a large number of its 2G   and 3G users upgraded to higher revenue 4G plans throughout the   year. It also has a small but growing wireline business with 79   million customers
column33: which could eventually enable it to launch   more comprehensive digital bundles like AT&T and Verizon.China Mobile is one of three state-owned telcos in China. The   Chinese government sometimes rotates its management with that of   its two peers --China TelecomandChina Unicom-- to ensure healthy competition between the three players. This   prevents China Mobile from ever becoming a monopoly
column34: but it gives   it a comfortable safety net which limits its downside during   market declines.China Mobile has a trailing yield of 3.1%
column35: which is supported   by a payout ratio of 42%. Its forward yield is uncertain
column36: since   it adjusts the payment every year based on its earnings
column37: but its   yield has stayed between 3% to 5% over the past five years. Its   semi-annual yield might not appeal to income investors looking   for quarterly payments
column38: but China Mobile's trailing P/E of 15   makes it a solid value play compared to other foreign telcos
column39: which have an industry average of 18.The key takeawayQualcomm
column40: Verizon
column41: and China Mobile all have wide moats
column42: low   valuations
column43: and high dividends. Their near-term growth might seem   glacial
column44: but I believe that they all have less downside potential   than other income plays
column45: which are trading at premiums to the   market -- which makes them solid long-term plays at current   prices.10 stocks we like better than Verizon     CommunicationsWhen investing geniuses David and Tom Gardner have a stock tip
