column1: Qualcomm (QCOM) Earnings: Why QCOM Stock Is A Buy;1/25/2017;"Shares of Qualcomm (QCOM) are edging lower in the after-market session Wednesday
column2: down about 1.3% even though the wireless chip giant reported fiscal first quarter earnings beat Wall Street estimates. Despite the bottom-line miss
column3: it’s tough to ignore the potential value QCOM stock presents.Indeed
column4: Qualcomm is facing some battles. Still
column5: I would place a bet here on QCOM shares
column6: which are priced at just 12 times fiscal 2017 estimates of $4.74 per share. Trading in the after-hour session at around $55
column7: QCOM stock should reach $62 to $65 in the next 12 to 18 months delivering 18% returns. And the gains could go higher assuming its legal battle with Apple (AAPL) gets resolved
column8: as I expect it will.The company’s guidance
column9: for instance
column10: underscores the extent to which the management remains focus on execution. For the second quarter
column11: Qualcomm is forecasting adjusted earnings per share to be in a range of $1.15 to $1.25. This compares favorably toThomson Reuters forecast of about $1.20 a share. This make Qualcomm — from a valuation perspective — easy to like at current levels. I’ll get back to that in a moment. Let’s go through he numbers.makeArticleAd();Forthe quarter that ended December
column12: the San Diego-based company reported a net income of $700 million
column13: or 46 cents a share
column14: down from $1.5 billion
column15: or 99 cents a share
column16: a year earlier. On an adjusted basis
column17: when taking out one-time gains and costs
column18: the company would have earned $1.19 a share
column19: which beat analysts estimates by a penny. First quarter revenue rose 4% year over year to $6 billion
column20: but fell shy on estimates of $6.12 billion.“We are pleased with the strong start to our fiscal year and the year-over-year earnings growth across both our semiconductor and licensing businesses
column21: ” said CEO Steve Mollenkopf in a staement. “Looking ahead
column22: the pending NXP acquisition accelerates our strategic transformation in the high growth areas of automotive
column23: IoT
column24: security and networking. We are very well positioned to lead as the semiconductor engine for the intelligent
column25: connected world.”Revenue in the licensing business (Qualcomm Technology Licensing (QTL))
column26: which sells sells applications processors and cellular baseband devices
column27: grew 13% year over year to $1.8 billion
column28: while QCT revenue
column29: which exists to monetize Qualcomm immense IP portfolio
column30: came in at $4.1 billion. These gains offset revenue in Mobile station modem (MSM) chip shipments
column31: which includes the Snapdragon LTE modem
column32: which declined 10% year over year $217 million.Ahead of the quarter
column33: analysts were also looking to see if the company discusses its $38 billion purchase of Dutch chipmaker NXP Semiconductor (NXPI). Qualcomm said it expects the transaction — subject to regulatory approval — to close by the end of 2017. What’s more
column34: the company said during the quarter
column35: $1.2 billion was returned to shareholders through a combination of buybacks and dividends."

column1: Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Q2 Earnings Preview;1/25/2017;"InvestorPlaceInvestorPlace   - Stock Market News
column2: Stock Advice & Trading TipsMicrosoft Corporation(NASDAQ:MSFT) stock has had an impressive run over the past few years. Heading into Thursday's fiscal second quarter earnings report
column3: MSFT stock is right near an all-time high
column4: having increased about 150% over the past few years.Source:Via MicrosoftWhat's interesting about the gains for such a large stock - MSFT is the third-most valuable company on U.S. markets
column5: behind onlyApple Inc.(NASDAQ:AAPL) andAlphabet Inc(NASDAQ:GOOGL) - is that they haven't been based on Microsoft earnings. Microsoft's EPS was $2.73 in fiscal 2012
column6: and $2.79 in fiscal 2016.makeArticleAd();Rather
column7: the multiple investors assign to MSFT stock has expanded. It has more than doubled
column8: in fact.That multiple expansion has come from increasing confidence toward Microsoft'sfutureearnings potential
column9: most notably in mobile and cloud. Where investors four to five years ago saw a fading giant whose earnings were likely to decline
column10: Microsoft now looks like a sleeping giant. And investors clearly believe the company's self-described ""mobile first
column11: cloud first"" strategy is going to push Microsoft earnings up - at some point.It's in that context that the market will analyze the Microsoft earnings report due on Thursday.Microsoft's Growth Isn't There…YetIt's always dangerous for an investor to believe that the numbers don't matter
column12: but in the case of MSFT stock
column13: the numbers really aren't the most important thing right now.10 Stocks to Buy to Survive a ""Trumpsy-Turvy""     2017Analyst consensus - informed in large part by Microsoft earnings guidance - doesn't predict a particularly impressive second quarter earnings report. The Street expects EPS to rise just a penny year-over-year
column14: which given share repurchases
column15: implies that Microsoft's total net profits actually will be lower in Q2 FY17 than they were ago.  Revenue is estimated to fall almost 2% year-over-year.Microsoft's guidance projects growth in its Productivity & Business and Intelligent Cloud segments
column16: but a sharp decline in More Personal Computing.That shouldn't be surprising. Office 365 growth has helped business revenue
column17: and the Azure platform continues to be a worthy
column18: if still much smaller
column19: competitor to Amazon Web Services in cloud. It's the potential for success in those products that has offset fears about continuing pressure on revenue from Windows
column20: as PC sales decline and mobile usage increases.Indeed
column21: the gain in MSFT stock from $27 to $63 has come mostly from the transition.The fears of Windows losses that led MSFT stock to be valued around 10x EPS in 2013 have turned to optimism toward growth in Azure
column22: Office 365
column23: Enterprise Mobility and other areas. That optimism has pushed the same stock to be valued at about 21x FY17 earnings.So it seems unlikely that investors will focus on the major headline numbers coming out of the Microsoft earnings report. A beat or miss of a penny or two on earnings likely isn't going to drive the market's reaction to the report - particularly if that weakness comes from Windows. Rather
column24: the focus is going to be on the growing
column25: smaller
column26: businesses
column27: most notably Azure.There's a reason Microsoft has steadily expanded its disclosure around Azure and cloud growth: That's where investor attention has been. And it seems likely that's where investor attention will stay coming out of the Q2 Microsoft earnings report.What to Watch For in Microsoft EarningsInvestors seem likely to have some patience with a modest miss in the Microsoft earnings report
column28: as expectations remain relatively low. The company still is getting out from under its deal withNokia Corp (ADR)(NYSE:NOK)
column29: and layoffs this year should provide a boost to margins over the next few quarters. Wall Street in particular isn't expecting growth to pick up until fiscal 2018
column30: where sales are projected to grow more than 6% against a rate under 2% in fiscal 2017.So what seems to be important in the Q2 Microsoft earnings report is whether the base of that growth is intact.While Azure is estimated to generate just 3% of total revenue
column31: accordingto analyst firm MKM Partners
column32: its growth rate certainly will be watched closely. After a 140% increase in Q2 FY16
column33: and 116% last quarter
column34: any slowdown seems likely to hurt the stock. But another 100%-plus figure would give further evidence that Azure is a worthy competitor to AWS
column35: and support the current MSFT stock price.The cloud business as a whole - including Office 365 and Dynamics
column36: which is trying to take share fromSalesforce.com
column37: Inc.(NYSE:CRM) - will be another area of post-earnings analysis.Here's Why Microsoft Corporation (MSFT) Stock     Will Hit $75What does that mean for Microsoft stock coming out of the Microsoft earnings report?Overall
column38: it means that the quarter seems likely to be judged more on ""feel"" than on the hard numbers. Even though cloud and mobile still aren't the majority of MSFT revenue or earnings
column39: they are the cornerstones of the Microsoft strategy going forward. And for now
column40: it's relatively clear that the market is content to wait for those sales and profits - as long as it continues to trust in that strategy.If Microsoft can deliver another earnings report that shows growth is on the horizon
column41: MSFT stock likely will rise - even if the headline numbers aren't perfect. But if there's any sort of stumble in either cloud or mobile
column42: that investor patience could reverse - quickly.As of this writing
column43: Vince Martin did not hold a position in   any of the aforementioned securities.More From InvestorPlace10 High-Yield Dividend Stocks That Are SOMEHOW     Still Bargains7 Straight-A Stocks to Build Your Portfolio     AroundMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Is Building an AI     MonsterThe postMicrosoft Corporation (MSFT) Q2 Earnings Previewappeared first onInvestorPlace."

column1: 3 ETF Myths And 4 Trading Tips From The Man Who Helped Launch SPY;1/25/2017;"Why is SPDR S&P 500 (SPY)
column2: beloved of so many investors in exchange traded funds
column3: like an   Apple (AAPL) iPhone? In both cases
column4: the teams who helped launch the products   did not anticipate they would revolutionize an industry.""When we designed SPY
column5: we had no idea how flexible the ETF   vehicle would turn out to be
column6: Jim Ross
column7: chairman of the global   SPDR business at State Street Global Advisors
column8: said Tuesday at   the 10th annual Inside ETFs conference in Hollywood
column9: Fla. ""We   could not have imagined all the innovative ways ETFs are being   used today.""Ross
column10: who was part of the team that launched SPY 24 years ago
column11: made that point as he drew a parallel between the iPhone's impact   on the technology industry and ETFs' transformation of the   investment landscape.makeArticleAd();As U.S. ETFs enter their 25th year
column12: the ETF industry is   cheering both the fact that this investment vehicle holds a total   of more than $2 trillion in assets and that ETFs represent less   than 5% of the investable market - meaning
column13: there's still plenty   of room to grow.ETFs certainly continue to be on a hot growth streak. ""ETF   assets have roughly doubled every three years over the past   decade
column14: Ross said at a conference session titled ""The ETF   Revolution And What's Next For ETFs."" He said that there is no   reason why global ETF assets cannot cross $16 trillion by 2025 at   the continued annual growth rate of 19%.Driving demand for
column15: and innovative use of
column16: ETFs are a host of   insurance companies
column17: ETF strategists
column18: sovereign wealth funds
column19: wealth management firms and even mutual funds
column20: he added.But Ross also pointed out that risks tied toETF   investinginclude a persistent lack of understanding about these   investment vehicles. In his afternoon address
column21: he sought to   debunk common myths about ETFs and offered some tips for trading   ETFs.Myth 1:""ETF liquidity (issues) could blow up the fixed-income   market."" Despite this common perception
column22: ETFs comprise less than   1% of the total fixed-income market
column23: Ross said. That makes it   unlikely they will ""blow up"" an entire market.In fact
column24: Ross believes fixed-income ETFs can be more efficient   than other fixed-income products
column25: as assets in them have   continued to increase to more than $400 billion today. And   although the underlying fixed-income market can be opaque
column26: fixed-income ETFs offer transparency in terms of trading costs   and portfolio holdings
column27: he added.Myth 2:""ETFs gone wild."" Referring to the belief that the   proliferation of ETFs can harm investors
column28: Ross said he believes   ETF issuers like his own company are diligent about making sure   new launches meet existing needs. Even a crudely constructed ETF
column29: he added
column30: displays the American value of ""take an idea to market   and test it out.""The lesson here
column31: Ross said
column32: is that ""all ETF investors need to   understand what they are buying
column33: when they are buying.""Myth 3:""ETFs fail to track intrinsic value in volatile markets.""   According to Ross
column34: ETFs have in some cases helped the process of   price discovery in challenging markets.""That happened on Aug. 24 (2015)
column35: he said. ""SPY traded   efficiently throughout the day"" despite the extreme volatility inthe stock marketthat day.Ross noted
column36: too
column37: that following that day's tradingdisruptions in some stocks and ETFs
column38: an ETF industry coalition took action to harmonize exchange   rules to address the issue.The lesson here
column39: Ross added
column40: is to understand ETF trading   basics:1. If you don't have to trade in volatile markets
column41: don't.2. Don't trade near the market open. Volatility tends to be   high as the markets price in the news.3. Use limit orders. These are generally seen to have   advantages over market orders in terms of price control and   protection.4. Reconsider the use of stop orders. As many ETF investors   unhappily discovered on Aug. 24
column42: stop orders become market orders   once the price is hit. And they run the risk of selling for much   below their intended price in serious market disruptions.A stop order is an order to buy or sell a stock once the price   of the stock reaches a specified price. A limit order is an order   to buy or sell a stock at a specified price or better.Introducing Ross to the audience
column43: Inside ETFs CEO Matt Hougan   made note of Ross' leadership role in the industry for more than   two decades.""There's a reason everyone loves him
column44: Hougan said. ""He's the   chairman of the ICI (Investment Company Institute) ETF committee.   He does education everywhere he can.""The Inside ETFs conferenceconcludes Wednesday.RELATED:The 'Trump ETFs' Spotlighted As 6 Best     Investment Ideas For 2017"
